description:
summary

apple is a place where extraordinary people gather to do their best work.

together we create products and experiences that people once couldn’t have envisioned - and now can’t imagine living without.

if you’re excited by the idea of making a real impact, and joining a team where we pride ourselves in being one of the most diverse and expansive companies in the world, a career with apple might be your dream job.

the emeia sales bpr team work closely and partner with colleagues across the business driving change and transformation across apple. this role will work as the interface between business and it data science and data engineering teams and is commonly referred to as a “citizen data scientist”,

leveraging the benefits of data science and machine learning within the tools and processes of the sales organisation we are looking for someone who is passionate about the power of data - working closely with sales and finance teams - to understand their processes and analytic needs.

we want somebody who can lead machine learning efforts from a sales perspective, partnering closely with is&t and sales finance.

you will work in a collaborative environment with minimal formal structure and should be comfortable in a changing environment with competing priorities.

you will possess proven business insight, a strong quantitative / technical background, natural curiosity, and the ability to effectively shift between communications styles based on the audience (technical peer review through leadership update).

key qualifications

innovative and strategic approach to reporting and business analytics.

superb interpersonal skills, both written and verbal - able to present complex analytics to an executive audience.

extraordinary data analytical skills, including the ability to model, interpret and present data in a way to zero in on what is most impactful.

a high level of accuracy and attention to detail, along with the ability to plan work and meet deadlines.

a propensity to unlock the potential of every relationship, through getting to know people, soliciting input and feedback from a wide variety of people.

appetite to push yourself, and others, in our quest for quality.

excellent time-management skills, the ability to work to tight goals and handle the pressure of last minute requests.

ability to translate technical content for non-technical audiences and vice-versa.

experience in eliciting business requirements and defining key sales performance and finance metrics.

experience in applying analytical techniques to provide solutions to real business problems.

strong verbal / written communication skills

creativity to go beyond current tools to deliver the best solution to the problem.

detail oriented and self-motivated individual able to function effectively when working independently or in a team.

description

partner with the key business teams to develop machine learning strategy and solutions for sales.

develop machine learning solutions to improve the speed, efficiency, and quality of decision making.

engage with business users to understand requirements and deliver tools/analytics that will support their needs.

manage project communications, implement change, and deliver training.

lead and/or participate in cross-functional teams to address business complexity issues from an analysis and process perspective and be the focal point of contact for systems escalations.

obsess over the user interface and user experience on solutions.

propose and implement new & innovative ways to enable the business to answer questions quickly

use expert analytical abilities to report on customer performance and in turn, help us to deliver an even better customer experience

develop early alert mechanisms through analytical insights in our sales data set and identify assignable actions to increase sell thru

utilise the appropriate statistical analytics techniques to find opportunities to optimise supply chain processes

champion the functions automation strategy by seeking opportunities for application of machine learning and robotic process automation techniques

education & experience

a bachelors or relevant experience .

a post-graduate qualification would be an advantage

role number: 200342392

apple media products engineering (amp) are the team behind high profile services such as the apple arcade, apple music, apple tv+ and many more. the people here at apple don’t just build products — they build the kind of wonder that’s revolutionised entire industries. it’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that encourages the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. join apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it. we are looking for a world-class scientist to research ground breaking problems in applied computational statistics, reinforcement learning and adaptive optimisation. with this advanced expertise, we want this individual to develop novel solutions to power our customer engagement and marketing automation platforms. they will have the incredible opportunity to see their solutions deployed at apple’s truly incredible global scale. read about real examples of our work at our blog: https://machinelearning.apple.com/research/interpretable-adaptive-optimization

key qualifications
• proven knowledge of statistical methods, ml/ai patterns and toolsets. this should span the spectrum of probabilistic bayesian statistical models including mcmc, unsupervised, supervised and reinforcement learning algorithms, and model performance measurement.
• we will look for evidence of knowledge of both theoretical and practical aspects of such knowledge. theoretical knowledge will constitute understanding of statistical theory and ml algorithms. practical knowledge constitutes application of these algorithms and theory to the development of actual solutions to real-world problems
• evidence of active research contributions in the scientific sphere. this primarily includes primary and senior authorship of papers in leading conferences and journals. where appropriate, we would like to see a google scholar profile.
• proven grasp of the open-source python ml/ai tech stack. includes tensorflow/pytorch/pyro, keras/theano, scikit-learn, numpy-scipy-pandas.
• advanced level of technical competence in scientific software development. we will be expecting that this will include proficiency in well-structured python software development, and optionally r. typically, we will expect to see an active github profile and history of contributions.

description

the selected candidate will join a small, expert team responsible for developing and building solutions with a focus on using anonymised data & machine automation to improve amp and services. we are seeking a research-active machine learning scientist to work with us. someone to contribute to research and development in machine learning and statistics to help drive innovation and tooling both within the team and across the organisation. this individual will contribute to r&d in key areas of growth, including modelling short and long-term patterns in user behaviour, optimising and personalising interactions with users based on data, and auto-generation of interaction content. at apple, we put user privacy first while achieving these goals. we expect the individual to take the time to develop a deep understanding of business challenges in apple services, and find data-driven solutions to apply r&d to help address these challenges. this will involve conducting exploratory r&d, and validating and improving upon existing solutions. we expect that the individual will develop novel r&d outputs in the form of papers, blog posts and code. they will work with ml and data engineers to bring their best ideas to production. they will develop metrics to generate provable evidence of the value their work brings to our customer experience. they will also actively disseminate methods, capabilities and solutions across apple and beyond.

education & experience

master’s or phd in a quantitative field, including computer science, maths, statistics, physics, etc. typically, we will also expect experience in research-active positions post-phd, in academia or industry.

additional requirements
• the following skills and experience will be an additional plus:
• 1. knowledge of data technologies including but not exclusively: apache spark, airflow, kafka, etc.
• 2. cloud computing technologies like amazon aws, s3 and emr

job description:

as part of apple’s machine learning and ai team, we transform every apple product and because we fully integrate hardware and software, we can collaborate to deliver amazing experiences while protecting user data. some people believe that in order to build insightful data analytics you need to sacrifice privacy. we see this as an opportunity to innovate. if you are passionate about privacy and analytics, we need your help!

job responsibilities:
• strong skills in object-oriented software design and programming
• proficient in one or more of python, strictly-typed oo languages e.g. java/scala and unix scripting.
• excellent problem solving, critical thinking, and communication skills
• background in differential privacy, federated learning and/or statistics
• fundamentals of systems and data engineering
• commitment to high quality, well-tested code, and automation.

job requirements/qualifications:

– work with software and research engineers to evaluate and implement algorithms for private data analytics.

– focus on driving utility for our users, with optimal algorithms, intuitive api, explainability to end-users and comprehensive documentation and experimental results.

– work on privacy-preserving model training, improve library while evaluating other industry and open source solutions e.g. tensorflow-privacy, opendp

– use distributed frameworks like apache spark to scale seamlessly in production.

– participate in code reviews and feedback with the entire team. you will share your expertise while continuously learning from colleagues.

– build features for a library, e.g. apis, backend services, ci/cd automation

summary

role number:200414940

apple media products is the team behind the app store, apple music, apple tv+, apple arcade, and many other high profile products on iphone, ipad, mac and appletv. our engineering team is looking for talented, performance-savvy, marketing operations specialists that can enable success of marketing and customer engagement programs by encouraging a close working relationship between business and engineering teams.

key qualifications
• experience in retention/lifecycle marketing (mobile marketing automation, crm operations, exposure to campaign tools, email service providers)
• solid understanding of technology (rest api responses, data types, databases)
• proven ability to build relationships and engage with cross-functional teams
• passion for learning new technologies
• experience integrating sdks of mobile marketing automation tools such as braze, localytics, swrve, sfmc. candidate will be responsible for migrating apple services onto internal marketing technology.

description

you will partner with our growth marketing organization, support their ongoing operations and be their point of contact within the engineering team. you will leverage a deep expertise of our customer engagement platform to empower our marketing teams to use our technology effectively through onboarding new teams, offering training, studying campaign requirements and making operational recommendations. you will be responsible for giving feedback to the engineering teams by carrying business context into product development prioritization meetings, capturing new requirements and providing feedback on new feature designs, raising bugs as you encounter them and helping test new functionality, providing initial enhancement suggestions. you will enjoy working in a multi-disciplinary team with engineers, data scientists, machine learning experts and ui/ux specialists. you will produce gap analysis and production support documents to improve the integration experience for new apple marketing projects. candidate will be expected to produce technical solutions architecture diagrams, engineering workflows and will be expected to work in agile-testing engineering structure. candidate will work with growth marketing organization, support their ongoing engagement and acquisition operations with past experience, and be their point of contact within the engineering team. you will debug ios applications with charles or other http proxy services. candidate will screen both apple services and internal client networking issues related to mobile marketing stack. candidate will be responsible for using internal rest apis to edit marketing campaigns as necessary.

education & experience

additional requirements
• experience of any of the following is an advantage:
• - technical account management/customer success experience
• - support engineering background
• - troubleshooting skills such as calling apis, inspecting browser network activity
• - ability to query campaign and logging data
• - experience with python or other interpreted languages, sql/pyspark

apple media products engineering are the team behind high profile services such as the apple arcade, apple music, apple tv+ and many more. we are looking for a world-class data engineer to help build the data pipelines and systems that power our customer engagement and marketing automation platforms.

the people here at apple don’t just build products — they build the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. it’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that encourages the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. join apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it.

here you have a phenomenal opportunity to help build and evolve large-scale highly-available systems, with positions currently available as we grow our amazing london team.

key qualifications

you will be joining a small team responsible for developing and building solutions with a focus on leveraging anonymised data & machine automation to improve apple media products and services. you will bring your knowledge and expertise in data engineering to develop, architect and maintain large scale reliable data & machine learning pipelines.

this is your opportunity to help engineer highly visible global-scale data products with petabytes of data, supporting hundreds of millions of users. successful candidates will have strong engineering and interpersonal skills, as well as, a belief that data driven processes lead to phenomenal products.

summary

as part of apple cloud platform, our team is responsible for building libraries and services which form the foundations of mission-critical systems at apple. as machine learning engineers we work with machine learning models, training and data pipelines from many different teams at apple, ensuring they are performant, available and optimized for the environment they will need to operate in, whether in the cloud or on device.

key qualifications

large-scale server side development experience:

expertise in library design / api evolution

practical experience training and evaluating machine learning models.

understanding of latest distributed ml training algorithms and systems.

asynchronous/streaming programming experience (e.g.reactivestreams ,dispatch ,combine,orsimilar)

swift + ios development experience.

experience in code optimisation and power/performance evaluation for modern device hardware ane,arm cpu/gpu, etc.

description

we write software in the swift and python programming languages to build services and infrastructure for machine learning; we write performance test frameworks, and run statistical analyses on different hardware deployments; we build jobs to extract transform and load data, and use machine learning platforms like tensorflow and pytorch to deliver ml training and inference. our software has a growing user base and the team is looking to expand to build amazing products making the team a truly exciting place to work.

we’re a collection of highly skilled and friendly engineers who value each other’s opinions and experience. we strive for excellence and believe strongly in the quality of our output. we have built a team of domain experts who specialise in specific core subject areas, and also have broad experience of cloud software services and platforms.

education & experience

b.s. in computer science or other numerate subject, with 6+ years experience; or m.s. in computer science or other numerate subject, with 4+ years experience

additional requirements

● quality focus - produce reliable, maintainable, deliverable software.

● comfortable diving deep-working across multiple levels of abstraction.

● good at handling relationships & communication.

● collaborate well with colleagues across a wide range of functions.

posted: sep 2, 2022

role number:200370848

apple's machine learning and ai teams transform every apple product and because we fully integrate software and hardware, we collaborate to deliver delightful experiences while protecting user data. some people believe that in order to build intelligent products using ml you need to sacrifice privacy. we see this as an opportunity to innovate. if you are passionate about privacy and machine learning, we need your help!

key qualifications
• ability and passion to deliver extraordinary results with minimal direction
• proficiency in 1 or 2 programming languages - e.g. python, java, c++
• track-record of shipping and maintaining code in production. commitment to high quality, well-tested code, automation
• experience with object-oriented design, multi-threading and synchronisation
• familiarity with ml frameworks such as pytorch, tensorflow, or keras (knowledge of internals is a big plus)
• attention to detail, demonstrated via monitoring and debugging solutions
• excellent problem solving, critical thinking, and communication skills.

description

you will be working in the privacy-preserving ml (priml) team, at apple. we are responsible for developing technologies that enable ml with strong privacy guarantee, such as private federated learning (pfl). your valuable work will contribute to industry-leading technologies, making them mainstream and accessible apple-wide to unlock more ml-powered features. as a result, you will impact the lives of millions of apple users worldwide, and fulfil our mission to uphold user privacy to a high standard. you will contribute to all aspects of the ml lifecycle - namely - engineering to build the pfl system, integrations with ml infrastructure as well as on-device frameworks, and applied ml. you will help bridge the gap between fast-evolving research and practice in federated learning and differential privacy, by incorporating algorithms into efficient implementations - with experimentation and prototyping. in this process you will collaborate with ml engineers from other product teams, helping with modelling for their use case using our framework and in turn enhance the experience of hundreds of millions of users, all while preserving their privacy. you will review designs and code by others and provide constructive feedback. you will share your expertise and mentor others, while continuously learning from colleagues. if this is you, we'd love to hear from you! education & experience

strong computer science fundamentals required - no matter how you got them.

additional requirements
• additional ("nice to have") qualifications
• comfortable driving cross-functional projects on time
• understanding federated learning algorithms, differential privacy. at minimum, collaborating to interpret and incorporate literature into viable products.
• experience in applied ml modelling, from experimentation and prototyping to deployment
• experience with distributed systems, containerized execution, low-latency

role number:200289864

apple's machine learning and ai team transform every apple product and because we fully integrate hardware and software, we can collaborate to deliver amazing experiences while protecting user data.

privacy is a fundamental human right. at apple, it’s also one of our core values. your devices are important to so many parts of your life. what you share from those experiences, and whom you share it with, should be up to you. we design apple products to be personal to you but also protect your privacy and give you control over your information. it’s not always easy. but that’s the kind of innovation we believe in.

would you like to make an impact on this scale? join siri's personalisation & private learning team and help us create amazing personalised experiences.

key qualifications

key qualifications

description

you will design and implement creative innovations that run on devices; work with machine learning engineers to evaluate and implement groundbreaking algorithms; write code that processes more than 1 billion messages a day. you will review designs and code by others and provide constructive feedback. you will share your expertise and mentor others, while continuously learning from colleagues.

proficiency in objective-c, swift or python; knowledge of nlp; familiarity with machine learning are areas of skill you will develop in this role.

based in cambridge, we work closely with teams across apple worldwide. this means occasional evening meetings with teams outside uk, and limited international travel may be required.

if this is you, we'd love to hear from you!

key qualifications

job id: jr0234549

job category: software engineering

primary location: london, liv uk

other locations:

job type: experienced hire

principal engineer, ip performance simulation lead
job description
come and join our team. intel is seeking a highly qualified candidate to join and lead an ip performance simulation and modelling team within the ip engineering group (ipg). ipg develops ips that enable the creation of intel products. as an ip performance simulation architecture lead, you will be casting a vision for ip performance simulation and leading the development and execution of ip simulation models using a cutting-edge approach that will drive our next generation ip architecture decisions. this opportunity will combine your technical knowledge of ip and soc architecture, performance model development, firmware and software as well as your leadership skills to deliver high quality ip simulation models and methodology.

qualifications
qualifications for an ideal candidate:
- must have a bachelor's degree in electrical engineering, computer systems engineering, computer science or equivalent field.
- your experience should include multiple of the following:
- soc architecture, soc subsystem architecture, ip architecture and/or microarchitecture definition
- simulation and performance modelling
- software development in systemc, c, c++ or domain specific language modeling
- workload analysis
minimum criteria:
- combined 10+ years soc or ip design/architecture, performance modelling and/or firmware development/architecture experience.
- 5+ years soc architecture, soc subsystem architecture, ip architecture and/or microarchitecture definition.
- 5+ years soc or ip-level modeling and methodology development.
inside this business group

in the design engineering group (deg), we take pride in developing the best-in-class socs, cores, and ips that power intels products. from development, to integration, validation, and manufacturing readiness, our mission is to deliver leadership products through the pursuit of moores law and groundbreaking innovations. deg is intels engineering group, supplying silicon to business units as well as other engineering teams. as a critical provider of all intel products, deg leadership has a responsibility to ensure the delivery of these products in a cost efficient and effective manner.

position of trust
this role is a position of trust. should you accept this position, you must consent to and pass an extended background investigation, which includes (subject to country law), extended education, sec sanctions, and additional criminal and civil checks. for internals, this investigation may or may not be completed prior to starting the position. for additional questions, please contact your recruiter....

work model for this role
this role is available as fully home-based and generally would require you to attend intel sites only occasionally based on business need.

ukexperienced hirejr0234549londondesign engineering group

job description

the operations research engineer will be responsible for, but to limited to : design, develop, and apply engineering, mathematical models, simulation and optimization models to drive solutions to complex manufacturing and supply chain problems.

identify and solves highly complex problems in factory performance, loading, equipment performance, decision science and, supply and distribution network problems.

understand the factory (fab and a / t) environment and supply chain knowledge to develop complex engineering models and apply them to identify and drive solutions.

build, develop, validate and apply mathematically based decision algorithms, heuristics, optimization and simulation models and tools.

work closely with the business units to identify root causes, define the strategic and tactical needs and drive the appropriate business and technical solutions.

develop solutions to problems utilizing formal technical training, business knowledge and judgment.the ideal candidate should exhibit the following behavioral traits : strong problem solving and analysis skillsability to identify root causes of problems and synthes effective practical solution approaches implementing these solutions in real-life production usagecommitted and highly motivated team player with strong communication skills

qualifications

you must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.

position not eligible for intel immigration sponsorship.

minimum qualifications

our engineering teams work closely with customers, understanding their requirements and then developing solutions to their real world problems.

the role

as a senior cyber analyst, you will be in the thick of the action, analysing technical data to identify potential cyber threats and give our clients the peace of mind that they are protected by darktrace’s suite of products. as a senior member of the team you will be responsible for helping support the analyst team by acting as a mentor. you'll be given extensive analyst training and support, which incorporates many skill areas and follows a structured pathway to allow individuals to develop continuously at their time in darktrace. this role suits candidates with strong technical background and experience of working in hands-on technical roles with knowledge of security.

requirements

• excellent communication skills, including both oral and written

forward-thinking! so bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. it’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.global covid and vaccination disclosurespotify is committed to safety and well-being of our employees, vendors and clients. we are following regional guidelines mandating vaccination and testing requirements, including those requiring vaccinations and testing for in-person roles and event attendance. for the us, we have mandated that all employees and contractors be fully vaccinated in order to work in our offices and externally with any third-parties. for all other locations, we strongly encourage our employees to get vaccinated and also follow local covid and safety protocols

accelerate your career in cloud with datatonic, an award-winning google cloud partner!

are you passionate about innovation within the data space? would you like to fastrack your career at a company that has learning & development at its core, where you'll be afforded the opportunity to work alongside some hugely talented technologists? then look no further!

the datatonic graduate program is now in its fifth year, with an excellent track record of training and equipping graduates in disciplines such as data engineer, bi analytics, data science, and ml engineering.

our october 2022 cohort will focus on the following two engineering roles:
• data science graduate - the data scientist route will provide you with the opportunity to learn and work on the most exciting data projects: product recommender systems, iot data analysis, segmenting user behavior profiles with web analytics data, geo-spatial analysis with billions of datapoints and many more, with a mandate to deliver high impact strategic outcomes for clients.
• machine learning engineer graduate - as a machine learning engineer you’ll learn how to engineer beautiful code in python and take pride in what you produce. you’ll also be trained to be an advocate of high quality engineering and best practice in production software as well as rapid prototypes.

if you're unsure which would suit you best, don't worry as we can help you determine what the most appropriate fit would be. all of the above roles are excellent entry points into the cloud data space - and have rewarding career paths with multiple options ahead!

the opportunity

the program starts with 6-weeks in our academy, where you'll be trained by some of the best google cloud trainers from around the globe. upon finishing the academy program, you'll move into your designated team at the 'associate' level, where you'll buddy up with senior colleagues who will support you on your ongoing journey! you'll learn a broad range of skills within your chosen discipline, using cutting-edge technologies to work on real client projects and innovative internal r&d projects.

your core goals:
• work with the most innovative and most scalable data processing technologies.
• build innovative state-of-the-art solutions with our customers.
• work closely with our tech partners: google cloud platform, snowflake, dbt, and others, in understanding their tech inside and out.
• work in an agile and dynamic environment together with a team of engineers, scientists, analysts, and machine learning experts.
• curiosity, a passion for tech, and a hunger to learn!
• a willingness to step outside of your comfort zone and grow - not just with tech, but also with client-facing skills including things like presales and project management.
• good knowledge of at least one programming language.
• some exposure to the handling of large, diverse, real-world data sets would be valuable.
• the ability to organise time, learn quickly and work well under pressure.
• problem-solving skills.
• strong communication skills.
• a bsc or higher in a quantitative subject such as computer science, mathematics or relevant subject (2:1 or above) is preferred - but we are open-minded!

the basics: 25 days holiday in addition to bank holidays, choice of laptop, pension scheme (rises by an extra 1% per year of service), team bonus payable annually, home equipment allowance

health & wellbeing: private healthcare insurance, working from home allowance, discounted gym membership, cycle to work and tech scheme

learning: datatonic encourages continuous learning at all levels with a generous conference budget, freedom to explore the latest tools and technologies as well as regular knowledge-sharing activities. you will get access to linux academy, coursera, and linkedin learning and a £700 conference budget

career development: a personalised development plan to ensure you hit your professional goals with a clear roadmap for progression

impact: the opportunity to work on cutting-edge ai and ml solutions spanning multiple industries and with market-leading organisations

innovation: access to datatonic labs, our research & development hub. experiment and bring forward ideas, create impactful and meaningful work in a creative and collaborative environment - even just for fun!

team vibe & social: a welcoming and friendly team plus regular monthly social events and team offsites including daily treats in the office, tasty tuesdays (paid lunch) and thirsty thursdays (team drinks)

working for datatonic

our uk headquarters is based in a tech-centric environment in the centre of canary wharf. we also have offices in stockholm and geneva and we work with clients in many other european countries. we allow for flexible working hours and the possibility of remote work.

we’re an eclectic team with lots of different interests and personalities. we have many different roles across data science, engineering, analytics, consulting, marketing, business development, and operations. as a company, we have a strong emphasis on learning and professional development. our core values are:

cultivating excellence

a hub for continuous learning, curiosity, developing ideas, testing things out - and then putting ‘excellence’ into practice.

owning it

working collaboratively in cross-functional teams to achieve customer delight. we love what we do and draw immense satisfaction from taking responsibility and seeing the results of our work.

purposeful impact

creating positive change for our customers, using the most relevant machine learning and analytics approaches and the best technologies to meet real business needs.

winning with partners & friends

our business has been built on great partnerships and open-source collaboration. it’s one thing to be successful, but to do it in partnership with great people and other great companies is even better in our opinion.

datatonic is committed to being an equal opportunities employer. diversity, equity and inclusion are a key part of our values and central to our overall mission of recruiting, retaining and promoting a diverse mix of colleagues. we encourage applications from all backgrounds, abilities and communities. if you require any accommodations or adjustments to our interview process, please reach out to jobs@datatonic.com and we will do our best to assist you

as google cloud's premier partner in ai, datatonic provides world-class businesses with cutting-edge data solutions in the cloud.

we help clients take leading technology to the limits by combining our expertise in machine learning, data engineering, and analytics. with google cloud platform as our foundation, we help businesses future-proof their solutions, deepen their understanding of consumers, increase competitive advantage and unlock operational efficiencies.

our team consists of experts in machine learning, data science, software engineering, mathematics, and design. we share a passion for data & analysis, operate at the cutting edge, and believe in a pragmatic approach to solving hard problems.

the role

as a machine learning engineer, you'll know how to engineer beautiful code in python and take pride in what you produce. you'll be an advocate of high-quality engineering and best-practice in production software as well as rapid prototypes.

whilst the position is a hands-on technical role, we'd be particularly interested to find candidates with a desire to lead projects and take an active role in leading client discussions. your responsibilities will involve building trusted relationships with prospects, finding creative ways to use machine learning to solve problems, scoping projects, and overseeing the delivery of these engagements.

to be successful, you will need strong ml & data science fundamentals and will know the right tools and approach for each ml use case. you'll be comfortable with model optimisation and deployment tools and practices. furthermore, you'll also need excellent communication and consulting skills, with the desire to meet real business needs and deliver innovative solutions using ai & cloud.

your responsibilities will include:
• taking vague requirements and translating them into models that solve real-world problems
• running machine learning experiments using a programming language with machine learning libraries.
• optimizing solutions for performance and scalability.
• implementing custom machine learning code.
• data engineering, i.e. ensuring a good data flow between database and backend systems.
• data science, i.e. analyzing data and coming up with use cases
• mlops, i.e. automating ml workflows with testing, reproducibility and metadata/feature storage; designing ml architectures on gcp
• multiple years experience as an ml engineer, ideally from a consulting background.
• this candidate should be comfortable working with python as a backend language, delivering code in well-tested ci/cd pipelines.
• familiarity with cloud environments (gcp, aws, azure).
• experience with software engineering.
• good knowledge of sql.
• knowledge of scaling up computations (gpus, distributed computing, ..).
• familiarity exposing ml components through web services or wrappers (e.g. flask in python).
• strong communication and presentation skills.

the basics: 25 days holiday in addition to bank holidays, choice of laptop, pension scheme (rises by an extra 1% per year of service), team bonus payable annually, tech scheme, home equipment allowance

health & wellbeing: private healthcare insurance, discounted gym membership, cycle to work and tech scheme

learning: datatonic encourages continuous learning at all levels with a generous conference budget, freedom to explore the latest tools and technologies as well as regular knowledge-sharing activities. you will get access to linux academy, coursera, and linkedin learning and a £700 conference budget

career development: a personalised development plan to ensure you hit your professional goals with a clear roadmap for progression

impact: the opportunity to work on cutting-edge ai and ml solutions spanning multiple industries and with market-leading organisations

innovation: access to datatonic labs, our research & development hub. experiment and bring forward ideas, create impactful and meaningful work in a creative and collaborative environment - even just for fun!

office environment: a modern office set in the innovation hub of canary wharf with complimentary fruit, cookies, tea/coffee throughout the day as well as a shared café and working space with panoramic views of london

team vibe & social: a welcoming and friendly team plus regular monthly social events and team off-sites including tasty tuesdays (paid lunch) and thirsty thursdays (team drinks).

working for datatonic

our uk headquarters is based in a tech-centric environment in the centre of canary wharf. we also have offices in stockholm and geneva and we work with clients in many other european countries. we allow for flexible working hours and the possibility of remote work.

working collaboratively in cross-functional teams to achieve customer delight. we love what we do and draw immense satisfaction from taking responsibility and seeing the results of our work.

job description

i am working with a global powerhouse who are going through a large google cloud migration project & are looking for a number of gcp experienced ml engineers.

role & responsibilities
• play a significant part in encouraging ml productionisation through the effective utilisation of the data science platform(s).
• be a senior figure in a distributed team of machine learning engineers working with the data science community across all business units.
• work closely with data scientists in the ai coe, and across customer facing units (cfus).
• help the business to realise the value from their ai initiatives through speeding up their solution delivery, ensuring that all ml artefacts are captured, and the solution is robust enough for production.
• report on progress clearly and succinctly to a wide range of colleagues, in and outside the immediate team.
• be a subject matter expert across business for mlops, with a responsibility for advising other teams to encourage the usage of ai.
• drive the high-quality and efficient deployment of multiple ml techniques across multiple products and business units.
• enable novel ml models to be productionised and scaled, with full lifecycle management (including continuous integration, delivery and training).
• assessment of ml models and frameworks to develop, adapt or buy to safely scale.
• ensure good software engineering practices in cross-functional teams in general.
• leading by example, and direct mentoring of machine learning engineering specialists.

skills & qualifications
• 5 years+ playing significant roles in mlops / data science initiatives.
• direct and recent experience of using cloud ml platforms such as google cloud platform (gcp) vertex ai, amazon web services (aws) sagemaker or microsoft azure ml studio.
• prior experience building ml pipelines and productionising ml solutions.
• experience of working directly with customers/stakeholders and as part of an agile squad.
• experience in implementing and steering good software engineering practices (devops, ci/cd, testing).
• experience with mlops on cloud platforms (kubeflow, tfx) would be desirable

benefits
• competitive salary
• 25 days annual leave (plus bank holidays)
• 10% on target bonus
• life assurance
• pension scheme
• option to join the healthcare cash plan or other benefits such as dental insurance, gym memberships etc

• develop scalable and robust data pipelines that are able to process petabytes of data for model training, and deploy models in production,

we’re public sector specialists, and our focus is building human parity performance ai products to help solve real-world problems in this often overlooked sector. our primary focus is on building the next generation of virtual assistants powered with our brand of conversational ai. these pre-trained assistants can be deployed on websites, intranets, live chat, phone, email, and social networks.

what our products do is offer an over 90% first-time resolution rate for high-volume requests, thus freeing up the client resources to focus on areas that really need that human touch. the real world impact of this? one of our local council clients, within 12 weeks of integrating our solutions, has recovered enough manpower to start tackling the homelessness crisis in their constituent area.

result.

due to an increased demand on our services and overall business growth, we’re expanding our engineering function and we’re looking for aa ai trainer to join us.

role objectives

this is the ideal role for a highly motivated self-starter to join a microsoft ai gold partner, creating ai solutions with microsoft azure technologies.

as an ai trainer you will be responsible for the development of natural language ai solutions with future opportunities in image and speech training. clients are mainly in the public sector (health, education and government). you will be expected to engage with customers’ businesses, understand them, use your experience with software development tools and possess the technical abilities to train in natural language modelling for digital assistant chatbot based solutions.

solutions are based on the latest microsoft technologies, including, microsoft azure (bot framework, cognitive services, machine learning and sql & cosmos db), office 365, microsoft power platform and microsoft teams.

your main duties
• gain a solid understanding of customer domains (health, education, government etc.)
• analyse, map and model customer topic areas into data structures
• create, modify and tune digital assistant natural language models
• perform model testing and measurement
• troubleshoot customer model performance problems
• improve the efficiency of the modelling process by using automation and scripts where possible

to be considered for this position, you should have the following skills and experience:
• strong written and verbal english communication skills
• some level of experience or demonstrable skills in an it discipline – coding/qa/infrastructure/support
• some scripting/programming experience would be advantageous
• knowledge of azure and/or ms sql server would be advantageous

about you
• ability to think like the end-user
• self-sufficient and will be able to succeed in a fast moving, start-up environment
• willing and able to learn and master new authoring tools, methodologies and processes
• attention to detail
• quality-driven
• logical thinker
• motivated by the application of ai technology
• able to take initiative in new areas of opportunity

what we can offer:

· private healthcare (vitality)

· enhanced holiday allowance (25 days + bank)

· enhanced pension (5% employer contribution)

· work from home allowance of £1200 per annum

· remote working as a default with the option to go to an office if you want to socialise

· equipment allowance for ergonomic at home set up

· flexible working in an adult, results-focused environment

machine learning and artificial intelligence engineer

are you ml and ai specialist passionate about cloud native data services, looking for a new opportunity to enhance your skill set and work on exciting projects?

the company is fast-growing, innovative and data-driven cloud expert, working with a variety of reputable clients across the uk. you will join passionate team of digital transformation experts and work with the latest technologies.

the culture is passionate, innovative, positive and data-driven. they are one of the sunday times top 100 companies to work for!

the company is microsoft gold partner and offers paid certifications and training, opportunities for career progression, healthcare, remote working, many more.

the role
• selecting features, building, and optimising classifiers using machine learning techniques
• researching , designing, deploying and developing innovative artificial intelligence/machine learning models for enterprise customers
• creating and utilising algorithms and models to mine big data stores, improve models, and clean data for uniformity and accuracy

technical skill-set
• experience in data science
• proficiency in python programming
• data mining and statistical analysis experience
• azure machine learning studio - hands on experience
• azure cognitive services - hands on experience
• azure public cloud - good knowledge
• good understanding of iaas, paas and saas services in cloud

culture
• passionate
• innovative
• diverse
• data-driven
• positive
• collaborative
• good work-life balance

benefits package
• base salary - up to £60,000 p/a
• standard pension
• healthcare
• birthday off
• paid certifications and training

other

job description:

the trueskill/truematch team in microsoft research cambridge is looking for a resident with experience in software engineering and interest in machine learning to be part of advancing the state of the art in player matchmaking systems for modern online games. in trueskill, we use probabilistic models to estimate the skills of players, and in truematch we combine reinforcement learning and decision theory to optimally place players from across the world into competitive matches. we collaborate closely with multiple microsoft studios to integrate our research in blockbuster titles like halo, gears of war, and forza and match millions of players in real time; and are exploring opportunities with the xbox organisation to understand how to bring trueskill and truematch to a billion players.

job responsibilities:
• collaborate with microsoft gaming studios to integrate trueskill and truematch in their titles, evaluate the systems on real data, ship them in production, and ensure the live deployments are stable and healthy.
• work closely in a team of ml researchers and software engineers in all stages of the development cycle of the
• trueskill and truematch systems, including ideation of new features, design, implementation, testing, etc.
• work with xbox in future partnerships relevant to trueskill and truematch.

job requirements/qualifications:
• familiarity with the microsoft development stack (.net, azure, etc.).
• good data analytical skills.
• degree in computer science, maths, physics, or a related field.
• experience with large-scale data processing systems.
• effective communication skills and ability to work in a collaborative environment.
• knowledge of probabilistic modelling or bayesian statistics.
• industry experience in software design and implementation with an established programming language, such as c#, java, c++, or python.
• interest in machine learning.
• preferred passion for gaming

“our industry does not respect tradition. it only respects innovation.”

satya nadella, microsoft ceo, 97% ceo approval rating (glassdoor)

come join us on our mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. our culture is centred on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging our teams and leaders to bring their best each day. in doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. you can help us to achieve our mission.

as a microsoft azure data & ai specialist aligned to our public sector strategic accounts, you will play a critical role in transforming their business to be fit for the future. with a focus on business outcomes & innovation you will leverage our world-leading portfolio of intelligent data solutions to drive data strategies and solutions in partnership with our customers. specific solutions could include; modern data warehousing, analytics, insights, and governance platforms, as well as ai and ml solutions.

you will leverage your knowledge of both the industry and our offerings and will actively advocate products and solutions as a thought leader to deliver positive outcomes for public sector. additionally, you will collaborate with our account management, customer success, marketing, operations, product and engineering teams to define strategic goals that impact business metrics including business growth attainment, shorter business cycles, growing market share, logo acquisition, and more. using our own world class systems and tools, you will create opportunities to drive the adoption of microsoft azure solutions, making a real difference, delivering positive impact and creating value for our customers through sustainable innovation.

“i truly believe that each of us must find meaning in our work. the best work happens when you know that it’s not just work, but something that will improve other people’s lives.”

satya nadella, microsoft ceo.

responsibilities
• contribute to our company-wide shared priority to realise our mission to ‘empower every person and organization on the planet to achieve more’ by putting the customer at the centre of everything you do & obsess about ‘making a difference’ to them.
• empower strategic customers in public sector through the unique value of the microsoft cloud.
• engage with our valued customers to understand how azure can drive transformation & innovation, using the breadth of microsoft’s world leading data & ai platform.
• act as a thought leader to define the data & ai strategy of your customers & within public sector – align this strategy to your customer’s business goals & market opportunity.
• engage with customers across the breadth of their organisation—building relationships across both technical & business roles and forming true partnerships across your customer’s c-suite.
• drive industry-defining customer success stories, highlighting business transformation initiatives that positively impact your customer’s business, including sustainability.
• show a strong desire & be intentional at seeking out the competition and following a compete strategy to win establishing microsoft further & the customers #1 transformation partner.
• your role will be focused on driving azure adoption and growing the microsoft data & ai footprint within your public sector strategic customers.

qualifications

extensive experience of:
• identifying unique and complex business challenges and solutions
• demonstrated passion and commitment for customer success
• experience of solution sales for azure data solutions or similar business applications
• selling software-as-a-service or cloud-based business applications to enterprise customers
• deploying a ‘challenger sales mindset’ - extensively using insight to teach, tailor, take control & use constructive tension to influence the outcome
• showing ‘excellence in orchestration’ of complex internal & external ecosystems consisting of internal and external resources

understanding of:
• working knowledge of microsoft’s cloud offerings or competitors’ related ecosystem
• adept at challenging perspectives with new ideas that reframes thinking about deriving value from microsoft solutions
• very strong presentation, white boarding, and negotiating skills
• technical knowledge. possess both business acumen expertise and technology knowledge to connect how customer business issues impact their it environments
• team culture & collaboration
• exercise your growth mindset by joining one of the leading technology organisations on the planet - taking advantage of microsoft’s learn it all culture
• join a company which recognises & embraces the importance of diverse views and the value of working in an inclusive working environment
• we truly embrace hybrid working and will you with the support and technology you require to support your work & home life balance
• on top of these the successful candidate with be able to provide real life experiences of how they would be able to exemplify living the microsoft culture of - customer obsessed, growth mindset, d&i, one microsoft & make a difference) and our values – respect, integrity, accountability.

over the coming decade, deep learning looks set to have a transformational impact on the natural sciences. the consequences are potentially far-reaching and could dramatically improve our ability to model and predict natural phenomena over widely varying scales of space and time. our ai4science team encompasses world experts in machine learning, computational chemistry, material science, quantum physics, molecular biology, fluid dynamics, software engineering, and other disciplines, who are working together to tackle some of the most pressing challenges in this field.

we are seeking i ntern candidates in the area of molecular modeling and dynamics for drug discovery . the successful applicant is expected to contribute to a program of research at the intersection of molecular modeling , simulations, machine learning and drug discovery. this is an exceptional opportunity to drive ambitious research in a highly collaborative , d iverse and global team of other researchers and engineers , to push the state of the art in deep learning for the natural sciences .

when submitting your application, include your cv with a list of publications and open source software contributions as an attachment .

responsibilities
• design , implement , validate and running of large - scale molecular modeling and dynamics workflows applied to drug discovery .
• contribute to a high-impac t research agenda within the context of a highly collaborative research culture.
• write robust research code to test new approaches or develop novel theoretical and practical insights .
• prepare technical papers , presentations and open-source releases of research code.

qualifications
• understanding and hands-on research experience in the modeling and setup of molecular dynamics simulations for proteins and/or protein-ligand binding , the docking and parametrization of small-molecule ligands, demonstrated for example through active research in a related phd program or equivalent research experience
• experience with computational drug discovery and machine learning
• a research program demonstrated by publications in relevant top-tier journals or conferences venues (appropriate for career stage)
• experience in running simulation s i n high-performance computing setups
• a bility to write high quality code in python , as well as familiarity with git and code reviews
• passion to see research have real-world impact on key challenges for society .
• demonstrable ability to work in an interdisciplinary collaborative environment, evidenced by effective communication of technical concepts to non-experts from different technical backgrounds.

read more about ai4science:

ai4science web site microsoft research ai4science - microsoft research

ai4science blog ai4science to empower the fifth paradigm of scientific discovery - microsoft research

position summary

the ai team at samsung research uk is looking for exceptional engineers to join the growing team in staines-upon-thames. the team undertakes projects involving the application of cutting-edge research into proof-of-concept and commercial products for samsung devices and services. the prospective candidate will have the opportunity to be part of building next generation mobile devices from samsung. the candidate will contribute to research and development of technology for on-device ai for their deployment on samsung's flagship mobile devices.

the ideal candidate will have experience and expertise in both systems (os, memory, optimizations, embedded) and also machine learning methods, algorithms, tools and frameworks. the prospective candidate will work on and grow in both directions - systems and ai. this position will require the candidate to work closely with researchers and engineers to enable and accelerate new research efforts for on-device ai.

the role is based at the samsung r&d institute in staines-upon-thames, surrey, uk. we operate a hybrid working policy of 3 days working from the office weekly and 2 days working from home if preferred.
role and responsibilities

as a machine learning engineer, you will:
• develop features and functionality across the ai stack - framework to applications
• be exposed to cutting edge ai models in various domains - speech, nlp, etc.
• actively propose and prototype novel ideas/solutions considering real-world constraints
• incorporate software engineering practices and be involved in software architecture & planning
• develop and maintain knowledge of cutting-edge tools, techniques and frameworks for ai research
• have technical responsibility for one or more significant sections of the assigned project
• translate complex functional and technical requirements into detailed design.

skills and qualifications

required skills
• masters or higher degree in computer science/engineering, electronics, or related disciplines
• professional software development experience with c/c++ (python and/or java will be a plus)
• strong computer science and engineering fundamentals (e.g., os, compiler)
• experience in either, android/embedded development, ai model/framework development (tensorflow/pytorch), or gpgpu development (opencl/cuda)
• familiarity with software engineering practices and tools such as git, ci, agile, etc.
• excellent communication, team work and a results-oriented attitude.
• proficiency in problem solving and debugging.

desirable skills
• experience working on on-device ai/ embedded ai
• experience with commercial/production ai in any domain - speech, nlp, image, recommender, etc.
• expertise and development experience with android framework (or other mobile/embedded)
• multi-processing and gpgpu programming experience on frameworks such as opencl and cuda
• expertise and development experience with ml frameworks such as tensorflow/pytorch
• experience with privacy preserving or distributed machine learning methods
• experience developing for cloud computing environments (e.g., aws or google cloud)
• familiarity with cpu and gpu hardware architectures

contract type: permanent or 6 month contract (within ir35)
job location: staines-upon-thames, surrey, uk
hybrid working: standard working week will be 3 days working from the office and 2 days working from home
employee benefits: competitive salary, annual performance bonus up to 21.5%, pension scheme with company contribution up to 8.5%, income protection, stocks & shares isa, life assurance, 25 days holiday (increasing to 30 with length of service). we also have a wide range of flexible benefits to choose from with samsung providing an allowance of £600 per year to spend on them.

position summary

samsung is the world’s leading manufacturer of digital tv products, and at sruk we are continually pushing the boundaries of technology to develop innovative and exciting features for our customers.

sruk designs and develops key components of samsung’s flat panel digital television product range. our software is deployed in products destined for european and worldwide markets. we have many years of experience with dvb broadcast systems, ip and interactive tv and on device ai technologies. we are continually looking to expand our expertise into new markets. the successful applicant will be joining an experienced and enthusiastic team with a friendly and supportive working culture.

we are looking for a talented machine learning engineer to join our team and help develop state of the art, ai based audio and speech technologies to run on samsung tvs. the technologies you create will improve the platform and user experience. you will have influence in the way that the platform continues to evolve.

at sruk we offer competitive salary and benefits packages, together with excellent opportunities for career progression and personal growth.

hybrid working: standard working week will be 3 days working from the office and 2 days working from home.

role and responsibilities

under the guidance of the project manager the job holder will be expected to:
• design and implement machine learning models for audio and speech applications that run on samsung tv devices
• modify and optimise existing models to run efficiently on samsung tv devices
• ensure that work packages meet requirements, pass quality standards and are integrated with other parts of the system
• work to a professional standard, paying due regard to safety, efficiency, cost effectiveness, time scales and the needs of the company

skills and qualifications

essential skills, knowledge and competencies:
• a bachelor’s or higher degree in electronics, physics, mathematics, computer science or related discipline. an equivalent period of industrial experience may be substituted
• excellent knowledge of machine learning and computer vision fundamentals, and deep-learning concepts such as cnns, rnns/lstms, deep reinforcement learning, multi-task learning
• a proven track record in development and deployment of on-device ai solutions on resource-constrained edge devices (including optimisation and performance improvement techniques)
• programming skills in deep learning frameworks, such as pytorch, tensorflow and caffe
• experience of real-time and/or embedded software development in c++ (on embedded linux)
• analysis and design of software modules within an embedded system. good written english skills are essential
• working in a small team, the candidate must be a team player and be flexible
• individuals suitable for the position must be enthusiastic and be prepared to develop their skill set across a diverse software environment

desirable skills, knowledge and competencies:
• familiar with developing machine learning solutions for audio and speech applications
• modern software design processes and methodologies
• linux (or other unix-like) programming experience
• version control systems, software build environments
• source code quality checking and analysis tools

job location: staines-upon-thames, surrey, uk

data science jobs

position summary

samsung electronics co., ltd. is the global leader in consumer electronics and the core components that go into them. it produces products found in every room of the home, from televisions, washing machines, ovens and microwaves to vacuum cleaners and of course, smartphones. samsung is now on a mission to embed ai within all of these devices, while also seeking to invent the next generation of consumer products that ai can enable. to accomplish this goal, in 2018, samsung established seven new ai labs around the world, selecting cambridge to be the home of one of these elite new institutions. now in its fourth year of operation, the cambridge lab performs world-class blue-sky ai research with an open and collaborative approach to science. the lab publishes its results in top scientific venues and releases open source code and datasets to facilitate engagement with the wider academic community. in service of our larger mission to samsung consumers, the cambridge lab has also been successful in transferring some of the technology developed in-house into the hands of users. through collaborations with other parts of the company, techniques and ai models developed in the lab are now used by millions of consumers world-wide on platforms such as the galaxy smartphone.current scientific interests of the cambridge lab are diverse and include the following research areas; video understanding, automl, action recognition, robotics and planning, neuro-symbolic models, meta-learning, domain adaptation, foundation models, on-device ai, unsupervised and self-supervised learning, efficient reasoning, speech recognition and audio modelling, and federated learning. about the distributed ai group one of the seven research groups at the cambridge lab is the distributed ai group. the group conducts research at the intersection of on-device and distributed ml systems, including key areas such as federated and distributed learning, on-device and edge-device collaborative inference and training, robotic ai systems and hardware accelerator design. among its strengths are the diverse backgrounds and expertise of the group’s members, spanning from pure ml and distributed systems to communications and robotics, which has led to the development of novel cross-stack ml systems and algorithms. the outcome of their research is recognized through multiple papers in top-tier international conferences / journals, patents and tech transfers.

role and responsibilities

the distributed ai group in saic cambridge is looking for a machine learning engineer to join the team and work directly with research scientists and ml engineers of diverse skill sets, supporting research efforts in the areas of embedded / distributed ml, communications and robotics. the role will be responsible for contributing to internal research tools, helping implementing / extending research ideas and / or realising research prototypes into demos and minimum viable products (mvps). as part of the group, the successful candidate will contribute to technical and system aspects of deploying embedded / distributed / mobile ml systems for cutting-edge research and real-world applications in vision and language, with the possibility of partaking in publishing academic papers and patents. moreover, there is the potential for cross-group collaborations and the ability to learn and grow inside the team.

to this direction, we are looking for a candidate with deep knowledge in system design and architecture. the candidate should have had exposure to different layers in the system stack and spherical knowledge about how ml systems operate. lastly, the successful candidate will have an analytical and rigorous approach and make design choices based on quantiative data.

skills and qualifications

essential skills required:
• experience with ml frameworks (pytorch, tensorflow, jax) and efficient ml (incl. quantisation, pruning, sparsification, etc.)
• experience with development on embedded and mobile devices (ml inference and/or training)
• experience with distributed and multi-gpu training at scale
• fluency in python, c/c++ and gnu linux
• experience in working as a member of a team

any of the following skills will also be positively considered:
• experience in real-world (distributed) system deployment and maintenance
• hands-on experience and understanding of networking stack and communication protocols (i.e. distributed inference,/training over pan/lan/wlan, software-defined radio, etc.)
• experience with practical aspects of deploying computer vision in real-world settings such as ar/vr, smart homes and robotics (e.g. camera calibration, rgb-d and/or motion tracking sensors, multi-camera ecosystems, etc.)
• experience with large-scale nlp research, including discriminative or generative tasks. this includes all steps of the pipeline, from data collection and pre-processing to large model adaptation, fine-tuning and optimisation.
• android operating system and android app development
• robot operating system (ros)

education and experience
• ms or phd in computer science / electrical engineering or equivalent experience in the industry.

the ai team at samsung research uk is looking for exceptional graphics and machine learning experts to join the development team in staines-upon-thames. the team undertakes projects involving the application of cutting-edge academic research, proof-of-concepts and commercial products for samsung devices and services. the prospective candidate will have the opportunity to be part of building the next generation of mobile devices. the candidate will contribute to the development of enhancements on android to enable the best gaming experience on samsung’s flagship mobile phone devices.

we are looking for enthusiastic engineers with a background in graphics, together with a good understanding of machine learning. a solid working knowledge of opengl es and/or vulkan, and one or more machine learning environments is important. experience with performance analysis and optimization on modern embedded platforms like android/tizen will be a plus.

opportunities to work on truly novel technologies like this are rare, so we are looking for highly motivated people with a passion to work on the world’s widest-reaching mobile platform.

the role is based at the samsung r&d institute in staines-upon-thames, surrey, uk. we operate a hybrid working policy within which a standard working week is 3 days in the office and 2 days working from home.

as a senior ai graphics engineer you will:
• identify & apply machine learning algorithms to improve gaming experience on samsung devices
• develop extensions to the android graphics framework to enable new user experiences.
• identify innovations to improve performance and reduce the power consumption for games.
• ownership of technical issues and resolving problems to ensure that quality and schedules are maintained.
• technical responsibility for one or more significant sections of the assigned project.

required skills
• bachelor or higher degree in computer science, electronics, natural science, mathematics, engineering or a related discipline.
• proficiency in c and c++ programming languages.
• expertise in computer graphics with experience in design and development of software such as opengl, opengl es, vulkan or directx.
• machine learning development skills and experience with one or more training or deployment environments (pytorch, tensorflow etc.)
• performance analysis and optimisation of real-time graphics applications.
• excellent communication, team work and a results-oriented attitude.
• proficiency in problem solving and debugging.

desirable skills
• exposure to ml techniques for image generation e.g. enhancing images, increasing image resolution.
• familiarity with cpu and gpu hardware architectures.
• performance analysis and optimisation on embedded systems, preferably mobile devices.
• knowledge of android frameworks and experience on android application development.

contract type: permanent or contract (within ir35)

job location: staines-upon-thames, surrey, uk

hybrid working: standard working week will be 3 days working from the office and 2 days working from home

employee benefits: competitive salary, annual performance bonus up to 25%, pension scheme with company contribution up to 8.5%, income protection, stocks & shares isa, life assurance, 25 days holiday (increasing to 30 with length of service). we also have a wide range of flexible benefits to choose from with samsung providing an allowance of £600 per year to spend on them

position summary

the ai team at samsung research uk is looking for exceptional research software engineers to join the growing team in staines-upon-thames. the team undertakes projects involving the application of cutting-edge research into proof-of-concept and commercial products for samsung devices and services. the prospective candidate will have the opportunity to be part of building next generation mobile devices from samsung. the candidate will contribute to software development and research of new functionalities or enhancing current pipelines on samsung’s flagship mobile devices. we encourage enthusiastic researchers and engineers with a strong academic background and expertise in development of audio, speech, nlp and vision related applications to apply. you will be poised to grow and expand your programming skills and expertise into a dynamic new set of research problems. this position will require you to work closely with researchers and engineers to enable and accelerate new research efforts for on-device ai and personalised ml.

the role is based at the samsung r&d institute in staines-upon-thames, surrey. uk. we operate a hybrid working policy within which a standard working week is 3 days working from the office and 2 days working from home.

role and responsibilities

as a research engineer, you will:
• perform software engineering and development activities including requirements analysis, design, implementation, testing, deployment, and code maintenance.
• understand and address software engineering questions that arise in research planning.
• maintain knowledge of current and future software development tools and techniques for machine learning and ai research.
• develop novel methods to improve on-device system performance and accuracy.
• develop and deploy state-of-the-art solutions for real-world large-scale ai problems with commercialization goals on samsung devices.
• have technical responsibility for one or more significant sections of the assigned research project.
• translate complex functional and technical requirements into detailed design.
• disseminate research output in top tier conferences and journals.

skills and qualifications

required skills
• phd degree in computer science/engineering, electrical engineering, mathematics, statistics, or related disciplines (an equivalent period of industrial experience may be substituted).
• research and development expertise of speech processing, language modelling and computer vision (e.g. speech recognition, nlp/nlu, semantic segmentation etc.)
• demonstrated success:
• professional software development experience with c++/ python is required.
• consistently using conventional and readable coding style.
• performing test-driven development.
• creating comprehensive and well-written documentation.
• participating in regular code reviews.
• developing and maintaining reproducible build systems.
• familiarity with software engineering practices and tools such as git, ci, agile, etc.
• knowledge of fundamentals of machine learning and deep-learning concepts such as model optimization, compression, personalisation and/or incremental learning is required.
• publications in top ml/ai conferences or journals (e.g. icml, neurips, iclr, cvpr, acl, emnlp, interspeech or similar).
• a proven track record in ai model development and deployment (on embedded devices is a plus).
• experience with programming using machine learning frameworks (strong experience in pytorch/tensorflow is a plus).
• excellent communication, team work and a results-oriented attitude.
• proficiency in problem solving and debugging.

desirable skills
• expertise in deploying ai on android.
• contribution to open source ml frameworks such as – pytorch, tensorflow, tensorflow lite, etc.

contract type: permanent

job location: staines-upon-thames, surrey, uk

hybrid working: 3 days working from the office and 2 days working from home weekly

employee benefits: competitive salary, annual performance bonus up to 25%, pension scheme with company contribution up to 8.5%, income protection, stocks & shares isa, life assurance, 25 days holiday (increasing to 30 with length of service). we also have a wide range of flexible benefits to choose from with samsung providing an allowance of £600 per year to spend on them.
