about the role

we have an exciting opportunity for a computer vision expert to join our data science team, where you will work on and deploy ground breaking products and have the opportunity to grow and improve your skills whilst working as an expert member of the team.

as a senior data scientist you will mentor and support other team members and with our career framework you can either grow as either an individual contributor or as a manager.

about the team:

at tesco, our data scientists model sophisticated and complex business problems across areas such as online, pricing, security, fulfilment, distribution, property, iot and computer vision and deploy data products at scale. the work spans across multiple areas including physical stores and warehouses, online, logistics, supply chain, marketing and clubcard, and we encourage rotation amongst the team, so they can gain expertise in different areas.

our team also spends their friday afternoons on learning and personal development. multiple academic collaborations enrich the team expertise; knowledge sharing events are regular. furthermore, we have got a great work-life balance, team days and relaxed but engaging culture!

you will be responsible for
• demonstrate your analytical mentality to find solutions to sophisticated problems, primarily focusing on computer vision solutions.
• understand difficult business problems and prototype solutions with minimal support.
• validate, document and present the modeling process and performances, as well as communicate complex solutions in a clear, understandable way to non technical stakeholders.
• promoting data science across tesco and promote tesco across the external data science community.
• use your skills in computer vision and deep learning to build proof of concepts as well production solutions, making your contribution to develop and deploy computer vision solutions across tesco’s environment.

you will need

we are looking for an ambitious individual with commercial experience working on computer vision solutions. a mix of statistics and machine learning skills are also welcome. a track record in modifying and designing advanced algorithms and applying them to large real-world data sets is fundamental.

an ideal candidate will have a scientific background with the ability to ask the right questions to technical and non technical experts, as well as answering them. a degree in computer vision subjects or in a mathematical, scientific, engineering or computer science subject area is preferable, or proven work experience.

finally, strong programming experience in python is needed

the ideal candidate will have experience of the following:
• deep learning frameworks: tensorflow and/or pytorch
• object detection models, e.g. faster-rcnn, yolo, efficientdet, nvidia models
• libraries and tools: opencv, scikit-image, scipy, pandas, docker, git
• knowledge of image processing, and video technology
• object tracking (optional)
• real-time video processing (optional)

about us

our vision at tesco is to become every customer’s favourite way to shop, whether they are at home or out on the move. our core purpose is “serving our customers, communities and planet a little better every day”. serving means more than a transactional relationship with our customers. it means acting as a responsible and sustainable business for all stakeholders, for the communities we are part of, and for the planet.

we are proud to have an inclusive culture at tesco where everyone truly feels able to be themselves. at tesco, we not only celebrate diversity, but recognise the value and opportunity it brings. we’re committed to creating a workplace where differences are valued, and make sure that all colleagues are given the same opportunities. we’re a big business with diverse working patterns and many business areas which means that we can find something that works for you. everyone is welcome at tesco.

we have recently announced that we are moving to a more blended working week – combining office and remote working. our offices continue to be where we connect, collaborate and innovate. talk to us about how this can work for you.

note: should you be successful in your application, your employment will be subject to and conditional upon you providing your bank account details on your agreed start date.

what’s in it for you

we offer excellent benefits that help make tesco a great place to work! these include but are not limited to:
• annual bonus scheme - up to 20%
• holiday starting at 25 days plus a personal day (and bank holidays)
• great colleague discounts and deals, saving you money on everyday purchases, utility bills for the home and more
• retirement savings plan – save between 4% and 7.5% and tesco will match your contribution
• buy as you earn and save as you earn share schemes
• opportunities to get on – take advantage of our ongoing learning opportunities and award-winning training to help you achieve the career you want

about the role

at tesco, our data science team focuses on modelling complex business problems and deploying data products at scale. our work spans across multiple areas including physical stores, online, supply chain, marketing and clubcard, where we encourage rotation amongst our data scientists so they can gain expertise in different subjects.

we work on several domains and problem types: forecasting, online, pricing, security, fulfilment, distribution, property, iot and computer vision are just some. our team members are encouraged to allocate working hours for learning and personal development every week and are provided with multiple learning resources and tools. multiple academic collaborations enrich the team expertise; knowledge-sharing events are regular.

furthermore, we have got a great work-life balance, team days and relaxed but engaging culture.

as a senior data scientist you will mentor and support other team members and with our career framework you can either grow as either an individual contributor or as a manager.

you will be responsible for

this is a hands-on position where you will need to leverage your analytical mindset to find solutions to complex problems. as a data scientist, you will need to understand difficult business problems and prototype solutions with minimal support. apply, modify and design algorithms and mathematical models to solve business problems on top of big data architectures (hadoop, spark) is a core component of the role. our data scientists will need to be able to validate, document and present the modeling process and performances, as well as communicate complex solutions in a clear, understandable way to non-experts. data scientists are also responsible for promoting data science across tesco and promote tesco across the external data science community.

you will need

we are looking for ambitious individuals with a mix of statistics, programming and machine learning skills. the role requires that you have an extensive background in machine learning and data mining. a track record in modifying and designing advanced algorithms and applying them to large data sets is essential.

an ideal candidate will have a scientific mentality with the ability to ask the right questions, as well as answer them. a strong numerical higher degree in a mathematical, scientific, engineering or computer science discipline is preferable, as well as a solid understanding of mathematics and statistical principles.

experience in one or more of the following fields is required: predictive modelling, operational research, deep learning and time series modelling. finally, strong programming experience (python is preferred).

what's in it for you

we offer excellent benefits that help make tesco a great place to work! these include but are not limited to:
• annual bonus scheme
• holiday starting at 25 days plus a personal day (and bank holidays)
• great colleague discounts and deals, saving you money on everyday purchases, utility bills for the home and more
• retirement savings plan - save between 4% and 7.5% and tesco will match your contribution
• buy as you earn and save as you earn share schemes
• opportunities to get on - take advantage of our ongoing learning opportunities and award-winning training to help you achieve the career you want

job description

as an engineering manager – machine learning at asos, your primary responsibility is to the people you manage ensuring they grow as engineers, assisting them in their personal and professional development and of course ensuring they are having a great time at asos. you will be carrying out line management responsibilities for several engineers across multiple teams including catch ups, reviews and personal development planning.

as you will be interacting with engineers across different teams, you will be expected to look out for common themes or problems, that when addressed would make asos a better place for engineers to work or improve the efficiency of delivery. you will then work closely with your engineering manager and data science manager peers to deliver cross-team changes as part of the platform or community delivery plans. in this highly collaborative role you will need to work closely with your engineers and others, whether that’s within the delivery teams, the coaching and competency crew, wider technology department or asos-wide teams such as our people experience teams.

what you will be doing:
• reporting into the platform lead for ai & data science, you will be line managing a team of 12-18 engineers, setting objectives, and creating suitable personal development plans.
• through mentoring and coaching, ensuring engineers and teams are high-performing, consistently, and iteratively delivering high-impact, high quality work.
• continuously assess your team’s approach and process maturity (with suitable techniques and metrics), and coach them to adopt and adapt agile methods for successful and sustainable delivery.
• partner with leaders across asos to share your knowledge and drive organisational change and improvement.
• identify trends and concerns amongst engineers and engineering teams and directly address.
• help attract and recruit the best engineering talent.
• what success looks like: build a high performing, diverse group of engineers who have the technical, personal skills and knowledge to deliver the business priorities whilst having fun.
• engineers have clear career goals and development plans that are being actively used and empower them in their growth.
• strong relationships and partnership with engineers, engineering managers, coaches, platform leads and leadership to enable you to enact broader technology changes to better asos.
• use your experience to appreciate delivery plans and drive greater efficiencies within the delivery teams

company description

we're asos. we blend our flair for fashion with our love of cutting- edge technology, but more importantly were interested in how we can bring the best out of you.

we exist to give people the confidence to be whoever they want to be, and that goes for our people too. at asos, you're free to be your true self without judgment, and channel your creativity into a platform used by millions.

job description

we believe fashion can make you look, feel and be your best and, with technology in our dna, we deliver the latest trends to our digital-obsessed 20-something market. our award winning tech teams sit at the heart of our business. we deliver technical innovation and pioneer incredible solutions, which are crucial to our continued success. we're extremely ambitious and thrive on the individuality of our amazing employees. our values encompass everything needed for our tech people to be the thought leaders of tomorrow.

we are looking for senior machine learning engineers to join our team and play a key role in helping asos provide the best shopping experience to our millions of customers. the role offers broad exposure to asos, requiring close collaboration with retail, marketing and technology divisions. you will be part of a highly innovative ai platform working alongside big data engineers and machine learning scientists to solve and productionise interesting and difficult problems and leveraging cutting edge technology. at asos, as an online only retailer, we have unique datasets - transactions and click streams for millions of customers and photos, videos, and text descriptions of hundreds of thousands of products.

the ideal candidate will have a strong technical background and experience solving tough problems with large datasets. you will be a highly intelligent self-starter, able to work independently with a strong attention to detail.

what you'll be doing:
• building and improving internal and external facing data products as part of a cross-functional team
• driving the implementation and scale-up of algorithms for measurable impact across the business
• deploying batch/online machine learning models at the scale that asos operates
• creating the tools, frameworks and infrastructure that enables the acceleration of our ml products delivery and optimisation of our operations
• taking an active part in our ai platform to establish ml ops standards and drive quality across our estate

qualifications

we'd love to meet someone with...
• an advanced degree in computer science, machine learning or similar
• hands-on experience in implementing, deploying and maintaining machine learning models and api's at scale using python, scala, .net or similar languages
• comfortable working with at least one machine learning framework (tensorflow, pytorch, xgboost, scikit-learn, etc)
• experience accessing and combining data from multiple sources and building data pipelines in a cloud environment - in particular large-scale data computation technologies like apache spark
• strong understanding of software development lifecycles and engineering practices (data pipelines, api workflows, ci/cd, containerisation, observability and security) -specifically ml ops principles, techniques and tooling
• non-technical
• experience of working in an agile (preferably scrum) environment
• experience of working with alm improvement
• excellent communication, influencing and collaboration skills
• experience in coaching and mentoring more junior engineers
• methodical in problem solving
• the ability to work collaboratively and proactively in a fast-paced environment alongside both scientists, engineers and non-technical stakeholders
• an understanding of the retail, marketing, and/or ecommerce industry is a plus

additional information

what's in it for you?
• competitive salary, pension, and private medical care scheme
• performance related bonus
• flex benefits allowance - which you can chose to take as extra cash, or use towards other benefits
• 25 days paid annual leave + an extra day for your birthday
• employee discount (hello asos discount!)
• tech develops - our internal tech focussed skills development programme to focus on your personal growth as a technologist
• opportunity to represent asos at industry leading events
• opportunity to help shape and drive our de&i initiatives in tech (like our wit movement and diversity mentoring in tech)
• opportunity to make an impact from day one and work with the latest in cutting edge of technology

we want our people to be whoever they want to be. that’s why we’re committed to creating a truly inclusive culture at asos, but how’re we doing it?

through our fashion with integrity strategy we are driving diversity, equity and inclusion across every aspect of asos and ensuring every asoser can be their authentic self at work. we want our people to be whoever they want to be, because we believe people who bring their best selves to work, do their best work.

we’re proud members of inclusive companies, are disability confident committed and have signed the business in the community race at work charter. we’ve also recently been placed 8th in the inclusive top 50 companies employer list too.

there are safe space employee networks and we host a monthly dei events series to help support and celebrate all of our people. we are constantly listening to our people, evolving, changing and taking a flexible approach to how we make asos truly inclusive

machine learning scientist - deep learning
job description
asos is one of the uk's top fashion and beauty destinations, expanding globally at a rapid pace. our values are to be authentic, brave and creative, and we live and breathe these in everything we do.
digital experience at asos is all about finding new ways to improve our customers' shopping experiences. thinking about what our customers really want from their shopping experience keeps the user experience team awake at night (well, busy in the day!). their job is to create the most usable and engaging experience possible. our digital analytics team spend their days understanding where our users come from and what they do when they're on the site. we want to know how they find us, the devices they use, how they interact with the site, and how successful we are at converting them into customers.
about the role
as a machine learning scientist, you will be part of a cross-functional team focused on our digital experience (such as personalisation, search or ranking). we passionately believe that cross-functional working is the key to any successful machine learning production system. the whole team is responsible for the end-to-end system, and we are all accountable for making sure it performs in production.
you will be focused on framing digital experience problems as machine learning problems using multiple rich sources (image, text) and large volume sources (clickstream). you will help build models using deep learning frameworks that can be served at scale using large volumes of data and big data technologies.
you will participate in conducting large-scale experiments to test hypotheses and drive product development. you will keep up to date with relevant state-of-the-art research by attending and publishing at top conferences as well as taking part and leading reading groups alongside other scientists,
at asos, as an online only retailer, we have unique datasets -transactions and click streams for millions of customers and photos, videos, and text descriptions of hundreds of thousands of products.
qualifications
about you
you have a background in machine learning and previous experience applying state of the art deep learning and machine learning methods to solve complex problems either in academia or industry.you have a broad understanding of machine learning theory and in-depth knowledge of deep learning. you are comfortable exploring and defining the problem and choosing the appropriate machine learning technique to solve it.you thrive in cross-functional teams, including scientists, engineers, and non-technical stakeholders. you are approachable, collaborative and you actively nurture a diverse and inclusive workplace.you are comfortable working in python software stacks and familiar with at least one deep learning frameworks (such as tensorflow/keras and pytorch) and enjoy going from ideas and prototypes into products and applications. you have experience working with data from multiple sources, involving complex/high - dimensional data (e.g. image, clickstreams, text, video, speech, time series).we would love to meet someone who has authored publications in top-tier machine learning conferences or journals (such as neurips, iclr, icml, kdd, cvpr, iccv, eccv, acl, emnlp) and want to keep up to date with the state of the art.you like to learn from others as well as mentor. you enjoy working and collaborating with other scientists to solve complex problems. you actively innovate, encouraging innovation within your team and you are not afraid to take risks to deliver maximum impact. you have effective communication skills and can facilitate discussions across teams and with business stakeholders. you are excellent at explaining complex data science concepts to non-technical audiences.
additional information
what's in it for you?
competitive salary, pension, and private medical care schemeperformance related bonusflex benefits allowance - which you can chose to take as extra cash, or use towards other benefits25 days paid annual leave + an extra day for your birthdayemployee discount (hello asos discount!)tech develops - our internal tech focussed skills development programme to focus on your personal growth as a technologistopportunity to represent asos at industry leading eventsopportunity to help shape and drive our de&i initiatives in tech (like our wit movement and diversity mentoring in tech)opportunity to make an impact from day one and work with the latest in cutting edge of technology

job description

as a lead machine learning scientist for search & recommender systems, you partner with product management and with key stakeholders, to identify opportunities and define the scientific direction for our recommendations and search ranking algorithms. you have strong commercial acumen as well as a passion for scientific research. this is a hands-on role as well as a leadership role.

you lead across multiple cross-functional teams which are focussed on using machine learning to personalise product discovery across our website and mobile apps, with the goal of improving the customer experience and increasing revenue and profit for the business. we passionately believe that cross-functional working is the key to any successful ml production system. the whole team is responsible for the end-to-end system, and we are all accountable for making sure it performs in production, at the scale at which asos operates.

your team will be setting up and conducting large-scale experiments to test hypotheses and drive product development, and you will be expected to both conduct these yourself, as well as mentor those in your team conducting these. as a lead, you will need to keep up to date with relevant state-of-the-art research, taking part and leading reading groups alongside other scientists, with the opportunity to publish novel prototypes for the business at top research conferences.

at asos, as an online only retailer, we have unique datasets -transactions and click streams for millions of customers and photos, videos, and text descriptions of hundreds of thousands of products.
qualifications

about you
• you are a highly experienced machine learning scientist, with extensive experience in recommender and search ranking systems that personalise the experience for customers. you have deep expertise in deep learning, and in machine learning frameworks such as tensorflow and pytorch. you have a strong engineering mindset and good knowledge of software engineering principles, agile methodologies, data engineering, distributed systems and machine learning at scale.
• you have a broad and deep understanding of machine learning theory and data science. you are adept at exploring and defining the problem space and building ml models, choosing the appropriate ml technique for the problem, and defining well thought-out pragmatic solutions.
• you thrive in supporting a cross-functional team, including scientists, engineers, and non-technical stakeholders. you are approachable, collaborative and you actively nurture a diverse and inclusive workplace. you have excellent leadership and interpersonal skills, and love to mentor across your teams in an open, respectful, flexible, empathic manner and you foster a culture of feedback. you are confident working and collaborating with other scientists, as well as understanding how to partner on research and solve complex problems.
• you are an individual that is experienced working in a cloud native python software stack and enjoys building production ready ml applications. you have experience working with data from multiple sources, involving complex/high-dimensional data (e.g. image, clickstreams, text, video, speech, time series). you'll be able to support a team through the machine learning development lifecycle, establishing excellent engineering and ml ops practices, and delivering impact through online experimentation.
• you actively innovate, nurture & encourage innovation within your team and you are not afraid to take calculated risks to deliver maximum impact. you have effective communication skills and can facilitate discussions across teams and with business stakeholders. you excel at explaining complex data science concepts to non-technical audiences.
• you will have a proven track record of delivering recommender/search ranking products that impact business performance. you get satisfaction from seeing your algorithms shipped and driving measurable impact to the business.

additional information

what's in it for you?
• competitive salary, pension, and private medical care scheme
• performance related bonus
• flex benefits allowance - which you can chose to take as extra cash, or use towards other benefits
• 25 days paid annual leave + an extra day for your birthday
• employee discount (hello asos discount!)
• tech develops - our internal tech focussed skills development programme to focus on your personal growth as a technologist
• opportunity to represent asos at industry leading events
• opportunity to help shape and drive our de&i initiatives in tech (like our wit movement and diversity mentoring in tech)
• opportunity to make an impact from day one and work with the latest in cutting edge of technology

we are looking for senior machine learning engineers to join our team and play a key role in helping asos provide the best shopping experience to our millions of customers. the role offers broad exposure to asos, requiring close collaboration with retail, marketing and technology divisions. you will be part of a highly innovative ai platform working alongside big data engineers and machine learning scientists to solve and productionise interesting and difficult problems and leveraging cutting edge technology. at asos, as an online only retailer, we have unique datasets - transactions and click streams for millions of customers and photos, videos, and text descriptions of hundreds of thousands of products.

the ideal candidate will have a strong technical background and experience solving tough problems with large datasets. you will be a highly intelligent self-starter, able to work independently with a strong attention to detail.

what you'll be doing:
• building and improving internal and external facing data products as part of a cross-functional team
• driving the implementation and scale-up of algorithms for measurable impact across the business
• deploying batch/online machine learning models at the scale that asos operates
• creating the tools, frameworks and infrastructure that enables the acceleration of our ml products delivery and optimisation of our operations
• taking an active part in our ai platform to establish ml ops standards and drive quality across our estate

#li-lc3
qualifications

we'd love to meet someone with...
• an advanced degree in computer science, machine learning or similar
• hands-on experience in implementing, deploying and maintaining machine learning models and api's at scale using python, scala, .net or similar languages
• comfortable working with at least one machine learning framework (tensorflow, pytorch, xgboost, scikit-learn, etc)
• experience accessing and combining data from multiple sources and building data pipelines in a cloud environment - in particular large-scale data computation technologies like apache spark
• strong understanding of software development lifecycles and engineering practices (data pipelines, api workflows, ci/cd, containerisation, observability and security) -specifically ml ops principles, techniques and tooling
• non-technical
• experience of working in an agile (preferably scrum) environment
• experience of working with alm improvement
• excellent communication, influencing and collaboration skills
• experience in coaching and mentoring more junior engineers
• methodical in problem solving
• the ability to work collaboratively and proactively in a fast-paced environment alongside both scientists, engineers and non-technical stakeholders
• an understanding of the retail, marketing, and/or ecommerce industry is a plus

additional information

what's in it for you?
• competitive salary, pension, and private medical care scheme
• performance related bonus
• flex benefits allowance - which you can chose to take as extra cash, or use towards other benefits
• 25 days paid annual leave + an extra day for your birthday
• employee discount (hello asos discount!)
• tech develops - our internal tech focussed skills development programme to focus on your personal growth as a technologist
• opportunity to represent asos at industry leading events
• opportunity to help shape and drive our de&i initiatives in tech (like our wit movement and diversity mentoring in tech)
• opportunity to make an impact from day one and work with the latest in cutting edge of technology

job description

as a lead machine learning scientist for search & recommender systems, you partner with product management and with key stakeholders, to identify opportunities and define the scientific direction for our recommendations and search ranking algorithms. you have strong commercial acumen as well as a passion for scientific research. this is a hands-on role as well as a leadership role.

you lead across multiple cross-functional teams which are focussed on using machine learning to personalise product discovery across our website and mobile apps, with the goal of improving the customer experience and increasing revenue and profit for the business. we passionately believe that cross-functional working is the key to any successful ml production system. the whole team is responsible for the end-to-end system, and we are all accountable for making sure it performs in production, at the scale at which asos operates.

your team will be setting up and conducting large-scale experiments to test hypotheses and drive product development, and you will be expected to both conduct these yourself, as well as mentor those in your team conducting these. as a lead, you will need to keep up to date with relevant state-of-the-art research, taking part and leading reading groups alongside other scientists, with the opportunity to publish novel prototypes for the business at top research conferences.

at asos, as an online only retailer, we have unique datasets -transactions and click streams for millions of customers and photos, videos, and text descriptions of hundreds of thousands of products.

about you

qualifications
• you are a highly experienced machine learning scientist, with extensive experience in recommender and search ranking systems that personalise the experience for customers. you have deep expertise in deep learning, and in machine learning frameworks such as tensorflow and pytorch. you have a strong engineering mindset and good knowledge of software engineering principles, agile methodologies, data engineering, distributed systems and machine learning at scale.
• you have a broad and deep understanding of machine learning theory and data science. you are adept at exploring and defining the problem space and building ml models, choosing the appropriate ml technique for the problem, and defining well thought-out pragmatic solutions.
• you thrive in supporting a cross-functional team, including scientists, engineers, and non-technical stakeholders. you are approachable, collaborative and you actively nurture a diverse and inclusive workplace. you have excellent leadership and interpersonal skills, and love to mentor across your teams in an open, respectful, flexible, empathic manner and you foster a culture of feedback. you are confident working and collaborating with other scientists, as well as understanding how to partner on research and solve complex problems.
• you are an individual that is experienced working in a cloud native python software stack and enjoys building production ready ml applications. you have experience working with data from multiple sources, involving complex/high-dimensional data (e.g. image, clickstreams, text, video, speech, time series). you'll be able to support a team through the machine learning development lifecycle, establishing excellent engineering and ml ops practices, and delivering impact through online experimentation.
• you actively innovate, nurture & encourage innovation within your team and you are not afraid to take calculated risks to deliver maximum impact. you have effective communication skills and can facilitate discussions across teams and with business stakeholders. you excel at explaining complex data science concepts to non-technical audiences.
• you will have a proven track record of delivering recommender/search ranking products that impact business performance. you get satisfaction from seeing your algorithms shipped and driving measurable impact to the business.

additional information

what's in it for you?
• competitive salary, pension, and private medical care scheme
• performance related bonus
• flex benefits allowance - which you can chose to take as extra cash, or use towards other benefits
• 25 days paid annual leave + an extra day for your birthday
• employee discount (hello asos discount!)
• tech develops - our internal tech focussed skills development programme to focus on your personal growth as a technologist
• opportunity to represent asos at industry leading events
• opportunity to help shape and drive our de&i initiatives in tech (like our wit movement and diversity mentoring in tech)
• opportunity to make an impact from day one and work with the latest in cutting edge of technology

as a machine learning product manager, you will articulate the vision for the team in line with the company ai strategy, establish roadmaps for delivery and define key kpis for measuring success. you will engage actively with key stakeholders and develop an expert understanding of their problems, challenges, and product opportunities. you will also assess the potential value of new initiatives and prioritise them in line with the platform objectives and key results.

you will collaborate with machine learning scientists, engineers, and architects to translate business problems into machine learning problems, as well as playing an active role in the delivery of data product from hypothesis to implementation and communication.

you will be part of a wider product manager community, consisting of over 30 product managers. you will be invited to community events, knowledge shares and meet-ups, all to support your product manager development journey, ensuring you can be the absolute best version of yourself at asos.

at asos, as an online only retailer, we have unique datasets - transactions and click streams for millions of customers and photos, videos, and text descriptions of hundreds of thousands of products.

about you

qualifications
• you are an individual with a strong problem-solving mindset, doing what it takes to solve the problem for the customer, internal or external. you have excellent communication skills, you're a good listener and you're able to adapt approach based on whom you're interacting with.
• you have prior work experience in one or more e-commerce problem space (customer experience, digital marketing, pricing, supply chain optimisation, customer care optimisation) and a good understanding of retail processes.
• you thrive in leading a cross-functional team, including scientists, engineers, and non-technical stakeholders. you are approachable, collaborative and you actively nurture a diverse and inclusive workplace. you're able to make decisions weighing different points of view focusing on the team goal.
• you have a keen interest in data and a broad understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, as well as the fundamentals of statistics and experimentation frameworks.
• ideally you have experience managing an internal or customer-facing product from conception to go live through all stages of the development lifecycle. you can gather and prioritise business requirements and translate these into user stories and an actionable backlog.

job description

asos is one of the uk's top fashion and beauty destinations, expanding globally at a rapid pace. our values are to be authentic, brave and creative, and we live and breathe these in everything we do.

digital experience at asos is all about finding new ways to improve our customers' shopping experiences. thinking about what our customers really want from their shopping experience keeps the user experience team awake at night (well, busy in the day!). their job is to create the most usable and engaging experience possible. our digital analytics team spend their days understanding where our users come from and what they do when they're on the site. we want to know how they find us, the devices they use, how they interact with the site, and how successful we are at converting them into customers.

about the role

as a machine learning scientist, you will be part of a cross-functional team focused on our digital experience (such as personalisation, search or ranking). we passionately believe that cross-functional working is the key to any successful machine learning production system. the whole team is responsible for the end-to-end system, and we are all accountable for making sure it performs in production.

you will be focused on framing digital experience problems as machine learning problems using multiple rich sources (image, text) and large volume sources (clickstream). you will help build models using deep learning frameworks that can be served at scale using large volumes of data and big data technologies.

you will participate in conducting large-scale experiments to test hypotheses and drive product development. you will keep up to date with relevant state-of-the-art research by attending and publishing at top conferences as well as taking part and leading reading groups alongside other scientists,

at asos, as an online only retailer, we have unique datasets -transactions and click streams for millions of customers and photos, videos, and text descriptions of hundreds of thousands of products.
qualifications

about you
• you have a background in machine learning and previous experience applying state of the art deep learning and machine learning methods to solve complex problems either in academia or industry.
• you have a broad understanding of machine learning theory and in-depth knowledge of deep learning. you are comfortable exploring and defining the problem and choosing the appropriate machine learning technique to solve it.
• you thrive in cross-functional teams, including scientists, engineers, and non-technical stakeholders. you are approachable, collaborative and you actively nurture a diverse and inclusive workplace.
• you are comfortable working in python software stacks and familiar with at least one deep learning frameworks (such as tensorflow/keras and pytorch) and enjoy going from ideas and prototypes into products and applications. you have experience working with data from multiple sources, involving complex/high - dimensional data (e.g. image, clickstreams, text, video, speech, time series).
• we would love to meet someone who has authored publications in top-tier machine learning conferences or journals (such as neurips, iclr, icml, kdd, cvpr, iccv, eccv, acl, emnlp) and want to keep up to date with the state of the art.
• you like to learn from others as well as mentor. you enjoy working and collaborating with other scientists to solve complex problems. you actively innovate, encouraging innovation within your team and you are not afraid to take risks to deliver maximum impact. you have effective communication skills and can facilitate discussions across teams and with business stakeholders. you are excellent at explaining complex data science concepts to non-technical audiences.

additional information

what's in it for you?
• competitive salary, pension, and private medical care scheme
• performance related bonus
• flex benefits allowance - which you can chose to take as extra cash, or use towards other benefits
• 25 days paid annual leave + an extra day for your birthday
• employee discount (hello asos discount!)
• tech develops - our internal tech focussed skills development programme to focus on your personal growth as a technologist
• opportunity to represent asos at industry leading events
• opportunity to help shape and drive our de&i initiatives in tech (like our wit movement and diversity mentoring in tech)

job description

as an engineering manager – machine learning at asos, your primary responsibility is to the people you manage ensuring they grow as engineers, assisting them in their personal and professional development and of course ensuring they are having a great time at asos. you will be carrying out line management responsibilities for several engineers across multiple teams including catch ups, reviews and personal development planning.

as you will be interacting with engineers across different teams, you will be expected to look out for common themes or problems, that when addressed would make asos a better place for engineers to work or improve the efficiency of delivery. you will then work closely with your engineering manager and data science manager peers to deliver cross-team changes as part of the platform or community delivery plans. in this highly collaborative role you will need to work closely with your engineers and others, whether that’s within the delivery teams, the coaching and competency crew, wider technology department or asos-wide teams such as our people experience teams.

what you will be doing:
• reporting into the platform lead for ai & data science, you will be line managing a team of 12-18 engineers, setting objectives, and creating suitable personal development plans.
• through mentoring and coaching, ensuring engineers and teams are high-performing, consistently, and iteratively delivering high-impact, high quality work.
• continuously assess your team’s approach and process maturity (with suitable techniques and metrics), and coach them to adopt and adapt agile methods for successful and sustainable delivery.
• partner with leaders across asos to share your knowledge and drive organisational change and improvement.
• identify trends and concerns amongst engineers and engineering teams and directly address.
• help attract and recruit the best engineering talent.
• what success looks like: build a high performing, diverse group of engineers who have the technical, personal skills and knowledge to deliver the business priorities whilst having fun.
• engineers have clear career goals and development plans that are being actively used and empower them in their growth.
• strong relationships and partnership with engineers, engineering managers, coaches, platform leads and leadership to enable you to enact broader technology changes to better asos.
• use your experience to appreciate delivery plans and drive greater efficiencies within the delivery teams.

qualifications
• strong passion for guiding, managing and coaching engineers.
• demonstrable comprehension in the fundamentals of software engineering, data engineering and machine learning engineering
• knowledge and understanding of agile methodologies and frameworks.
• skills to build lasting relationships with stakeholders.
• experience as agile delivery manager, engineering manager, development manager or scrummaster on a data science or machine learning team.
• familiarity in using data to help inform on decision making, influence people and create meaningful change, but the confidence to use your intuition to make quick decisions.

additional information

• competitive salary, pension, and private medical care scheme
• performance related bonus
• flex benefits allowance - which you can chose to take as extra cash, or use towards other benefits
• 25 days paid annual leave + an extra day for your birthday

it support analyst / apple specialist

if you have expert knowledge of apple products, this role could be for you.

we are looking for an enthusiastic, analytical problem solver to join our small, dynamic team as an it support analyst.

your primary responsibility will be to provide frontline it support to the team, and to work closely with our outsourced it service provider to ensure that help desk requests are logged and resolved promptly.

in addition, you will be responsible for maintaining our apple mac estate to ensure devices remain patch current and managing the it lifecycle process, including procurement and disposal.

the role

you will act as a focal point for all internal it support requests and, where possible, provide first contact resolution to the reported issue

where necessary, you will log it support tickets with our outsourced it service provider, and monitor their resolution

you will interact with our microsoft azure active directory and office 365 tenant to action first line support requests, such as the creation and deletion of user accounts, management of sharepoint sites and mailbox administration

you will monitor the status of patching (macos and third-party applications) across the laptop estate, and where necessary implement corrective actions to ensure that the devices remain up to date

you'll also ensure that all laptops remain conformant with our security policy, e.g

malware protection, disk encryption, host firewall controls etc.

you will manage the creation and deletion of user accounts for new starters and leavers

you will execute our it lifecycle process, i.e

the procurement and secure disposal of devices, along with maintaining the it asset register.

about you

domain knowledge/expertise

3+ years working in an it service desk / support role

experienced in troubleshooting and problem-solving

practical experience with the following microsoft products.

microsoft 365 defender

microsoft office

microsoft endpoint manager admin centre (intune)

azure active directory

apple macos configuration, troubleshooting and support.

desirable qualifications

apple certified support professional (acsp)

comptia a+

microsoft 365 certified.

fundamentals

this role will be a hybrid arrangement based out in our bath office - 1 or 2 days a week in office.

summary

we are seeking a world-class data engineer to join the data engineering team within apple media products. amp (home to apple music, app store, itunes and other services that millions of customers use every single day) has some of the most compelling data in the world.

we are looking for a talented engineer who is motivated by meaningful problems and well versed with big data technologies. this is a rare opportunity to join a focused team and work collaboratively with other groups to make a significant impact.

key qualifications

languages: java or scala

working knowledge on the following distributed data processing platforms: spark, hadoop

great if you also know: kafka, java map reduce, python

algorithms: you will be working on crafting new algorithms to process large scale data efficiently.

we expect you to know: basic computer science algorithms, data structures and distributed algorithms to process and mine data

great, but not required, if you also know about how to develop: graph, data classification and clustering algorithms in distributed environment

good debugging, critical thinking, and communication skills

knowledge in engineering machine learning, feature engineering systems is a plus.

able to capture cross-functional requirements and translate them into practical engineering tasks

bonus points for experience in the music space

3+ years of programming experience

description

as a member of the data engineering team, you will have significant responsibility and influence in crafting its future direction. this role is inherently cross-functional and the ideal candidate will work across disciplines. we are looking for someone with a love for data and ability to iterate quickly on all stages of data pipeline. this position involves working on a small team to develop large scale data pipelines and analytical solutions using bigdata technologies. successful candidates will have strong engineering skills and communication, as well as, a belief that data driven processes lead to phenomenal products. you will need to have a real passion for quality and an ability to understand complex systems. if this sounds like you, then we would love to hear from you.

education & experience

bachelors or masters degree in computer science, mathematics, or meaningful industry experience preferred

additional requirements

about the role

this role will be an integral part of lockheed martin’s computer incident response team (lm-cirt) and will work in the global defense and intelligence mission area. this role is responsible for defending the enterprise against network intrusion activity originating from criminal and nation state adversaries. it is focused on the analysis of malicious software (malware) with the goal of using the results to better defend the enterprise and the industry as a whole.

the ideal candidate for this position has proven experience working both independently and as part of a team; is a proficient software reverse engineer; is experienced in both static and dynamic analysis of code and is capable of developing detections and parsers for malware. the responsibilities of this role include, but are not limited to:

• computer network defense and incident response
• thorough documentation of analysis
• creation and maintenance of resilient detections and countermeasures
• consistent and effective communication across the team
• managing priorities and workloads with established accountability to deliverables

lm-cirt consists of a geographically dispersed global workforce serving mission excellence from four strategically located security intelligence centers (sics). the members of lm-cirt include a combination of analysts and technologists, with varying backgrounds and specialties, practicing the core tenets of intelligence driven defense (idd). cirt’s mission is governed by principles including idd, advanced counter measures, agile development of custom technologies, and cross industry collaboration.

lockheed martin sets the global standard in enterprise cyber security.

required skills, qualifications and experience
• previous experience in reverse engineering, including:
• comfort working within a sandbox/vm environment to perform analysis
• ability to use disassemblers and debuggers to understand malware behavior
• intermediate programming skills and knowledge
• ability to communicate findings to colleagues and partners in a clear and consistent manner

desired skills, qualifications and experience
• demonstrated experience developing and maintaining custom detection capabilities using programming and development expertise, including python, shell scripting, and regular expressions
• familiarity with common binary formats
• understanding of shellcode
• demonstrated experience with in-depth security log analysis
• proficiency in a unix/linux command line environment
• critical thinking aptitude in one or more of the following areas: practical cyber intelligence methodologies, development of custom intelligence techniques, uncovering targeted threat activity in large datasets, or subject matter expertise in applicable analytical areas (geospatial intelligence, linguistics, geopolitical intelligence, data science, etc

we are looking for a highly talented crime and intelligence analyst to join our growing and exciting intelligence function. in this role you will be key to delivering security and crime intelligence to keep our client and their properties secure. you will be able to demonstrate the confidence, experience, drive, flexibility and determination to provide the highest standards of intelligence and communication.

you will have the ability to work in a fast-paced environment, with excellent interpersonal and communication abilities and confidence using a variety of it and intelligence software.

main duties
• proactively merge intelligence from disparate qualitative and quantitative sources and draw inferences and conclusions based on client needs
• analyse crime trends and present actionable intelligence to provide advice or more effectively manage security resources
• identify poi’s and ocg’s that propose a threat and provide end to end case management with the objective of securing criminal convictions and custodial sentences
• create intelligence products to identify risk and vulnerabilities to our client’s retail operations and wider estate

• present intelligence and evidence to the client leadership and law enforcement partners

• other time-critical tasks as directed by the client and management
• complete ad-hoc projects as designated by the soc manager or client on time and to a high standard of quality

• strong big-data analytical ability – an expert user of microsoft office products, in particular excel, and use of crime intelligence databases

• an excellent communicator with experience in delivering oral and written presentations to senior leadership

• computer literate with a variety of software, including microsoft office and bespoke software

• good educational background and a solid command of written and spoken english

• strong communication and customer service skills

• good communication skills, verbal and written
• reliable, flexible and discreet

• solid organisational skills with the ability to coordinate multiple priorities and achieve tight deadlines
• a positive attitude and ability to deal with pressure professionally

desirable

in people & places, we handle all things people-related so our employees around the globe are empowered to do their best work. our talent acquisition teams find, attract, and hire the world's greatest minds to join uber.

about the role

in this role, you will be responsible for collecting, organizing, compiling, and analyzing talent acquisition (ta) data. you will partner with ta leaders to collect and report on operational analytics (volume and velocity metrics) and organizational kpis (candidate experience, d&i goals) that help craft ta strategy. this will require that you develop, maintain, and improve dashboards to further drive decision-making across the ta team. our team works directly with functional and business leaders to diagnose hiring needs, and go beyond the data to provide prescriptive recommendations that focus on important and impactful action planning.

what you'll do
• define business and talent acquisition data needs through discovery sessions with key collaborators
• develop analytic tools, dashboards, and reporting for operational reviews of the ta team's critical metrics and overall team performance across regions (apac, emea, us&c, and latam)
• use data to analyze trends and provide valuable insights and analysis for uber's global lines of business and executive leadership teams (data trends, recommendations, etc.)
• partner on improvements to uber's ta model to ensure accurate data capturing and management
• continuously identify process and design improvements to implement changes as needed

basic qualifications
• minimum 4+ years of professional experience

preferred qualifications
• 4+ years of experience building data-driven recommendations rooted in strong problem identification and measurement
• strong ability to visualize data that tell a story and communicate relevant points of the analysis clearly and concisely to non-technical audiences
• proven understanding of approaches to measurement, data analysis, and statistics
• experience working in fast-paced, agile, ambiguous multi-geographic environments
• ability to understand uber's businesses and how data can advise our people and business objectives.
• ability to lead initiatives across teams and communicate findings with leadership to move insights into recommended actions.
• self-starter attitude, you energetically pursue your work and love the responsibility of being personally empowered
• use one or more analytics visualization tools (e.g. tableau, visier, service now)
• experience working within hris and tools, including experience with workday, icims, servicenow, jira, or other related tools
• ability to manipulate large data sets with various dimensions and complexity

in people & places, we handle all things people-related so our employees around the globe are empowered to do their best work. our talent acquisition teams find, attract, and hire the world's greatest minds to join uber.

about the role

in this role, you will be responsible for collecting, organizing, compiling, and analyzing talent acquisition (ta) data. you will partner with ta leaders to collect and report on operational analytics (volume and velocity metrics) and organizational kpis (candidate experience, d&i goals) that help craft ta strategy. this will require that you develop, maintain, and improve dashboards to further drive decision-making across the ta team. our team works directly with functional and business leaders to diagnose hiring needs, and go beyond the data to provide prescriptive recommendations that focus on important and impactful action planning.

what you'll do

• define business and talent acquisition data needs through discovery sessions with key collaborators
• develop analytic tools, dashboards, and reporting for operational reviews of the ta team's critical metrics and overall team performance across regions (apac, emea, us&c, and latam)
• use data to analyze trends and provide valuable insights and analysis for uber's global lines of business and executive leadership teams (data trends, recommendations, etc.)
• partner on improvements to uber's ta model to ensure accurate data capturing and management
• continuously identify process and design improvements to implement changes as needed

basic qualifications

• minimum 4+ years of professional experience

preferred qualifications

• 4+ years of experience building data-driven recommendations rooted in strong problem identification and measurement
• strong ability to visualize data that tell a story and communicate relevant points of the analysis clearly and concisely to non-technical audiences
• proven understanding of approaches to measurement, data analysis, and statistics
• experience working in fast-paced, agile, ambiguous multi-geographic environments
• ability to understand uber's businesses and how data can advise our people and business objectives.
• ability to lead initiatives across teams and communicate findings with leadership to move insights into recommended actions.
• self-starter attitude, you energetically pursue your work and love the responsibility of being personally empowered
• use one or more analytics visualization tools (e.g. tableau, visier, service now)
• experience working within hris and tools, including experience with workday, icims, servicenow, jira, or other related tools
• ability to manipulate large data sets with various dimensions and complexity

we welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. if you have a curiosity, passion and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let's move the world forward, together.

darktrace is looking for candidates with a strong interest and experience in data, bi and reporting to join a newly established and growing data and bi team, who work closely with senior stakeholders across the business to help them make data driven decisions.< p>the role will suit analytical, self motivated people who can solve problems by translating requirements into reports, dashboards and analysis using various reporting tools, sql and microsoft excel. this is an exciting opportunity to work on a greenfield project and shape bi across the business.< p>we are offering a fully remote interview process and remote working whilst current restrictions apply. once we are able to return to the office you’ll need to be in a commutable distance of our cambridge office.< p>highly proficient in ms excel with proven experience in interrogating, manipulating and automating existing reportsexcellent sql skills with experience of writing queries linking various data sources together for analysisexperience with power bi (although experience with other visualisation tools considered)exceptional communication skills with an ability to manage stakeholder expectations and gather requirements effectivelya 2:1 (or equivalent) degree from a highly ranked university in a stem subject

grc analyst 12 months maternity cover (london)

darktrace’s mission is to make the world more secure in the face of targeted threats and evolving, machine-speed attacks.

by augmenting human security teams and autonomously detecting and responding to attacks, darktrace’s cyber ai platform reduces the risks of data theft and technology disruption that organizations face on a daily basis.

our technology applies cutting-edge machine learning and mathematics to the field of cyber-security.

founded in 2013, darktrace was most recently valued at over $3b and currently has over 2,000 worldwide employees spread across over 40 countries.

the technical hub and headquarters are located in cambridge, uk, with a us headquarters in san francisco, ca.

in this role you would be one of daktraces’ resident grc analysts, working within the security compliance team. your responsibilities would include but not limited to :

supporting the day-to-day management of industry recognised information security standards (e.g., iso 27001, iso 27018, ce).

supporting of isms management within gitlab issues to sustain information security business operations.

supporting the requirement and process for continuous improvement across the business, by leading process for non-conformance capture.

to include the identification of information security risks, incidents or regulatory changes.
• supporting the management of security-related incidents whereby there is an existential security concern over personnel, assets or infrastructure.
• supporting the information security risk management process by identifying, evaluating, treating and monitoring threats to data confidentiality, integrity and availability.
• providing a level of security compliance support to the business, engagement with department leads and darktrace users to ensure security compliance throughout the business.
• providing suitable resiliency and redundancy for other security compliance team leads with department workflows (i.e., certification management).
• evaluating requests for exceptions to policies and security compliance queries, ensuring sufficient mitigating controls are in place.
• supporting the management and completion of customer security assessments and queries.

about you :
• prior domain-specific knowledge of cyber security and security governance
• awareness of data protection legislation and its application in a practical way
• good communication skills required
• organised and attentive to details
• proactive, self-motivated and team player
• maintain an awareness of the existing and emerging threat landscape
• security or general technology related certifications would be beneficial but not essential

benefits :
• competitive base salary
• bupa family healthcare
• other benefits include transport allowance, free lunch on a friday*, free fruit and regular office social events (* dependent on region

job description:

spectrum it are looking for a contract digital data analyst to get involved with working across several product areas across commercial, digital service and app teams for one of our clients. the role will provide data, reporting, insight and analysis which illustrates a complete picture of the performance across digital (web and app) assets. you are expected to guide product owners to the right data points and support them to self-serve through appropriate reporting/automation using google big query, google analytics and google data studio.

the role will also involve building queries and automating data sets, analysing data to drive the optimisation and improvements of the journeys, along with supporting the tagging and development of the website and app. the position interacts with a number of roles including product owners, the wider digital analytics team (including reporting analysts along with the tagging and implementation manager), website & app developers, and business analysts.

responsibilities:
• providing accurate data, reporting and dashboards to key stakeholders using the existing systems
• support analytics, digital and development teams to ensure we have the best possible data capture, tagging and reporting
• deliver and support the necessary bau
• work collaboratively with the product teams to define and set out datalayer updates to enhance data capture and reporting requirements
• utilise the existing data to conduct analysis along with providing insight and recommendations for improvement and optimisation
• support with data capture across existing and upcoming product development
• check all reporting and analysis for accuracy
• ensure reporting & analysis slides are updated

skills:
• background in digital data & analytics
• intermediate to advanced sql skills with knowledge of google bigquery
• experience of building and adjusting sql queries
• working knowledge of google firebase app and web tracking/reporting
• experience of tag management process and tracking using tools such as tealium or gtm would be an advantage
• experience of developing reporting and an ability to draw insights from reporting and analysis that informs business decisions
• knowledge of digital across web & app
• day-to-day experience of using google analytics
• experience of creating automated reporting / dashboards using google data studio
• experience of digital project work an advantage
• ability to use planning and prioritisation tools such as jira and confluence

if suitable please apply or contact natasha on for more information

minimum qualifications:
• experience in business intelligence (bi) engineering, including building infrastructure, data pipelines, and assets through change control
• experience with writing sql queries, including creating and maintaining tables
• experience with analysis or business intelligence tools, including dashboards, spreadsheets, looker, tableau, or similar
• ability to speak and write in english fluently

preferred qualifications:
• bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience
• experience deriving insights from data and presenting findings in a business setting
• ability to work in an unstructured environment, navigate ambiguity, and bring clarity and structure
• ability to create and cultivate cross-functional networks and manage without authority

about the job

as a sales data analyst on the business performance and data analytics team, you will partner with sales operations and leadership teams to build a scalable infrastructure. you’ll develop business tools/dashboards that support the day-to-day operations and go-to-market (gtm), and derive insights that translate into accelerated business growth, while improving our ability to serve google cloud customers at scale.

google cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. we deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. customers in more than 150 countries turn to google cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.

responsibilities
• enable regional and functional sales teams with at-scale dashboards, tools, insights, and analysis.
• establish the core data infrastructure to help the organization operate the business from leadership.
• be a collaborative business partner and act as the subject matter expert for all things data.
• contribute to building analysis to provide actionable insights to executive leadership within the region.

company description

we are looking for an aspiring data analyst for a full-time permanent opportunity at autovia

job overview:
• permanent data analyst opportunity to work with autovia
• full-time job with flexible working hours
• hybrid working arrangements

as the uk’s leading automotive publisher, our content-first digital business attracts the widest automotive media audience in the uk. the data & insights function owns the development, delivery and optimisation of the data and insights strategy. supporting the development of new and existing revenue streams across advertising, demand generation, subscriptions and data products; the team constantly strives to evolve the scope, quality and utilisation of our data asset. fundamental to this purpose is our understanding of how readers and customers engage with our media sites and interact with those revenue streams.

job description

reporting into head of data and insights

you will provide tracking, reporting, and deep-dive analysis on all areas of the business, from data capture in third party systems through etl in google cloud platform to our cutting edge customer data platform. you will offer recommendations for business improvements and efficiencies to drive profitable revenue growth through your interpretation, knowledge and insights. you will look to automate key functions to reduce manual work as much as possible, in addition to adopting and advocating new technologies such as ai and machine learning..
• continuously improve our google analytics implementation (using google tag manager) to extract maximum insights from user behaviour, including spearheading the migration to a ga4 solution
• develop automated reporting and dashboards through optimising google cloud platform and championing google data studio dashboards
• understand the business objectives of our sites and develop meaningful metrics that accurately measure our success and encourage the right initiatives
• extract business insights from data to inform our digital strategy and communicate your method and conclusions clearly
• proactively identify problems and opportunities on our websites, interpreting customer behaviour into actionable insights
• provide data-backed answers to business questions from stakeholders
• propose and contribute to deep-dive analytics exercises such as attribution, predictive modelling and segmentation
• train technical and non-technical users to get the most from analytics and related technologies
• keep up to date with the latest analytics technology to ensure our toolset and approach is best of breed
• work with other analysts within the team to share knowledge, experience and effort effectively
• collaborate with product squads to identify important questions

qualifications

you will have a passion for improving digital experiences through measuring customer behaviour by embracing the latest technology and listening to the story which that data tells.
• a strong interest in both implementation and insights
• proven commercial experience in working with google marketing platform (analytics 360, tag manager 360, and optimize)
• proven record of using digital analytics metrics to measure performance; including measuring and analysing online marketing campaigns using natural and paid search, email, affiliate, display and social
• solid knowledge of javascript, browser technology, cookie behaviour and server-side programming, including consuming apis
• experience of working in digital industries, especially content led or publishing
• understanding of paid search platforms, such as google adwords
• understanding of (or passion to learn about) web development coding (e.g. html), the technical aspects of seo & conversion optimisation
• experience with data visualisation tools, such as google data studio or looker desirable
• ideally a knowledge of incorporating google analytics into google big query
• confident and competent at sql coding
• you’ll have a bsc in computer science, information management, mathematics, or statistics or equivalent industry experience
• be able to communicate with a wide variety of people, adjusting language accordingly

additional information

at autovia we want our people to embrace the journey, be curious, think creatively, push the boundaries and be a positive team player. our driving force is to wow our customers, listen to what they want and deliver best in class service whatever part of the business you join. all we ask is that you keep it real, be authentic to who you are, respect others and have fun along the way!

we’re proud that our teams are as diverse as our customers. we recruit talented people based only on their skills, experience, and their drive to make autovia the best it can be. if this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you

essence’s mission is to make advertising more valuable to the world. we do this by employing the world’s very best talent to solve some of the toughest challenges of today’s digital marketing landscape. it’s important that we hire people whose values reflect those of our own: genuine, results-focused, daring and insightful. as an essence employee, we promise you a workplace that invests in your career, cares for you and is fun and engaging. we believe these factors create a workplace where you can be yourself and do amazing work.

about the role:

essence is seeking an analytics manager to join our growing emea analytics team. you will be responsible for delivering category defining models and analytical services for our clients.

we’re looking for someone with deep quantitative and data management skills to help interrogate various data sources and understand what’s driving brand performance. the role will be overlooking brand analytics in emea.

you will be supported by a growing team of experienced analytics directors. the role sits within the wider data & technology team at essence, and you will collaborate with colleagues from across the agency - including planning, activation, and client services.

some of the thing's we'd like you to do:
• use your knowledge of statistics to lead the development of actionable insight. work with analytics & client leadership to deliver the findings of your models to our clients.
• collaborate with the practice and the wider agency to develop new tools and solutions to support;
• budget setting
• scenario planning
• media optimization
• get under the skin of marketing problems, and generate genuine insights that will resonate with senior clients.
• be able to translate complex analysis into actionable insights that tell a story.
• be innovative and bring new and interesting analytical techniques to the team, and be willing to educate others in their practical use.
• define execution plans and drive delivery of projects & initiatives with guidance from your director(s)

a bit about yourself:
• 3+ years of experience in a data & insight role; practical know-how in building analytical solutions including: campaign analytics; experimental design; multivariate analysis, including data reduction techniques, clustering; categorical data analysis; predictive modelling as well as time series forecasting. previous agency or consultancy background is desirable.
• 1+ years team management experience.
• strong analytical skills, with the ability to identify business questions, analyse data, draw conclusions, and develop actionable recommendations.
• technical experience in analytical programming languages - sql is compulsory, one of programming languages such as python and r are also preferred.
• equally importantly, a knack for presenting complex data in clear & simple formats that cuts-through the noise and allows audiences to focus on key insights.
• a natural collaborator, and enthusiastic about building relationships across agency disciplines.
• knowledge of the advertising and communications landscape. clear understanding of how marketing works.
• you will have the talent and appetite to become an influential member of a fast-growing, cutting edge agency that grew on the strength of analytics - our founders were all analysts
