join a team of passionate thought leaders in a dynamic and collaborative environment!  cognizant microsoft business group’s applied innovation team is hiring now and we’re looking for our next agile business analyst to join us.

the microsoft business group is a cloud-first, full-service microsoft partner committed to delivering innovative technology solutions that solve human challenges. we are compelled by our core values to drive transformational results for clients across all company sizes, geographies and industries. the cognizant microsoft business group team delivers full lifecycle solutions—from project inception and planning, through deployment to ongoing support and maintenance.

why should you work at microsoft business group?
• multi award winning business
• official and award-winning microsoft partner
• award winning databricks partner
• official github partner
• cloud native organisation
• growing international and diverse teams
• hugely collaborative environment, where ideas and knowledge sharing is actively encouraged

what will the agile business analyst be doing day-to-day?
• lead requirements gathering activities, ensuring you and the client both agree on what it is you plan to deliver. regular grooming of the backlog to ensure appropriate level of detail is captured at the right time.
• planning and facilitation of the various agile meetings and artefacts, including sprint planning, reviews & retrospectives, daily stand-ups & planning poker
• assist in team development while holding teams accountable for their commitments, removing roadblocks to their work; leveraging organizational resources to improve capacity for project work; and mentoring and developing team members.
• primary contact point for requirements gathering and management (including acceptance), managing stakeholder expectations for project deliverables and communications, maintaining maximum customer satisfaction
• working directly with our client to help them build applications to make the most of their data

what type of experience does the agile business analyst need to be successful in this role?
• five years plus experience working on data focused projects (i.e. cubes, warehouses, migrations, ml etc)
• confident in challenging assumptions and working with the business to define an mvp for a product
• extensive experience in data governance
• ability to effectively structure backlogs to define a product using epics and features aligning both business needs and technical architecture
• ability to write clear, testable user stories using gherkin acceptance criteria
• ability to lead stand-ups, retrospectives, showcases, planning sessions, iteration planning sessions and project discovery sessions, and backlog refinement sessions
• expert understanding of scrum methodology
• solid experience working in an agile team to agree and develop system/product designs based on user requirements and specify these as user stories
• experience of using azure devops or jira tooling
• ability to create and sustain effective stakeholder relationships, across all levels
• resilient and proactive with a strong delivery focus
• strong data modelling skills
• ability to become familiar with complex business domains quickly

qualification requirements
• degree educated – required
• certified scrum master – beneficial
• certified product owner – beneficial

does the agile business analyst role require travel?

the role is currently 100% working from home however some travel to our london office will be required in the future.

security responsibility:

all employees must act in accordance with cognizant microsoft business group’s corporate security standards.

employment eligibility

cognizant microsoft business group requires candidates to prove eligibility to work in the uk. offered candidates may be asked to complete a background check as permitted by applicable employment regulations. depending on the requirements of the job, these record checks may include any or all of the following education verification, employment verification, drug screening, and criminal record check

an expanding energy company, with a focus on gas extraction and low carbon solutions, seeks a power bi developer/data analyst. in this role, you will design, implement and support microsoft power bi dataflows, datasets, reports and dashboards to support finance, operations, hr and it and much more. the company is open to applications from graduates to experienced professionals – the key is to have some power bi development experience and a passion to excel in the role and take on a lot more responsibility.

the company, which is part of a larger group of companies, focuses on oil and gas production and in developing low carbon technologies for the coming energy transition. they are actively involved in the north sea with production from operated fields. they are in constant acquisition mode and in recent years have increased their market position significantly. they hold operated platforms in the danish sector and have equity shares in west of shetland. this presents major opportunities for the company to realise operational and commercial synergies and further enhance their offshore skills base.

the company is committed to further growth, both organically and through acquisitions. with a fairly flat organisational structure and a friendly open culture, they actively promote knowledge transfer and individuals’ involvement in the decision-making process. the company advocates health and fitness and has a fully operational gym on site with free instructor lead classes. in addition, the company is keen to promote from within, all leading to great opportunity for career development

job description

we are looking for looking for experienced and dynamic consultants to join our existing teams. as a senior microsoft data and analytics consultant, you will engage with our clients daily, working to understand their challenges and to deliver solutions. you will be based from one of our regional offices or on client site.

your skills and attributes for success:
• an excellent team player and able to work independently.
• excellent client facing skills.
• a self-starter who is proactive in nature.
• excellent verbal, written communication, and presentational skills.
• ability to build internal and external relationships.
• effective negotiating and influencing skills.
• ability to think creatively and propose innovative solutions.
• strong self-developer.
• leadership skills.

your skills and attributes for success:
• multi-skilled experience of one or more of the following disciplines: data management, data engineering, data warehousing, data modelling, data quality data integration, data analytics, data visualisation, data science and business intelligence.
• project experience using the following core technology: microsoft data and analytics stack (t-sql, sql server database, ssis, ssas, ssrs, power bi).
• project experience leading, planning, and delivering enterprise-wide reporting and data warehouse solutions using proven delivery methodologies (e.g., waterfall, agile, scrum, devops, testing), frameworks and best practices.
• project experience in designing/developing/maintaining etl processes.
• project experience in designing/developing/maintaining dashboards, reports and cubes using sql, mdx, dax.
• excellent sql skills for querying and creation of views/tables, functions, and stored procedures.
• project experience of data modelling and/or data warehousing concepts.
• technical business analysis experience.
• a proactive awareness of industry standards, regulations, and developments.

ideally, you'll also have:
• project experience deploying/provisioning/implementing azure iaas/paas.
• working knowledge of power bi, azure databricks, synapse analytics, hdinsight or azure data factory
• microsoft certifications e.g., mcsa in cloud platform, sql bi development, bi reporting or data engineering with azure.
• project experience of enterprise etl tools such as informatica, talend, datastage or alteryx.
• exposure to any of the following technologies: sas, teradata, machine learning, python, r, snowflake, hadoop, spark, scala, oracle, pega, salesforce, rpa tools such as uipath, nintex, blue prism.
• capability to articulate and document architectural solutions and processes.
• cross and multi-platform experience.
• financial services sector experience.
• line management experience.
• team building and leading.
• mentoring/staff development experience.

you must be:
• willing to work on client sites, potentially for extended periods.
• willing to travel for work purposes and be happy to stay away from home for extended periods.
• eligible to work in the uk without restrictions.

what we offer:
• bdp plus – a reward programme whereby you accrue points to trade against a 3-month paid sabbatical or cash equivalent.
• 25 days holiday + bank holidays.
• 5 days holiday buy/sell option.
• private medical insurance.
• life cover.
• cycle to work scheme.
• eligibility for company pension scheme (5% employer contribution, salary sacrifice option).
• employee assistance programme.
• bespoke online learning plans via udemy for business.

array

ready to find the right role for you?

salary: c£35,000 plus veolia benefits (pension, bonus)

hours: 40 hours per week

we live in a world that needs to take care of its resources, and our mission at veolia is to 'resource the world'. we have an exciting opportunity for a data analyst to join our team.

this permanent position is well suited to an individual that is looking to advance their career in the it sector and gain industry-leading experience in a thriving and supportive workplace.

improving communities, protecting the environment and creating an inclusive culture is right at the heart of our business. together our employees make our communities better. they are the resourcers, behind the resources. we want you to be part of our diverse workforce!

what will you be doing?

create a suite of automated reports and dashboards by which we can effectively manage our business
identify kpis within the business and ensure that they are measurable with achievable targets
develop an understanding of the various end users of these reports and ensure that they are suitable
use advanced analytics practices to delve deeper into trends and patterns in the data
be able to communicate technical solutions to non-technical people

what are we looking for?

microsoft transactional sql (data aggregation, transformation, relational table joins, etc)
microsoft dax (data aggregation, filtering, lookups, etc)
microsoft power bi desktop and online (report and dataset development and management)
degree level education in a relevant field (strong mathematical experience preferred)
high problem solving ability

our promise to you

in return, you will receive 25 days of holiday and an extensive benefits package which includes our market-leading pension and share scheme as well as employee discounts. additionally, we provide mental health and financial support because we are committed to supporting you.

as a proud equal opportunities employer, we are fully committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive environment that's diverse and welcoming. every applicant who passes the minimum requirements for the role will be considered, no matter their age, gender or gender expression, disability, race or ethnicity, religion, belief, sexuality or veteran status

looking to take your analytical skills and apply them to a global organisation going through various transformation projects? do you enjoy working with the best technology solutions available and applying them to world-class customer service? if this sounds like you then this might be the right opportunity for your career as we look to recruit a microsoft data analyst with azure experience based remotely.

if the above sounds like you read onif you are not, then check out our other jobs – we are also looking for people in other mi & insightpositions

job summary

our client's management information team has recently grown and with that growth comes the need for a new microsoft data analyst which is where you come in. this business supports a large remit of customers across the uk and has seen an increase in the demand for its services.the brand continues to lead the way as an industry leader in their respected field and there is a huge opportunity for someone joining the business to further their career and have a real impact on their success.

your role

as the microsoft data analyst ,you'll work closely with the head of planning & mi joining a department that has 95% of their data stored in either sharepoint or excel and your goal will be to assist with the strategy to move this to azure. we're looking for an experienced analyst/developer to review where the data is stored, etl process, and assist with the build, governance, and automation from sharepoint to azure.

about you

the successful person for this role will either be a strong analyst or developer with strong working experience in microsoft azure with at least 4 years of experience in building solutions using a variety of tools and microsoft azure services(extra points if you have sharepoint experience) and have been great at it and all that being a microsoft data analyst ,involves –if it needs explaining then this is probably not for you.

some bullet points about you:
• hands-on experience with business intelligence tools, data modeling, and data extraction processes
• expertise in physical data warehouse database design
• strong microsoft azure professional experience
• proven stakeholder management exposure at all levels

how to apply?

if all of this sounds like you then click on the apply button or if you want to learn more before that then contact us and make it for the attention of john who will answer any questions that you might have

data analyst - london

are you a talented bi/data analyst with excellent power bi skills, looking for a new and exciting opportunity to work for a growing, ambitious, innovative, expanding company? my client are putting a huge focus on their reporting, and increasing the teams headcount by 3 power bi developers.

my client are a global organisation within the education sector. you will be working as part of an innovative, fast paced technology driven culture who are always looking at ways to enhance how technology is used within their organisation.

this role will be focusing on the reporting needs across multiple departments as well as very senior stakeholders.

we are looking for someone who enjoys problem solving, who has an inquisitive nature, a team player and can work in a collaborative environment.

the role

this role is varied, please find below some of the main responsibilities this role will entail:
• reporting & visualisations
• designing dashboards
• full reporting project lifecycle - gathering requirements, working with sme's, design brief, testing, uat, launch, comms plan, workshops for adoption, lessons learnt.
• data modelling and logic testing
• the potential to get involved in predictive analytics - projections.
• stakeholder management - working with a wide range of stakeholders including some very senior members. you could be gather requirements, asking questions, workshops, presenting to them, building relationships, consult them, help them understand what the data can do. be part of the process of change.

main skill-set

we are looking for a good mix of the below skills, (not necessarily all of the below, but a good proportion):
• power bi - designing dashboards, complex dax calculations, create data models, not just structure data sets, understand relationships between different data sets, keep up to date with all the new releases, building foundations of data set. understanding where data is stored.
• sql server - write sql scripts to get data out, create joins, understand tables, where to get data from
• power query

must haves

to be successful, it is essential you have the following:
• 2+ years' experience with power bi.
• excellent communication; clear, concise, articulate.
• stakeholder management experience

culture & values

my client believe in building a culture supported by strong values. within the team, they would describe themselves as being highly collaborative, they use teams and sharepoint to share ideas. they are supportive, open and they have high standards in the work they produce. its very non-hierarchical and are all trusted and given independence.

benefits package

you will be awarded the following benefits package:
• base salary - from 36,000 to 50,000 per annum (this is a wide range, looking for junior and mid level and 3 hires, what you are offered is completely dependent on your skill level which is assessed on your cv and interview)
• pension
• interest-free season ticket loan
• 30 days + organisation closure days + bank holidays
• eye care vouchers
• plus so much more… (please enquire for more details)

other

• contract type - permanent, full time
• working hours - 9am - 5pm (flexible
• interview process - 1 stage
• salary reviews - yearly
• progression options - lots of options; senior, analytics, data science.
• training & development options

please note: this is a permanent role. this role is for uk residents only. this role does not offer sponsorship. you must have the right to work in the uk with no restrictions. some of our roles may be subject to successful background checks including a dbs and credit check

position summary

samsung ads is responsible for identifying, valuating and determining new opportunities within the digital media and advertising industry with the goal of creating scalable services and businesses on top of the global footprint of european samsung smart tvs. the team is working to bring value for partners, advertisers, and agencies through its unique insights into tv viewership in the shifting media landscape!

we are a rapidly growing team working to build a unique, world class advertising organisation with a steadfast focus delivering real results to customers

having won adage best places to work award 2020, we are looking for a person who likes early stage opportunities and would like to join a rapidly growing team to help define the next chapter within a nascent hyper growth advertising business.

role and responsibilities

this role sits in the esbo analytics & insights team. the team is focused on delivering campaign and marketing insights reports. it is currently focused on automating reports to bring scalable solutions to the business. this role is mainly focused on custom campaign and market insights, and also contributing to finding patterns and contributing to automation.

we are looking for a confident individual with strong sql skills and python knowledge who understands the importance of communication, solutions and delivery. you should have a passion for solving problems, identifying solutions, leading projects, and working in cross-functional teams. if you love, being in the hot seat with the opportunity to be a hero, we’d love to meet you!

this senior analyst will report to the data analysis manager. if you are interested in joining a rapidly growing team working to build a unique, world-class advertising organisation with a steadfast focus delivering real results to customers, you've come to the right place.

you have a solid understanding of sql and python automation. sophisticated tv and insights-based advertising experience a plus. the senior analyst is expected to develop and maintain excellent working relationships with all appropriate levels within and outside the company.

lastly, you will also work closely with teams around the world to ensure we are getting the proper support to grow the business.

what this role will achieve

core to the role is translating ctv campaign insights and ad hoc viewership, audience profile, or other analysis requirements into significant queries and scripts to pull data from our media consumption databases. once the analysis is completed, you will then help craft the narrative for business and clients to understand the results. this is a key role to drive to contribute to drive the business forward, as it helps sales and marketing to demonstrate the value of advertising with samsung ads.

you will explore data to find trends and identify new opportunities for the organisation. in addition, you will help improve and automate current code base.

ideally, you are organised, detailed oriented, flexible and possess ability to establish priorities with minimal guidance in a fast paced environment – be proactive, analytical problem solver and strategist, who is able to draw conclusions- not just report the data.

your key responsibilities:

+ translate business requirements into meaningful set of sql queries for ad hoc analysis and new reporting solutions, and particularly related to ctv ad insights campaigns. the overall aim is to use data to demonstrate the value of advertising with samsung ads to our clients.

+ explore data to identify trends and anomalies, develop new analytical capabilities/solutions, and find new monetization opportunities

+ transform and cleanse outputs from data warehouse into meaningful analysis for business/sales teams

+ summarise analyses into powerpoint presentations or formatted excel reports

+ help explain analysis results to business team

+ automate and optimise current code base, will be owner for some specific audience dashboards to support client service management.

+ collaborate with other analytics teams to develop and improve our current solutions

+ collaborate with product teams to identify new data solutions improve our current offer

+ aid in documentation overall, be responsible for documentation in new project owned

+ collaborate to refine methodology and calculations

skills and qualifications

to be successful, you will possess the following skills and attributes:

backgrounds:

- data analyst

- measurement

- business analyst

- data scientist

- ad operations (if includes campaign insights)

required skills

- extensive using sql full time

- extensive experience working in an agency or company leading media analytics

- exposure to automation, preferably with python

- experience working with large relational databases

- demonstrated expertise in connecting various sources of data (across digital media channels or platforms) to create a holistic view of integrated campaign performance

- experience with statistical analysis/tools

- familiarity with media, digital / mobile /tv measurement

- strong written and verbal communication skills

- experience with ad tech and digital media ops

- insights led story telling experience

- a high degree of analytical expertise is crucial, along with the ability to communicate test results in basic terms for consumption of non-technical colleagues.

- willing to work collaboratively with non-technical teams and learn new concepts

- degree in computer science/engineering or quantitative discipline (economics, statistics, engineering, physics, mathematics). masters preferred.

a plus

- experience working with domo and tableau

- exposure to aws redshift or postgresql

- experience with aws tools such as ec2 and s3

- jira, confluence, github and other agile development tool experience

- experience working with a dmp

- experience with data visualisation

- familiarity with digital marketing

- familiarity using python for data manipulation/cleansing

- experience working with salesforce

what does success look like?

- a love for data and statistics, for example exploring data for fun, find patterns, create norms for campaign insights report results. you are curious and take initiatives on finding new insights, new angles are looking at the data and deep dive into the meanings of campaign insights results. support the development of reporting capacities for all types of campaigns, particularly to develop the capacities of programmatic campaign insights reporting.

- you have a passion to test and learn in a fast paced environment, your curiosity is outstanding. you love communicating your new findings to the analytics & insights team, as well as to esbo (european ad business) stakeholders.

- help build a data-informed culture – provide decisions makers with the information they need when they need it and in a way they can trust and act on.

- experience building and optimising queries to bring data to csm, sales and marketing accurately and efficiently. a passion for digital or tv advertising a bonus.

- experience to develop strategic relationships with all areas of the business. you can root cause issues quickly and uncover core issues, then assist, collaborate with, and teach the teams how decisions affect efficiency, scalability, new mechanisms as they are needed.

chertsey, surrey

blue square marketing limited

do you have office and remote people management experience?

do you have excellent powerpoint and excel skills?

are you good at multi-tasking and coordinate a lot of activities at once?

if this sounds like you, we have an exciting opportunity, where you can take the next step in your career and work with a leading technology brand.

what will you be doing on a daily basis?

the digital appliance & customer experience support manager will be responsible for supporting the samsung field service engineers & samsung brand specialist engineers, along with the field support executives.

reporting to the client development manager there will be a requirement to have a flexible approach to administrative tasks whilst supporting the samsung service network.

working in the customer experience team alongside the service delivery and business engagement team, to manage a team of engineers/technicians and administrative staff, to deliver an industry leading digital appliance repair and inspection team, who will operate across the uk. the role will also offer support to the field team from an administrative point of view.

all suitable candidates should reside no more than 50 miles away from the vacancy location. candidates who live outside of the requirement will not be considered.

what experience & skills do you need to succeed in this role?
• ability to look after a team of people, both in the office and in the field
• able to use the microsoft office suite to an advanced level, especially excel and powerpoint
• good co-ordination skills and able to multi-task
• knowledge of reverse logistics
• ability to work with minimum direction, a self-starter and self-motivated.
• willingness to travel domestically as required (approx. 10% travel).
• has background of white goods industry or has an understanding of this
• outstanding communication skills
• able to understand and support change management
• great eye for detail
• able to work under pressure and to tight deadlines
• able to manage and lead several different teams

who are we and what is it like to work with us?

with a decade’s experience helping some of the world’s biggest brands, we are an industry-leading field and experiential marketing agency with a team of over 1000 across the uk and ireland, accelerating brand performance. you will be the live connection between brands and their audience, so every day will be different. working at blue square is exciting, challenging and incredibly rewarding!

and lastly, i know you are thinking…what are the benefits & development?!

firstly, working with a leading technology brand, you will get hands on with all the latest tech devices and receive best in class training on these. we are passionate about growth and we aim to provide every employee with a clear development plan, with regular reviews that enables them to achieve their career goals.

our commitment to you…
we understand that we are currently living and working in unprecedented times and that this may cause uncertainty. we want our applicants to know that we are committed to the recruitment and onboarding process for this and so the experience will be reflective of our culture of embracing change, agility in our processes and putting our people first. this means the hiring (and potentially onboarding) of this role will be completed entirely remotely. we will work with our candidates to make this process a smooth and accessible as possible. thank you.

position summary

this role will sit within the dtc ce / mx commercial team, but work closely with the dtc data & analytics team. the commercial team is made up of specialists who take responsibility for setting our commercial strategy and ensuring we are meeting our sales ambitions. in order to achieve this, the commercial team collaborate with the dtc ux and marketing teams to understand the drivers behind performance and to unlock additional opportunities.

role and responsibilities

this is a hands on data role which will support the ce / mx commercial team, taking responsibility for:

end to end insight delivery – working closely with the product planning manager to improve understanding of areas of incremental opportunity
• compare dtc’s current performance to market trends and identify areas of additional opportunity, at both a category and a product level
• work with peers within the ux and marketing teams to interrogate ecommerce data sets (sell out, website data and marketing activation) to build recommendations on what further actions can be taken to unlock the identified opportunity
• proactively feed relevant insight in to commercial strategy and act as the data champion for the commercial team
• work to improve the insight that the team are able to generate and the decisions that are able to be made from this
• collaborate with the dtc data & analytics team to unlock additional data sources and tools where appropriate

performance reporting – accountable for ensuring adequate reporting has been implemented for all required business purposes. collaborating with our data analytics agency and dtc data & analytics team to enable this
• deliver appropriate reporting and analysis of the previous week’s performance to feed in to the dtc weekly trading rhythm. working closely with the commercial leads to ensure they are clear on performance and understand the drivers of this
• proactively feed in-week insight and analysis of performance to relevant commercial stakeholders, which enables decisions to be made in-flight to adjust or up weight plans as appropriate

working with the dtc data & analytics team, ensure there is a clear report development roadmap and that our reporting suite continues to fit the needs of the business
• gather all reporting and data requirements for product launches and key campaigns, ensuring there is frequently refreshed data which enables performance to be monitored within day. using this data to proactively feed in recommendations on changes that can be made to impact performance
• enable monthly business performance reviews to unpick performance and drive strategic change where appropriate

target setting – accountable for ensuring there are clear targets set across all dtc kpis which ladder up to our overall objectives.
• within bau, ensure these targets are clearly defined and set at the appropriate level of granularity to measure performance accordingly
• for product launches and campaigns, work closely with the commercial leads to understand the product division’s ambitions for dtc and to translate these in to ecommerce specific kpis. traffic, cvr, aov, proposition uptake etc.
• forecast product level expected sell out performance for upcoming campaigns, based on historic performance and promotional effectiveness analysis

data enablement – responsible for enabling accurate and reliable data across our data infrastructure
• maintain adobe analytics and google analytics segment mapping, ensuring this is up to date and in line with site structure at a category and product level. making sure these web tools are used consistently across a number of relevant stakeholders
• work with the commercial team to ensure product skus lists are maintained and mapped correctly within all reporting
• act as the data validation champion to enable accurate reporting across platforms and that all data received by the business is correct

representation - you’ll also need to act as a bold data representative within internal meetings, liaising with members of the marketing, commercial and onsite teams on a regular basis. proactively feeding in insight and recommendations wherever possible.
• champion self-serve data practices across the commercial team, and wider, providing coaching and upskilling where appropriate

skills and qualifications

this role requires someone with demonstrable experience in analytics and insights, as well as previous experience working with digital analytics tools. we are looking for someone who feels comfortable both working independently and as part of large teams.

they should be happy to work alongside both technical analysts within our agencies, and also able to translate key insights and recommendations in a clear way to internal stakeholders with differing levels of understanding.

essential hard skills:
• extensive analytics experience, working with both adobe and google solutions.
• experience in setting commercial and ecommerce measurement frameworks
• experience in using data visualisation tools (i.e. looker, data studio, tableau)
• experience in using sql and etl platforms to make sense of large data sets
• confident in manually manipulating data to draw conclusions and recommendations
• knowledge of the digital data landscape and likely future opportunities & challenges
• an ability to work as part of a team, working on multiple projects for multiple partners at the same time

essential soft skills:
• analytical & detail orientated
• confident
• flexible and adaptable
• excellent communicator
• conscientious, confident and keen to support a high standard of execution.
• willing to challenge peers through questioning, prioritisation and planning

we are looking for an exceptional data scientist to join our growing team in staines-upon-thames. you will be experienced in working with data, curious about data and patterns, passionate to turn huge data sets into accurate and meaningful information which is easy to understand and has commercial impact on samsung products.

as a data scientist your role will involve:
• creatively analysing patterns in existing and new data with complex data modelling, machine learning or statistical analysis.
• visualizing large sets of data to extract actionable items from information, across diverse customer-facing platforms.
• finding creative opportunities from the data to produce insights and recommendations that help drive samsung’s business success.
• translate complex functional and technical requirements into a detailed design.

required skills
• masters, phd, or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (statistics, mathematics, computer science, ml & artificial intelligence, etc.)
• programming proficiency in python
• data collection, data fusion, statistical data modelling and evaluation experience in python
• prior experience with one or more of the following: regression, clustering, classification, decision trees, statistical models
• excellent communication, team work and a results-oriented attitude
• proficiency in problem solving and a self-starter

desirable skills
• knowledge of machine learning
• knowledge of big data tools such as spark
• familiar with cloud technologies (aws, gcp, etc.)
• exposure to deep learning approaches and modelling frameworks (pytorch, tensorflow, keras, etc.)

contract type: full time / permanent

job location: staines-upon-thames, surrey, uk

hybrid working: standard working week will be 3 days working from the office and 2 days working from home

employee benefits: competitive salary, annual performance bonus up to 25%, pension scheme with company contribution up to 8.5%, income protection, stocks & shares isa, life assurance, 25 days holiday (increasing to 30 with length of service). we also have a wide range of flexible benefits to choose from with samsung providing an allowance of £600 per year to spend on them

position summary esbo (european service business organisation) is responsible for identifying, valuating and determining new opportunities within the digital media and advertising industry with the goal of creating scalable services and businesses on top of the global footprint of european samsung smart tvs. the team is working to bring value for partners, advertisers, and agencies through its unique insights into tv viewership in the shifting media landscape we are a rapidly growing team working to build a unique, world class advertising organisation with a steadfast focus delivering real results to
customers having won adage best places to work award 2020, we are looking for a person who likes early stage opportunities and would like to join a rapidly growing team to help define the next chapter within a nascent hyper growth advertising business.

role and responsibilities

we want to expand our data driven decision making to enhance relationships with our existing & new content partners.

we want to be proactive in relation to our clients' growing products & services and their evolving sources of value.

this role will help us achieve these objectives by harnessing data from our own team & other teams in esbo & the wider organisation.
• build an 'always on' view of our partners' performance across various metrics
• build internal & external performance reporting templates
• use multiple data sources to analyse, track, interpret and make clear and concise recommendations on partner performance on our platform
• create regular performance reporting on content engagement and revenue generation to key stakeholders using a range of bi and presentation tools, including teams across business development, product management, ads and hq
• manage a range of analytics requests and be proactive in finding relevant insights to present to stakeholders
• identify and prototype new data processing projects to gain new insights into content consumption: there is a constant need to refine our understanding of content consumption to ensure we are bringing the correct content to the service
• develop our capacity to predict performance and revenue generation behaviour
• support the expansion of the content by providing performance and revenue analysis to be shared with partners for their owned content and for the service overall.
• collaborate with colleagues in ads and product management to drive forward new ways of interpreting performance and revenue data
• commission and manage ad-hoc quantitative and qualitative projects as required
• manage roi tracking for specific projects across europe
• develop and manage positive working relationships with colleagues, content partners and other teams within samsung

skills and qualifications

to be successful, you will possess the following skills and attributes:
• previous experience of working in a data and insights capacity within the content industry.
• knowledge of how data can be used across a business to inform decision-making and drive value
• demonstrable experience in deriving insights and value from data to improve user engagement, revenue growth and user retention
• advanced spreadsheet skills and good working knowledge of visualisation tools such as data studio, domo, tableau or quicksight as well as powerpoint
• a good understanding of metadata and how it can be used to support insights
• experience of taking ideas from concept to finished product whilst retaining creativity and singularity of purpose
• effective planning and organisational skills. the ability to handle several initiatives at once and prioritising tasks effectively, and reacting to late requests and fast-changing events
• the ability to operate with autonomy and cross-functionally in a collaborative way
• the ability to maintain standards of accuracy and attention to detail when working to tight deadlines
• being comfortable with ambiguity and a willingness to try new things
• written and spoken english to native speaker standard
• enthusiasm, sense of humour, a can-do attitude and the willingness to pitch in when needed
• a genuine passion for content and tv in general, with a desire to build the best product experience possible
desirable knowledge and experience include:
• knowledge of the concepts and methods behind ai and ml when used to predict outcomes or results: of course practical experience would be ideal
• experience of working for a large company spread across multiple locations and time zones where the spirit of collaboration, tolerance and patience can sometimes be required

preferred technical and professional expertise
none

restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the fortune 50 companies relying on the ibm cloud to run their business.

about ibm

ibm’s greatest invention is the ibmer. we believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and ai strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the fortune 50 companies relying on the ibm cloud to run their business. at ibm, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

you will play a leading role in advising clients on business transformation through an analytical approach. you’ll work closely with clients and talented ibmers to understand each client’s issues and make strategic recommendations to address these, tailored to the client’s unique situation and data-maturity.

you will be working at the interface of consulting and data science. you will use data to derive insight for clients and help to explain technical concepts using strong communication skills and creative storytelling. during your day-to-day work you will provide specialist analytics, business modelling support, benefits realisation, machine learning insight, and build ai solutions. you will work with a variety of data types and use analytics and ai tools and programming languages, often using a cloud infrastructure to handle the volume and veracity of data streams.

introduction
information and data are some of the most important organizational assets in today’s businesses. as a security consultant, you will be a key advisor for ibm’s clients, analyzing business requirements to design and implement the best security solutions for their needs. you will apply your technical skills to find the balance between enabling and securing the client’s organization with the cognitive solutions that are making ibm the fastest growing enterprise security business in the world.

your role and responsibilities
security consultants are the front line of the security services delivery organization working to understand and solve client cyber security challenges. in this role, you will act as a trusted advisor, applying consulting methodologies and industry knowledge to provide solutions across all aspects of people, process and technology. these engagements encompass the full end to end cycle, from initial client engagement, through assessment, solution design and implementation, to longer term engagement in an advisory capacity.

security consultants also work collaboratively with our wider security specialist teams, using a range of technologies, industry standards, such as iso27001 and nist, ibm partners and ibm’s own varied security product portfolio to deliver the capabilities of the wider ibm to best solve problems in an ever-changing industry.
#gbscicuk21

required technical and professional expertise
• interest and a strong desire to learn continuously about cyber security across a range of domains
• ability to apply and adapt security knowledge across a range of client needs
• a collaborative working style
• perseverance and determination to deliver
• strong communication and presentation skills
• ability to explain complex problems in simple terms
• apply problem solving techniques
• apply knowledge/ability to influence through expertise
• to be a self-starter and happy to reach out when you need help

preferred technical and professional expertise
• demonstrate accountability
• apply business acumen
• use analytical thinking
• establish relationships & understand business goals
• demonstrate persuasive & compelling storytelling

ideally you will hold a level of security clearance, if not, you will be willing to undergo the uk clearance process, for this criteria you will need to be a british uk national with at least 5 years worth of residency

do you have a passion for big data and analytics? are you interested in improving meta’s existing products like messenger, facebook, news feed, whatsapp, instagram, oculus, and more? if so, our analytics team at meta are looking for data scientist apprentices to join their fast-moving team and work on the next generation of products, systems and services that help people connect with each other around the globe.

you might already see yourself as a data junkie who is excited about working with big data and using it to craft the story of why things happen - well that’s great! that’s just what our data scientist apprentices will do for products or businesses at meta. and by collaborating with our product managers and engineers they will translate these data driven narratives into meaningful impact to the business.

at meta, supporting our employees is a core part of how we do business. from our generous benefits to our inclusive culture, we’re focused on empowering all our employees to live life to the fullest and bring their best selves to work, each and every day. so, whether you are a school leaver, re-entering the workforce or interested in pursuing another career, we would like to hear from you!

how the data scientist apprenticeship works this higher apprenticeship program runs for up to 19 months and is designed around the ifate (institute of apprenticeships and technical education) syllabus for the data analyst level 4 apprenticeship standard.

this role is based in our london office with some remote working, within the analytics team in conjunction with our training provider, multiverse. you will receive continuous training & development, with a tailored development plan and opportunities to increase your skills throughout, which includes:

- multiverse’s community hub with unlimited access to training events & webinars such as excel, sql and python fundamentals bootcamp
- 20%: combination of theory, technical and practical training with multiverse
- 80%: on the job learning with 3 rotations across meta analytics team
- full support from your manager, buddy, and mentor to aid you in securing a permanent role at meta

work with product manager and engineering team to identify actionable insights to influence the direction of the business by communicating results

suggest improvements in the tools and techniques using data analysis

meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. when facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. apps like messenger, instagram and whatsapp further empowered billions around the world.

now, meta is moving beyond 2d screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. people who choose to build their careers by building with us at meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics

summary:

the team leads growth initiatives for facebook's most important products, including facebook, instagram, whatsapp, oculus, and messenger. the team is data-driven and results focused. we are seeking a talented professional who thrives at the intersection of product analytics, data science, product design, and growth marketing. the ideal candidate will have a strong technical, analytical, and product background - with a hunger to optimize product funnels and make products grow. this position is full-time, part of our product growth team and is located in our menlo park office.

required skills:

product growth analyst responsibilities:
• product analysis & data science responsibilities:
• apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with both our consumer and business products.
• identify the opportunities most important for growth, to remove barriers for product adoption, retention, engagement, and/or monetization, and partner with our growth-focused engineering teams to execute on projects based on what's identified to accelerate the growth and adoption of facebook inc. products in all the markets we serve.
• understand funnels, ecosystems, user behaviors, and long-term trends in the adoption of our products to identity opportunities for step-changes and angle changes in growth.
• define and analyze metrics that inform the success of products and allow us to monitor the heath of product adoption in the markets we serve.
• communicate the state of business, experiment results, opportunities, etc. to product teams.
• influence and inform product teams through presentation of data-based recommendations.
• product growth responsibilities:
• lead the product understanding process using data to identify opportunities to remove friction and accelerate growth and market adoption of our products.
• lead the ideation and execution of product changes that drive growth, partnering with product management, engineering, design, content strategy and data science.
• bring a deep understanding of growth & optimization best practices to growth focused engineering teams.
• drive consensus and prioritize the road-map of the growth-focused engineering team to drive a ruthless focus on the most impactful ideas.
• partner with product designers, who are also members of our growth-focused product & engineering teams, to ensure that designs incorporate known best practices, remove friction, and will be effective at increasing product adoption in the market.
• partner with engineering and data science to develop and implement experiments to test hypothesis for which changes will drive product adoption and growth.
• analyze the results of experiments to determine what should launch or not. learn from and iterate on those experiments by identifying additional opportunities to drive growth.
• communicate and simplify concepts to build buy-in with the engineering team.
• establish shared vision across the company for growth product optimizations by building consensus on priorities leading to major product improvements.
• product growth & market adoption responsibilities:
• understand the competitive landscape facing facebook inc. products and relative position in the market, to inform the product growth strategy and design.
• lead direct response communication efforts with users & potential users of facebook inc. products
• choosing the best targeting, channel, and message to drive product adoption.
• take product optimizations best practices that are known to be effective and implement them in other places.
• optimize funnels to reduce friction and drive the best possible experience for users who are going through any product flows necessary to become users of our products and services.
• lead product adoption efforts partnered with product growth teams, to effectively promote high retention experiences.

minimum qualifications:

minimum qualifications:
• 2+ years experience doing quantitative analysis.
• 2+ years experience working collaboratively with product team members such as: product management, engineering, design, data science, data engineering etc.
• 2+ years experience manipulating data sets through statistical software (ex. r, sas, pivot tables) or other methods.
• 2+ years experience with product optimization work i.e. funnel/website optimization and/or outbound communication channels like email or push notifications.
• 1+ years experience in sql and/or other programming language.
• 1+ years experience with product optimization or growth best practices.
• ba/bs in computer science, math, physics, engineering, statistics or other technical field or 3+ years equivalent technical work experience.
• experience in making analytical, data-driven decisions and communicating the results of analyses.
• experience in statistics (e.g. hypothesis testing, product experimentation, regressions, experimentation logic and biases).

preferred qualifications:

preferred qualifications:
• experience with prioritizing, communicating and influencing teams.
• experience thinking strategically, structurally solving product problems, and driving execution.
• experience delivering growth on the most important top-line company kpi's.
• experience working with product and engineering teams and technologies on platforms with existing, significant user adoption.
• experience partnering with product design, to design for growth and market adoption.
• experience with software development/coding and/or working closely with software engineers.
• experience with distributed computing (hive/hadoop).
• experience with other programming languages for example: r, python, sas, c++, c#, objective-c, perl, etc.
• experience with product design, or product wire-framing tools.

industry: internet

summary:

do you like working with big data? do you want to use data to influence product decisions for products being used by over half a billion people every day? if yes, we want to talk to you. our data warehouse team works very closely with product managers, product analysts and internet marketers to figure out ways to acquire new users, retain existing users and optimize user experience - all of this using massive amounts of data. in this role, you will see a direct link between your work, company growth, and user satisfaction. in this role, you will work with some of the brightest minds in the industry, and you'll get an opportunity to solve some of the most challenging business problems on the web and mobile internet, at a scale that few companies can match.

this is a full time position based in our london office

competitive salary including the following benefits apply:

-medical benefits

-dental benefits

-vision benefits

-pension benefits

-life assurance

-childcare benefits

-gym benefit

-transport benefit

-laundry benefit

required skills:

manage data warehouse plans for a product or a group of products.

interface with engineers, product managers and product analysts to understand data needs.

build data expertise and own data quality for allocated areas of ownership.

design, build and launch new data models in production.

design, build and launch new data extraction, transformation and loading processes in production.

support existing processes running in production.

define and manage sla for all data sets in allocated areas of ownership.

work with data infrastructure to triage infra issues and drive to resolution.

minimum qualifications:

2+ years experience in the data warehouse space.

2+ years experience in custom etl design, implementation and maintenance.

2+ years experience working with either a map reduce or an mpp system.

2+ years experience with programming languages, python preferred.

hands on and deep experience with schema design and dimensional data modeling.

ability to write efficient sql statements.

ability to analyze data to identify deliverables, gaps and inconsistencies.

excellent communication skills including the ability to identify and communicate data driven insights.

ability and interest in managing and communicating data warehouse plans to internal clients.

preferred qualifications:

bs/ba in computer science or mathematics.

industry: internet

about tencent

tencent is an internet-based platform company founded in shenzhen, china, in 1998. we use technology to enrich the lives of internet users and assist the digital upgrade of enterprises. our mission is "value for users, tech for good". we embrace a culture of teamwork & creativity and are driven by our values - integrity, proactivity, collaboration and creativity.

we are rapidly expanding our international operations and are looking for top talent to propel us forward. combining the results-oriented nature of a startup with the resources of a profitable and leading internet company, tencent offers a unique opportunity for aspiring individuals to thrive.

about tencent games

tencent games was launched in 2003 and is now the largest gaming company in the world, achieving game related revenues of $33 billion in 2021. as a leading global organisation for game development, publishing and operations, we are dedicated to providing high-quality interactive entertainment experiences to players and currently offer more than 140 games including pubg mobile, call of duty mobile, honor of kings and league of legends to hundreds of millions of players across more than 200 countries and regions. tencent games offers talented individuals the opportunity to help shape and build something unique within the gaming industry as a whole.

about the team

global game research team is to provide detailed analysis on game content, assess early stage opportunities, identify industry trends, portfolio gaps for the business and operations teams and help our investment companies to grow. we are looking for two game analyst in europe: one based in amsterdam while the other one based in london. this role is visible across tencent's ieg team (interactive entertainment group) , as ieg team relies heavily on the key insights provided by our team to make critical decisions.

role & responsibilities
• work closely with tencent second-party developers. provide insightful feedback, identify potential risks and support decision making through out the development process.
• prepare holistic content analysis, assessing a game's merits across all key components (game design, game mechanics, balance, art, game economy, total addressable audience, etc.)
• compile regular reports on specific genres or industry trends via infographics, visuals, and research synthesis.
• monitor consumer trends across the pc, console, and mobile landscape and share findings with internal teams.
• extensive playtest and review games submitted to tencent for evaluation across a variety of platform and genres, as well as all notable new market releases.
• perform due diligence on game development studios globally and prepare comprehensive reports covering the team's strengths and weaknesses. give insightful comments on investment, co-development and other potential opportunities.

key requirements
• a minimum of 3 years' experience working as a video game designer or producer with a proven track record.
• strong understanding of large-scale project development. familiar with global development team culture and work flow.
• strong passion for interactive entertainment and a deep understanding of gameplay systems and mechanics.
• strong research and problem-solving skills, creative thinking, global mindset, and excellent communication skills in a multi-cultural environment.
• solid gaming experience across platforms is required. we recommend candidates to list up the game he/she/they play recently or the games he/she/they enjoyed with reviews or comments in the resume or cover letter (if applicable, please send the cover letter at aprilyjwang@tencent.com)
• a plus: university degree in a relevant field; mandarin proficiency.

location
• amsterdam or london
• some travel required

report to
• team leader of global game research team (shanghai based)

benefits
• a diverse and inclusive work environment where you can connect with colleagues from around the world.
• a safe and supportive organisational climate to continue to grow and hone your craft.
• 25 days annual leave, long-service awards, flexible work arrangements, private health insurance and pension plan.
• additional benefits such as annual trips, gym membership, working lunch, family day and other cultural events and festival gifts.

tencent games is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. we are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity.

diversity, equity & inclusion at tencent:

diversity, equity and inclusion are important, interdependent components of our workplace. as an equal opportunity employer, we firmly believe that diverse voices fuel our innovation and allow us to better serve our users and the community. we foster an environment where every employee of tencent feels supported and inspired to achieve individual and common goals

we’re looking for a data analyst to join us here at gwi. not just any data analyst though. someone ambitious and genuine, who works best in the midst of a collaborative and forward-thinking team. that’s because as a gwier you’ll be immersed in the fast-moving world of data tech. we think big to make an impact, we’re not afraid to ask why, and we always show respect. those values are what got us where we are today, and they’re a big part of what we’re looking for in you.

about the job

our newly formed business data & analytics department is on a journey to empower every area of the business with quality data, insights, automated efficiencies and analytics. our goal is to enhance business performance and to give every gwier the opportunity to make the best, timely decisions to move at the pace that makes gwi special. gwi is a data company where we power insights for some of the biggest global businesses, but the bd&a team is all about looking inwards and unlocking huge opportunities to work cross-functionally across departments to power up our internal teams.

we are hiring an experienced data analyst to support the build of our new data and analytics platform as well as projects and initiatives across the business. you should be able to extract and integrate data and look for trends and patterns for both system needs and business analysis needs. you will have experience in profiling and analysing data in any system, internal or 3rd party, including data lakes and data warehouses. you will be comfortable working with metadata, data lineage and master data and confidently be able to advise the business on these areas.

what you’ll be doing
• learn and understand how the data works and be ready to answer questions of the data
• document data, data flows, processes and data models
• analyse and document system data for integration into data lake and data warehouse
• collaborate with enterprise data architect, business experts, and analysts to integrate systems and automate data collection processes
• work with data ingestion pipelines built by data engineers and be hands on to support data issues or questions raised on data
• problem solve issues through deep-dive data investigation
• setup proactive monitoring of data to support either data quality or timely insights for departmental action
• produce mi and dashboards which help users understand key pressure points in data or processes
• support data testing activities across business and technical areas
• ensure data is available in a fit-for-purpose and timely manner for business and analytics consumption

about you

first things first, as a disruptor in the global market research industry, we haven’t come this far without entrepreneurial spirit and a get-up-and-go attitude. we are looking for someone who embraces modern data frameworks and innovation and can see the benefits of using data to enhance business decision-making. so if you think we’ll see that in you, then you’re already halfway there. here’s the rest of what we’d like you to bring to the table.

technical
• data manipulation and analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise and analyse large amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
• experience in data reconciliation against any systems, data platform or bi reporting sources
• experience in designing and implementing workflows for management of data to support business areas as well as the bd&a team
• experience in data modelling
• highly proficient in sql
• highly proficient in excel and/or google sheets
• experience with either tableau or looker
• working knowledge of python highly desirable
• preferable experience with gcp and the gcp data components
• experience with dbt, stitch or similar highly desirable
• experience supporting qa and user acceptance testing processes
• knowledgeable on modern data architecture such as data lake, data warehouse, lakehouse, data mesh etc.
• delivering incremental value through scrum and kanban methodologies
• competencies
• ability to find solutions when faced with challenges and be articulate when offering viable recommendations
• ability to interpret impact of changes to business rules on the data and data integration pipelines
• excellent verbal and written communication skills and able to write up and present findings
• self-driven and constantly striving to improve data
• analytical and agile mindset and ability to see the big picture alongside the value of incremental delivery
• natural problem solver who can make recommendations at pace
• ability to scope, estimate and deliver committed work on time, on own and as part of agile team
• understand, if not live and breathe the mantra that good quality data is the backbone of every busines

our benefits

great benefits make a big difference. not just to employees, but to the whole vibe of a business. that’s why when you work for us, you’ll enjoy a full spectrum of generous perks, rewards and office benefits - all in line with covid-19 guidelines of course.
• competitive salary and discretionary bonus
• 25 days annual leave (prorated)
• flexitime and a great work-life balance (don’t just take our word, check out glassdoor)
• allocated shares according to gwi’s share scheme
• a range of discounts and freebies
• linkedin learning and ongoing learning and development opportunities
• simplyhealth cash plan for everyday healthcare
• auto-enroll pension plan with gwi matching up to 4%
• a range of discounts and freebies
• cycle to work scheme and commuter season ticket loan
• commit a working day to charity each year
• early finishes on a friday
• a well-stocked fridge, plenty of snacks (some healthy, some not so healthy)
• regular social activities, including free online yoga and team outings

who we are

gwi was founded with the knowledge that understanding your audience is really important for business. when you know who you’re speaking to and why, you can create content and campaigns that stand out to the people that matter.

through our global online survey, we gather data on the behaviour and perceptions of consumers across the world. this provides businesses with deep, actionable insights on their audience, revealed from data they trust.

it’s been going well, too. since launching in 2009, we’ve become one of the uk’s fastest growing target audience companies. we’re not about to stop growing any time soon. as a business, we’re on a mission to re-engineer data-driven marketing, and we’re on the lookout for talented people to join us.

diversity & inclusion

imagine if our data came from just one kind of person. we’d get a very nuanced view of the world. and we definitely wouldn’t have got off the ground as a business.

although things certainly aren’t perfect, we live in a society where differences are increasingly celebrated – so we’d expect nothing else from our teams. in fact, the gwi office is as diverse as our global data, it’s really important to us that it stays that way. this is a place to feel at home, express yourself freely and make your mark.

#li-hybrid

about you

you’re a data analyst who has real curiosity when it comes to answering business questions with data. you enjoy finding hidden patterns and relationships. you look for the right tools for a given job - rather than just using what you’re used to.

you enjoy working collaboratively with a wide range of stakeholders across the business. you take an interest in the wider business context and independently identify areas where data and analytics could deliver value.

you have a passion for learning and are always looking for opportunities to hone your craft.

about the role

you will be responsible for answering both day-to-day and longer-term, strategic questions with data, analysing data and processes, developing analytics data flows, dashboards and reporting, and distilling actionable insights on core business metrics.

reporting directly to the head of data, you will work across car & classic to add critical analytical horsepower to ensure we’re making data-driven decisions and using insights to improve efficiency and customer experiences.

about us www.carandclassic.com

car & classic is one of the largest automotive marketplaces in the world. we’re lucky to have thousands of user generated listings submitted monthly with content gems from james bond’s aston db5 to elvis presley’s cadillac. the site is old, launched in 2005 but under new, vc-backed ownership since 2018 and on an exciting triple-digit growth journey to bring classic vehicle transactions online.

our culture is incredibly important to us. we’re lucky enough to have built the team from scratch with a focus on enjoying the day-to-day, diversity, inclusion and high performance. despite being an entirely distributed business we build strong connections as colleagues and have created a fun and high performing culture.

whilst the team is only 100 people now we expect to double over the next 12-months. we’re looking for a data analyst that has good, relevant experience and wants to make their mark in a rapid growth business where they can make a real difference, whilst enjoying the environment and culture.

finally you don’t have to love cars to work here (and lots of our team don’t) but for those who do this is an incredible opportunity to combine your passion and professional lives – we look forward to hearing from you.

role and responsibilities
• working proactively with stakeholders to understand data requirements, converting these into structured analytical hypotheses and output and using these to help identify areas where we can drive business performance and growth.
• building innovative and scalable analytical solutions which solve real business problems
• working to optimise our analytics infrastructure and analytics data pipelines using a range of technologies
• identifying new data sources which could deliver business value and working with other technical stakeholders to ingest and transform this into analytics-ready modelled datasets
• confidently delivering the results of your work to technical and non-technical stakeholders to influence decision-making in a way which ensures that business decisions are as data-driven and evidence-based
• being closely involved with the identification, procurement and implementation processes for new technologies such as bi/reporting tools, observability platforms etc.

what do you get (remuneration & benefits)?
• salary up to £50,000 (dependent on experience) 💰
• stock options 📈
• all the equipment you need to get the job done 💻
• flexible working - work where and when you want in order to get the job done 🌍
• access to free counselling, therapy and mental health support via spill 🤗
• professional development allowance 🚄
• company paid team retreats 🧘‍♂️
• income protection 🛡
• life cover 👩‍👧‍👦
• smart health 🩺
• generous parental leave 👶
• 33 days holiday (including bank holidays) & any period of closure over christmas also paid 🏝
• ability to make your mark on a fast-growing start-up 🚀

the skills, attributes and experience you must have:
• advanced sql skills
• experience working with a data warehouse (snowflake would be nice but not essential)
• experience of using standard data analysis packages within python / r (pandas / numpy / matplotlib / plotly / scikit / statsmodels) (tidyverse / dplyr / ggplot2)
• ability to communicate technical findings to a range of non-technical stakeholders
• ability to prioritise and deliver a workload comprised of a range of short and long-term deliverables
• ability to translate business questions into well structured analytical solutions
• ability to write comprehensible, well-structured code

skills, attributes and experience it would be nice for you to have:
• use of dbt (desirable)
• use of git / github (desirable)
• use of at least one bi tool (metabase, looker, thoughtspot, tableau…)
• experience working with a modern elt data stack

our application process

we want to make sure we hire the best available talent! we had a fantastic 2021 with all of our hires hitting the ground running. we are excited to do the same in 2022.

every role is crucial to us at this stage of our growth. we are improving and evolving our recruitment and application process on a monthly basis. we are trying to remove any bias from our recruitment process, this is an on-going issue in the recruitment function for companies of all sizes.

to help achieve this we have refined our application form that you will find when you click 'apply for this job'. the answers to the questions are the difference between your application being progressed or not so please do give them your time and effort when answering. the first thing our talent partner will review is these questions (we may not even need to review your cv depending on your answers).

good luck with your application and thank you in advance for your interest in joining us at car & classic
