what we do

at zero100, we’re mobilizing a radically new and diverse community of global operations leaders at the nexus of supply chain, technology and climate change. our members are pioneers in their industries; re-inventing the production, distribution and consumption of physical goods on behalf of consumers around the world. c-level executives and their teams rely on zero100’s proprietary digital operations assessments, content, research and events to level-up the current and future generation of supply chain talent.

with rapidly expanding headquarters in london and new york city, we’re also proud to be backed by leading investors and supported by an impressive founding member list of global brands, including unilever, deliveroo, google, the estee lauder companies and kroger.

what you will do

at zero100, we are rapidly developing and expanding our data infrastructure to support our fast-growing business. to ensure our reporting capabilities grow alongside our data infrastructure, we are seeking a london-based data analyst to own business reporting and analytics for our zero100 business.

as a zero100 data analyst, you will work closely with stakeholders from multiple teams (including product, research, events, finance and customer engagement) to scope, build, launch and maintain a broad portfolio of analytics, reporting and visualization tools. you will also partner with our product team to influence the roadmap and strategy for our zero100 data platform as we launch new reporting methodologies and analysis tools.

the successful candidate is highly detail-oriented and well-versed in multiple data and analysis techniques/tools, including excel, sql, and (ideally) data visualization tools like tableau and google data studio. you are an effective written and verbal communicator who can work directly with business stakeholders to define requirements and deliver new reports and analytics to a high degree of quality. you are highly curious and interested in learning new skills and developing your career while ‘rolling up your sleeves’ to deliver results in a fast-paced start-up environment. above all, we are seeking candidates who are passionate about building products customers love, and who share our enthusiasm about the potential for our zero100 mission to have a positive impact on the world.

does this sound like you? think you’re up for the challenge? apply today and let us know why.

responsibilities:
• build automated reports (ie, in excel) that deliver business-critical data to our zero100 teams in a complete, accurate and timely fashion.
• develop self-service visualization tools (ie, via tableau, google data studio or similar) that allow non-technical stakeholders to slice, dice and explore our company data.
• partner with our product team to build, maintain, and ultimately deliver our data and reporting roadmap.
• maintain and optimize our existing portfolio of analytics, visualization tools and reports.

what we offer:
• competitive salary
• private healthcare
• enhanced pension/401k
• unlimited vacation policy
• enhanced parental leave – 6 months full pay
• life insurance

requirements:
• expert-level excel proficiency
• intermediate proficiency with sql
• baseline knowledge of data visualization tools (ie, tableau, google data studio or similar)
• a strong track record of operational excellence
• strong written and verbal communication skills

preferred qualifications:
• experience with python
• experience with google cloud platform
• experience working in a start-up, scale-up or high-growth business
• knowledge of program/product management methodologies and frameworks
• zero100 is equal opportunity-affirmative action employer – minority / female / disability / veteran / gender identity / sexual orientation

introduction

at burberry, we believe creativity opens spaces. our purpose is to unlock the power of imagination to push boundaries and open new possibilities for our people, our customers and our communities. this is the core belief that has guided burberry since it was founded in 1856 and is central to how we operate as a company today.

we aim to provide an environment for creative minds from different backgrounds to thrive, bringing a wide range of skills and experiences to everything we do. as a purposeful, values-driven brand, we are committed to being a force for good in the world as well, creating the next generation of sustainable luxury for customers, driving industry change and championing our communities.

job purpose

burberry is making a major investment in expanding our data and analytics capability. over the last few years, we’ve created a global omni-channel single-customer view, built an outstanding analytics platform and developed a small but highly effective digital analytics and data science team. we’ve built a great capability in the digital part of our business and we’re now ready to build on these foundations to make a quantum leap forward in the sophistication and breadth of data-inspired decision-making across the whole of burberry. the fashion industry hasn’t historically been at the forefront of data and analytics innovation but, at burberry, we aim to change this…

you’ll be joining a team with a hugely ambitious, well-funded and exciting roadmap in a role with great scope to shape our data strategy. you’ll be joining at the start of the next stage on our journey, so you’ll have the opportunity to influence our plans as well as deliver them. you’ll be implementing and using the most modern tools in the market with limited/no legacy technology and tools holding you back. you’ll have a rare opportunity to apply analytics and data science in a creatively-driven business – combining art and science to create beautiful things. you’ll be joining a team that is already using advanced techniques like deep learning, machine vision and ai to drive real value for our business. you’ll be working for an organisation that is optimistic, positive, tolerant and respectful but also audacious, ambitious and driven. you’ll be working with and supported by an amazing data technology function that is a true partner in delivering our strategy. you’ll find yourself a team that is passionate about, and invests heavily in, training and development. and finally, you’ll be working on a global scale but in a company small enough that everyone can have their voice heard and make a difference.

does that sound exciting? if so, we’re recruiting a large number of roles and this is one of them …

we are recruiting a data analyst to join our expanding team.

responsibilities
• insight delivery: you’ll be directly responsible for extracting, manipulating and, crucially interpreting the wealth of information available to inform the business on key priorities
• rapid insight: you’ll be responsible for supporting fast-paced project development covering prototyping, capability building and rapid project development. you will be expected to become an expert in our chosen tools and languages in order to meet these responsibilities
• subject matter expertise: you will build your knowledge of the business areas you support to become a go-to for reliable expertise and analytics support
• analytical skills: you will develop your technical and analytical problem-solving skills to lift the fluency and quality of analysis you deliver
• communication & presentation: you will share your work and learnings in a clear, concise and easy to understand form providing suitable recommendations and conclusions
• self-development: you’ll be responsible for staying up to date with industry trends and developments across ecommerce, marketing & digital
• delivery management: value-led prioritisation of your work and ensuring excellence in day-to-day operational and project delivery
• stakeholder management: you’ll proactively share key insights and trends on a regular basis with the immediate and wider teams

personal profile
• influencing skills: ability to influence, engage with, and respond to stakeholders with credibility and impact
• creativity: an ideas person - a creative thinker who has a hunger for novelty and newness with a keen interest in merging technology and innovation
• collaboration skills: ability to work collaboratively with others – understanding, respecting and leveraging different perspectives, skills and objectives to make the whole greater than the sum of its parts
• time management: ability to prioritise and communicate to stakeholders what you’re delivering and when, reliably and independently
• self-motivation: drive to learn about and understand the business and, within your area of influence, the impact your work could have to its continued success
• value focus: relentless focus on value delivery and, taking an evidence-led approach, will always focus on the commercial value that your work can deliver
• curiosity & empathy: keen learner, and this curiosity will lead you to a deep understanding of and empathy for the business & customer and of the objectives and needs of your stakeholders

required experience and education:
• bachelor’s degree or above in a mathematical, statistical, scientific or engineering discipline
• ability to demonstrate basic sql skills, equivalent to the syllabus described here: https://www.coursera.org/learn/sql-for-data-science
• ability to demonstrate, through either academic projects or work experience, a scenario where you have used data in making a decision or solving a problem
• ability to explain complex scenarios or solutions in simple terms and hold excellent written and verbal communication skills that combines a keen eye for detail with the ability to tell the bigger story
• prior knowledge and experience of any of the following would be highly valued:
• google analytics, adobe analytics or equivalent digital analytics tool
• tableau, looker, powerbi or other enterprise level bi and visualisation tool
• qualtrics or similar voice of customer and survey tool
• web and ecommerce technologies including html & javascript, single-page applications, cms or search & merchandising platforms

there has never been a more exciting time to join the digital & data team at m&s! this is a fantastic opportunity to support the delivery of our transformation goals, be a role model for digital behaviours and championing a culture of data led decision making!

working alongside a team of analysts, you will design and deliver sophisticated analytical solutions in demanding and fast paced commercial environments. with an intuitive grasp of data and analytics, you will be passionate about driving innovative analytical thinking and the benefits of a data driven approach.

conduct full analytical lifecycle delivery to include requirements, design and development resulting in the implementation of analytical solutions and capabilities that drive insight and benefit. key accountabilities & responsibilities
• act as a data and analytical consultant to help see opportunity, drive understanding and data solutions across the business.
• become advocate for using data manipulation and visualisation tools.
• champion a culture of analytical curiosity through the development of innovative data driven solutions to business questions.
• deliver and present analytical findings and recommendations to business partners and leadership, ensuring key findings are understood.
• develop analytical applications and systems that provide automatic solutions to manual processes, improving efficiencies.
• develop and prepare reporting solutions providing descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive insights.
• encourage and lead in the understanding and learning of sophisticated system features and methodologies of currently adopted analytical tools. upskilling the wider team in broad principals whilst improving abilities in specific subject matter expert areas.
• identify and demonstrate potential commercial benefit of analytical solutions, through accurate forecasting, prediction, and trialling.
• investigative analysis to determine cause, consequence & scale of data issues, gaps, or anomalies.
• keep updated with new technologies and industry developments relating to analytics, data science and data technology.
• liaise with the wider data team to ensure we have the right data and solutions available to deliver our analytical priorities.
• manipulate data within relational databases to clean, transform & enhance data.
• provide analytical expertise and support in the delivery of advanced data driven solutions.
• provide daily operational support ensuring critical reporting solutions and applications are available.
• successfully manage and deliver end to end analytical and development projects.
• support and encourage experimentation approaches to technological and analytical challenges.
• support the analytics manager in delivering the teams objectives and strategy and help shape the future direction.
• work closely with key partners to fully understand requirements and provide collaborative solutions based on a commercial and analytical understanding.
• work cross-functionally with the other analysts in the team to build a thriving analytics environment where knowledge and ideas are shared.
key experience
• outstanding problem solving, analytical and numerical skills are essential.
• expert understanding of analytical solutions and standard processes related to building, testing, deploying, and supporting highly scalable data solutions.
• the ability to initiate and build strong relationships and demonstrate experience of influencing business partners at all levels.
• experience in a variety of reporting and data visualisation techniques.
• advanced knowledge of data management, storage, systems, and techniques.
• expert knowledge and the uses of data-orientated and programming languages (sql, python, r).
• expert knowledge of developing optimal sql across big data tables and sets.
• ability to translate technical data to be easily understood by non-technical consumers.
• advanced knowledge of manipulating and redefining data sets and applying analytical methodologies.
• ability to communicate effectively with the business to understand their needs and interpret how they could be fulfilled using the available data.
• experience utilising statistical analytical methods (regression, classification, etc.)
• solid experience in visualising and storytelling with data.
• advanced knowledge of power bi or similar data visualisation tools
• passion and desire to learn new tools and techniques.
• experience working within an agile delivery framework.
• previous experience in performing and maintaining data quality.
key benefits
• hybrid working
• 33 days holiday (including bank holidays) + 1 celebration day
• 20% discount on m&s products
• a range of wellbeing support (including free counselling and a virtual gp for you and immediate family)
• 25% off gym memberships, access to online fitness classes and discounts for complementary health services, such as nutrition and lifestyle coaching
about m&s

m&s is ready to push boundaries to lead the industry into a greener, speedier, more inspiring digital era. thatâs why weâre revolutionising how we work and offering our most exciting opportunities yet. thereâs never been a better time to be part of our team.

#li-cp1

bally's interactive is the digital arm of one of the world's leading entertainment providers, bally's corporation, with tens of millions of players across the globe and big plans always in the works. our brands and sites include market movers and shakers like sportscaller, monkey knife fight, vera&john, virgin casino, jackpotjoy and many more. we make our mark by embracing the diversity of our global team, challenging ourselves, and striving to make a difference for our players.

the digital media team: who are we?

we sit within the performance marketing team, with our primary focus being on running and optimising new user acquisition campaigns for a range of websites that are operated by bally's.

the digital media team run the paid advertising campaigns across several categories - direct display deals, programmatic, video, and social media. we are a highly ambitious team and are always striving for the best performance possible using the most efficient processes. working as a team and in collaboration with the leading companies in this continuously evolving sector, we learn, we share, and we grow together.

the role: what will you be working on?

this role encompasses all aspects of digital display advertising. you will be responsible for the full range of tasks involved in the end-to-end running of a selection of marketing campaigns within the team to ensure they are performing as effectively as possible.

key responsibilities:
• the set-up of digital media campaigns including coordinating creative assets and tracking urls
• implement ongoing changes to live campaigns to ensure they are running as efficiently as possible
• liaise with media companies (such as facebook and google) to ensure effective and accurate delivery of our campaigns
• perform analysis of live or historical campaigns to detect trends in the data with a view to improving the performance of current and future campaigns
• work with our in-house design team to develop new ad creative
• communicate campaign performance and any learnings to the team and senior stakeholders on a regular basis

the person: who are we looking for?

we're looking for someone who's recently graduated with a scientific or numerical based degree.

this is an entry-level role so no previous marketing experience is necessary. if you have a natural grasp of numbers, like making evidence-based decisions and are results-driven then this is a great opportunity to learn all about display marketing in an ambitious environment.

key skills:
• strong aptitude for data analysis
• good working knowledge of microsoft excel, experience with pivot tables is desirable
• excellent attention to detail
• natural, methodical problem solver
• highly effective and clear communicator, both verbally and in writing
• focused and highly organised

benefits:

we offer some of the most competitive benefits in the market, including continued personal growth and career development plans, as well as performance based bonuses. we also believe in providing an environment where employees can flourish. you'll have the opportunity (hopefully soon!) to work in a modern and well catered for environment, with office events and team-building activities. until then, we also offer a work from home allowance to ensure you have everything you need to work comfortably, during these times

when you see the world as we do, you see the chance to help the world take better care of its resources, and help it become a better place for everyone. it’s why we’re looking for someone who sees the world in a similar way to take up an exciting data science manager role in our analytics team.

because of our responsibility when it comes to leading change, resourcing takes every single one of us, and this is how you can play your part. and if you’re passionate about data and technology, this role will suit you perfectly.

it doesn’t matter if you’re looking to overhaul the industry, or just do a good day’s work. we know that everyone here at veolia can help us work alongside our communities, look after the environment in small and big ways, and contribute towards our inclusive culture.

what will you be doing?

as a data science manager you will lead a team of data scientists and data engineers whilst coordinating the efforts of the data science team in solving large-scale business problems. you will set the data science strategy, identify improvement opportunities, and work closely with stakeholders to create innovative solutions to important business problems.
• the data science manager will develop strategies for effective data modelling.
• translate ambiguous business challenges into technical solutions.
• redesign business processes to best make use of analytical outputs.
• oversee the implementation of models into cloud production environments.
• use outcomes to make recommendations for creating or adapting existing business strategies.
• present insights to technical and non-technical audiences.

what are we looking for?
• previous analytics experience.
• experience leading a data science team.
• degree-qualified in a mathematical or engineering discipline.
• strong coding ability in sql & either python or r.
• strong understanding of machine learning principles.
• understanding of database design fundamentals.
• proven project management experience, particularly data science projects.

our promise to you

here at veolia, we know that a genuinely good role goes both ways.

so alongside your salary or hourly pay, you’ll get 25 days of holiday alongside an extensive benefits package, which includes our market-leading pension and share scheme, alongside a range of employee discounts. also to help you further, we provide mental health and financial support, so you can lean on us whenever you need to.

apply today, so we can make a difference for generations to come.

about the role

we are looking for an associate data analyst to join our product analytics team, where you will be working closely with ourstore productand ux teamsin order to make product recommendations with colleagues and customers at the heart.

a fantastic opportunity for someone at the start of their analytics career.

we also encourage data analysts to play active roles in the analytics community giving you the opportunity to attend events, mentor others and get involved in our diversity & inclusion committees.

there are also plenty of opportunities to learn new things and we havededicated days forself-learning and personal development.

furthermore, we have got an excellent work-life balance, team days and a fun but engaging culture.

about the product analytics & optimisation team

the analytics and optimisation team sits within the customer and serve product department. our mission is to deliver insightful and actionable recommendations through reporting, analysis, and optimisation;

with a focus on establishing best-practice processes and enabling data-driven decision making across all product teams. tesco store tills, colleague apps, tesco groceries, and clubcard websites and apps are amongst the digital products supported by our team.

you will be responsible for

whilst specific responsibilities will be dependent upon the changing needs of the tesco business, the following provides an overview of the role'

s key responsibilities and measures :
• collaborate with store product managers and ux leads to identify and understand their data needs, and help translate business challenges into questions and analysis, in order to make product recommendations with colleagues and customers at the heart.
• help define business objectives / customer needs by capturing the right requirements from the right customers, and challenging assumptions.
• participate in and contribute to setting objectives and goals for the product teams you support and help measure these.
• perform deep-dive analyses using a variety of data-capture and mining tools (hadoop, alteryx), and communicate findings and opportunities to product teams.
• create, maintain and automate monitoring and analysis dashboards using visualisation tools (tableau).
• create ad-hoc data visualisations following tesco best-practice.
• following our business code of conduct and always acting with integrity and due diligence.

you will need
• a recent graduate with an analytics degree or up to 6months-2years of experience working within an analytics role
• working effectively with a variety of people from different backgrounds and with different levels of data literacy
• explaining complex systems and complicated information to stakeholders in relatable terms - you must be able to articulate complex concepts to a diverse audience.
• the ability to influence without authority, maintaining cross-functional relationships.
• ability to thinking at a conceptual level across several customer interfaces (e.g. different tills, or different apps).
• maintaining commercial and customer awareness in your work.
• sql - ideally having experience of accessing data using sql
• relevant experience in a quantitative disciple, or a similar university degree or higher

personal
• flexibility, ability to plan and organise, responsiveness, creativity, self-starter.
• able to build solid working relationships with peers and senior leadership.
• ability to demonstrate strong written, verbal communication and presentation skills to all levels of seniority and disciplines within the organisation.

what's in it for you

we offer excellent benefits that help make tesco a great place to work! these include but are not limited to :
• annual bonus scheme
• holiday starting at 20 days, rising to 22 days after 12 months, plus a personal day (and bank holidays)
• great colleague discounts and deals, saving you money on everyday purchases, utility bills for the home and more

about the role
as a senior data analyst you will not only take on your own projects, often the most complex and challenging, but help to support and train other team members. you will also be expected to participate in wider discussions and initiatives within technology, offering solutions to problems and helping to ensure tesco maximises the value of its data assets. it would best suit a highly experienced analyst who is looking to gain the additional experience required to take their next step into management.
about the analytics team:
the analytics capabilities & optimisation team is a team of data analysts, bi experts, analytics engineers and product managers. it is responsible for defining, prioritising and delivering the self-serve analytics strategy, event streaming and optimisation capability, methods and components for enabling real-time, data-driven decision making and customer data insight across all of tesco's businesses. it accelerates the self-serve delivery of ad-hoc insight from customer data and enhances the value of our analysis to the business and customers. it connects the customer analytics and insight innovation needs of tesco's businesses to our core data platform, tools and services.
you will be responsible for
translate customer needs and business questions into detailed technical and functional requirements for analysis or self-service analytics. then translate results back. actively question the commercial drivers of such requirements, the stakeholder objectives, and challenge the rationality of approach.
analyse structured and unstructured data from customer transactions and business operations, then present insights and well-argued recommendations.
build automated performance trackers and dashboards where appropriate, balancing business need with technical debt
coach, train and support members of the team and be a role model for professionalism and best practice, deputising for analytics manager as and when required.
challenge how we deliver analytics within tesco and offer ideas and solutions to improve and change
work with the business and analytics community to expand the types of analytical approaches in areas such as automation, pattern analysis and clustering.
develop close working relationships with stakeholders, effectively listening and understanding their needs and applying persuasive skills to influence and inspire others.
write well-formed code supporting the development of big data-oriented solutions solving complete data integration or analytic use cases with the production-ready precision.
actively contribute to our data dictionary and business reference materials, with documentation and articles demonstrating best practice and case studies.

you will need
you will need:
a strong personal interest in data analytics, both in the execution, the technology and market trends
deep understanding and extensive experience using database/datastore technologies, from traditional rdms solutions to nosql/distributed file systems.
expertise querying massive datasets using a variety of sql dialects, with demonstrable understanding of query optimisation and relational modelling
experience building and debugging complex data blending and preparation routines, either using scripting e.g. python and/or other data blending tools/languages.
extensive experience and practice in the creation and implementation of data visualisation solutions, with solid awareness of data visualisation principles
solid understanding of computer science principles (networks, software architecture)
understanding of how to test, measure and validate your outputs. able to translate findings to non-technical audience.
experience building etl pipelines
experience coaching and developing more junior team members, both from a technical and personal skills perspective
creativity, confidence, flexibility, ability to plan and organise, responsiveness, self-starter
excellent interpersonal skills, a trusted advisor
comfortable with ambiguity and able to navigate a fast moving, complex environment
a natural planner looking ahead, raising issues, providing solutions and meeting deadlines.
strong written, verbal communication and presentation skills

most companies try to meet expectations, dunnhumby exists to defy them. using big data, deep expertise and ai-driven platforms to decode the 21st century human experience – then redefine it in meaningful and surprising ways that put customers first. across digital, mobile and retail. for brands like tesco, coca-cola, procter & gamble and pepsico.

we are looking for a tesco education lead to join the team dunnhumby uk retail team

what we expect from you
• deliver data literacy capability building into tesco
• support the dunnhumby uk retail team on their training needs with tesco, including upskilling in our tools and processes
• capture and communicate value of education; respond and refine delivery and content to always improve customer satisfaction
• manage relationships with key stakeholders in tesco’s central learning, customer & people capability
• work in partnership with dh tesco team to identify new and changing capability requirements within tesco, support design of new content, pilot and roll out
• build profile and commercial opportunities of education in uk and global business

what you can expect from us

we won’t just meet your expectations. we’ll defy them. so you’ll enjoy the comprehensive rewards package you’d expect from a leading technology company. but also, a degree of personal flexibility you might not plus, thoughtful perks, like early finish friday and your birthday off.

you’ll also benefit from an investment in cutting-edge technology that reflects our global ambition. but with a nimble, small-business feel that gives you the freedom to play, experiment and learn.

and we don’t just talk about diversity and inclusion. we live it every day – with thriving networks including dh women’s network, dh proud, dh parents & carers, dh one and dh thrive as the living proof. everyone’s invited.

our approach to flexible working

at dunnhumby, we value and respect difference and are committed to building an inclusive culture by creating an environment where you can balance a successful career with your commitments and interests outside of work.

we believe that you will do your best at work if you have a work / life balance. some roles lend themselves to flexible options more than others, so if this is important to you please raise this with your recruiter, as we are open to discussing agile working opportunities during the hiring process

about the role

as a senior data analyst you will not only take on your own projects, often the most complex and challenging, but help to support and train other team members.

you will also be expected to participate in wider discussions and initiatives within technology, offering solutions to problems and helping to ensure tesco maximises the value of its data assets.

it would best suit a highly experienced analyst who is looking to gain the additional experience required to take their next step into management.

about the analytics team :

the analytics capabilities & optimisation team is a team of data analysts, bi experts, analytics engineers and product managers.

it is responsible for defining, prioritising and delivering the self-serve analytics strategy, event streaming and optimisation capability, methods and components for enabling real-time, data-driven decision making and customer data insight across all of tesco'

s businesses. it accelerates the self-serve delivery of ad-hoc insight from customer data and enhances the value of our analysis to the business and customers.

it connects the customer analytics and insight innovation needs of tesco's businesses to our core data platform, tools and services.

you will be responsible for

translate customer needs and business questions into detailed technical and functional requirements for analysis or self-service analytics.

then translate results back. actively question the commercial drivers of such requirements, the stakeholder objectives, and challenge the rationality of approach.
• analyse structured and unstructured data from customer transactions and business operations, then present insights and well-argued recommendations.
• build automated performance trackers and dashboards where appropriate, balancing business need with technical debt
• coach, train and support members of the team and be a role model for professionalism and best practice, deputising for analytics manager as and when required.
• challenge how we deliver analytics within tesco and offer ideas and solutions to improve and change
• work with the business and analytics community to expand the types of analytical approaches in areas such as automation, pattern analysis and clustering.
• develop close working relationships with stakeholders, effectively listening and understanding their needs and applying persuasive skills to influence and inspire others.
• write well-formed code supporting the development of big data-oriented solutions solving complete data integration or analytic use cases with the production-ready precision.
• actively contribute to our data dictionary and business reference materials, with documentation and articles demonstrating best practice and case studies.

you will need :
• a strong personal interest in data analytics, both in the execution, the technology and market trends
• deep understanding and extensive experience using database / datastore technologies, from traditional rdms solutions to nosql / distributed file systems.
• expertise querying massive datasets using a variety of sql dialects, with demonstrable understanding of query optimisation and relational modelling
• experience building and debugging complex data blending and preparation routines, either using scripting e.g. python and / or other data blending tools / languages.
• extensive experience and practice in the creation and implementation of data visualisation solutions, with solid awareness of data visualisation principles
• solid understanding of computer science principles (networks, software architecture)
• understanding of how to test, measure and validate your outputs. able to translate findings to non-technical audience.
• experience building etl pipelines
• experience coaching and developing more junior team members, both from a technical and personal skills perspective
• creativity, confidence, flexibility, ability to plan and organise, responsiveness, self-starter
• excellent interpersonal skills, a trusted advisor
• comfortable with ambiguity and able to navigate a fast moving, complex environment
• a natural planner looking ahead, raising issues, providing solutions and meeting deadlines.
• strong written, verbal communication and presentation skills

• holiday starting at 25 days plus a personal day (and bank holidays)

about the role

about the product analytics & optimisation team

the product analytics and experimentation team sits within the data & analytics directorate in the technology department. our mission is to deliver insightful and actionable data through reporting, analysis, and experimentation; with a focus on establishing best-practice processes and enabling data-driven decision making across all supported product teams. the tesco groceries & clubcard app and store self-checkout tills are amongst the digital products supported by our team.

everything is underpinned by our continuous drive for the best tools and technology to deliver our vision. we’re driving innovation and transforming our technology to become the world’s leading e-commerce business.

we need people who share our ambition to deliver for our customers; passionate and confident people willing to take the initiative and drive us forwards. in return we offer excitement, a great team, an excellent benefit package, and significant career development opportunities.

at tesco, you’ll find a world-class data environment with the tesco analytics platform – all of our analytics, sales and customer data in one place. our team offers unparalleled opportunities to gain fantastic big data analytics experience while working extremely closely with the key decision-makers in the business.

joining us means playing a part in defining, building and launching an ambitious roadmap of digital products that could affect the lives of millions of people over the years to come.

if that sounds exciting then we'd love to hear from you.

you will be responsible for

whilst specific responsibilities will be dependent upon the changing needs of the tesco business, the following provides an overview of the role’s key responsibilities and measures:
• collaborate with product managers and ux leads to identify and understand their data needs, and help translate business challenges into questions and analysis, in order to make product recommendations with colleagues and customers at the heart.
• help define business objectives/customer needs by capturing the right requirements from the right customers, and challenging assumptions.
• participate in and contribute to setting objectives and goals for the product teams you support and help measure these.
• perform deep-dive analyses using a variety of data-capture and mining tools (hadoop, alteryx, adobe analytics), and communicate findings and opportunities to product teams.
• create, maintain and automate monitoring and analysis dashboards using visualisation tools (tableau).
• create ad-hoc data visualisations following tesco best-practice.
• learn new analytics techniques and tools rapidly and put these skills into practice.
• following our business code of conduct and always acting with integrity and due diligence.

about us

our vision here at tesco is to become every customer's favourite way to shop online, whether they are at home, out shopping, on the move, anywhere in the world. our core purpose is ‘serving our customers, communities and planet a little better every day’.

our business was built with a simple mission – to be the champion for customers, helping them to enjoy a better quality of life and an easier way of living. this hasn't changed. customers want great products at great value which they can buy easily. it's our job to deliver this in the right way for them. in the uk, we serve some 66 shoppers every second, so it's our goal to ensure every one of those customers experiences just a little better service on each visit.

at tesco, inclusion means that everyone is welcome. everyone is treated fairly and with respect; by valuing individuality and uniqueness we create a sense of belonging. diversity and inclusion have always been at the heart of tesco. it is embedded in our values: we treat people how they want to be treated. we always want our colleagues to feel they can be themselves at work and we are committed to helping them be at their best.

across the tesco group we are building an inclusive workplace, a place to actively celebrate the cultures, personalities and preferences of our colleagues – who in turn help to build the success of our business and reflect the diversity of the communities we serve

about the role

at tesco, our data science team focuses on modelling complex business problems and deploying data products at scale. our work spans across multiple areas including physical stores, online, supply chain, marketing and clubcard, where we encourage rotation amongst our data scientists so they can gain expertise in different subjects.

we work on several domains and problem types: forecasting, online, pricing, security, fulfilment, distribution, property, iot and computer vision are just some. our team members are encouraged to allocate working hours for learning and personal development every week and are provided with multiple learning resources and tools. multiple academic collaborations enrich the team expertise; knowledge-sharing events are regular.

furthermore, we have got a great work-life balance, team days and relaxed but engaging culture.

as a senior data scientist you will mentor and support other team members and with our career framework you can either grow as either an individual contributor or as a manager.

you will be responsible for

this is a hands-on position where you will need to leverage your analytical mindset to find solutions to complex problems. as a data scientist, you will need to understand difficult business problems and prototype solutions with minimal support. apply, modify and design algorithms and mathematical models to solve business problems on top of big data architectures (hadoop, spark) is a core component of the role. our data scientists will need to be able to validate, document and present the modeling process and performances, as well as communicate complex solutions in a clear, understandable way to non-experts. data scientists are also responsible for promoting data science across tesco and promote tesco across the external data science community.

you will need

we are looking for ambitious individuals with a mix of statistics, programming and machine learning skills. the role requires that you have an extensive background in machine learning and data mining. a track record in modifying and designing advanced algorithms and applying them to large data sets is essential.

an ideal candidate will have a scientific mentality with the ability to ask the right questions, as well as answer them. a strong numerical higher degree in a mathematical, scientific, engineering or computer science discipline is preferable, as well as a solid understanding of mathematics and statistical principles.

experience in one or more of the following fields is required: predictive modelling, operational research, deep learning and time series modelling. finally, strong programming experience (python is preferred).

asos is one of the uk’s top fashion and beauty destinations, expanding globally at a rapid pace. our values are to be authentic, brave and creative, and we live and breathe these in everything we do.

we believe fashion can make you look, feel and be your best and, with technology in our dna, we deliver the latest trends to our digital-obsessed 20-something market. our award-winning ai teams sit at the heart of our business. we deliver technical innovation and pioneer incredible solutions, which are crucial to our continued success. we’re extremely ambitious and thrive on the individuality of our amazing employees. our values encompass everything needed for our tech people to be the thought leaders of tomorrow.

about the role:

we are looking for data science managers to join our team and play a key role in helping asos provide the best shopping experience to our millions of customers. the role offers broad exposure to asos, requiring close collaboration with the wider asos tech community. you will be part of a highly innovative ai platform working alongside machine learning scientists and engineers and software/data engineers to solve difficult problems using our rich datasets (transactions, customer interactions, product photos and videos) and cutting-edge ai technology.

what you will be doing:
• serve a group of scientists as manager through hiring, coaching, mentoring, and career development
• build cohesive, high functioning cross-functional teams that thrive in a culture of trust, respect and inclusion
• ensure your teams are consistently and iteratively delivering high-impact, high quality work by continuously assessing their approach and their process maturity
• shape the future of data science within asos by defining and executing strategies to attract and retain top talent and push ai competencies forward
• develop learning curriculum for each career family and provide clarity for progression for each individuals
• increase asos ai visibility through partnership with academia and participation in leading conferences
• be part of our sizable engineering management group to share knowledge and drive organisational change and improvement
• give leadership to other efforts that fit your passion and asos needs in collaboration with other managers, engineers and/or scientists across asos tech

we’d like to meet someone with:
• passion for developing and growing people
• demonstrable experience in leading, managing and coaching scientists
• broad understanding of machine learning and data science delivery lifecycle
• strong knowledge of agile methodologies and frameworks
• passion for machine learning and ai
• proven experience working in a data science environment and building relationships with stakeholders and business leaders
• excellent communication and collaboration skills

company description

we're asos. we blend our flair for fashion with our love of cutting- edge technology, but more importantly were interested in how we can bring the best out of you.

we exist to give people the confidence to be whoever they want to be, and that goes for our people too. at asos, you're free to be your true self without judgment, and channel your creativity into a platform used by millions.

job description

want to help drive our data implementation across our web and apps, collaborate with our agile teams and insights & analytics team? did i hear a "hell yeah"?

every day is different, you'll have the opportunity to work on a vast number of initiatives across the web and apps domain. you'll help the teams with data implementation and also drive the roadmap of our data implementation.

what will you do?
• lead and define the best practices when it comes to tracking
• define the roadmap of our data implementation
• support other team member
• transform business requirements into technical specifications in line with guidelines specified by digital analytics team
• work with engineers in web and apps teams to implement tracking in ios, android apps and websites
• help with acceptance criteria and troubleshooting of analytics related issues and provide qa sign off for tech implementation
• provide subject matter expertise concerning the solution roadmap for tracking across business

we would like to meet someone with:
• good technical implementation aspects pertaining to adobe analytics
• good understanding of html, javascript, web tagging
• the ability to translate non-technical business requirements into clear analytics briefs
• some knowledge in data services area (integration, business intelligence, data science, data stewardship etc.)

qualifications
• hands on experience in adobe tracking, preparing technical specifications, helping engineers through implementation and testing
• 2 years of overall adobe analytics experience
• experience in defining and configuring processing rules within adobe, help prepare dashboards, reports etc.
• experience of defining tracking requirements to support the development of site features and functionality
• proven track record of working with various internal and external stakeholders
• strong quantitative, problem solving and analytical skills
• ability to work on multiple assignments in a fast-paced environment
• ideal candidate would have a good knowledge of industry best practices, be familiar with ecommerce / online retailing and how analytics helps drive better decision making.

additional information

what's in it for you?
• competitive salary, pension, and private medical care scheme
• performance related bonus
• flex benefits allowance - which you can chose to take as extra cash, or use towards other benefits
• 25 days paid annual leave + an extra day for your birthday
• employee discount (hello asos discount!)
• tech develops - our internal tech focussed skills development programme to focus on your personal growth as a technologist
• opportunity to represent asos at industry leading events
• opportunity to help shape and drive our de&i initiatives in tech (like our wit movement and diversity mentoring in tech)
• opportunity to make an impact from day one and work with the latest in cutting edge of technology

company description

the ultimate goal of the insight & analytics team at asos is to drive value from data. we partner with stakeholders to solve complex business problems by interrogating, interpreting and synthesising information about our customers, products, onsite experience and marketing, in light of market intelligence and strategic context to generate strategic insights. we ensure our decisions are focussed on fashion loving 20 somethings globally and support our short- and long-term financial targets. we love pushing the boundaries of our technical capabilities and championing a test and learn mindset. the asos customer is at the heart of everything we do.

job description

we are looking for a senior insight analyst to join asos's audience insight team and focus on understanding brand equity for asos and our different brands, understanding perceptions of comms campaigns and being a key partner to our brand strategy team.

what you'll be doing....
• running our brand equity tracking both from a stakeholder point of view and managing suppliers
• delving into brand equity data to identify insights to support teams across the business and combining these insights with other data sources (e.g. internal behavioural data) to give a full picture of asos's brand health
• monitoring and investigating any shifts in brand health over time
• understand perceptions and reaction
• running pre-testing of comms campaigns, both for asos and potentially for partner brands
• acting as key partner for our brand strategy team and supporting and facilitating their insight requirements
• implementing the roadmap for brand equity and brand health measurement. planning and delivering a research roadmap to support the brand strategy team.
• taking a data-driven approach, comfortable drawing conclusions from multiple data sources and aware of the biases associated with certain research techniques

qualifications

we'd love to meet someone with.....
• hands-on experience in brand equity measurement
• hands-on experience in research, comfortable both setting up primary research and analysing results
• experience of working with both implicit and explicit research techniques
• experience of brand and comms strategy and approaches
• experience working in an analytical role; manipulating data to deliver insight and actionable recommendations
• highly numerate with strong attention to detail and confident conducting statistical significance testing
• strong project management skills and proven ability to deliver research projects end to end
• experience in pulling together data from different sources to tell a compelling story
• strong communication, stakeholder management and collaboration skills
• highly numerate with strong attention to detail and confident around details such as statistical significance testing and weighting.
• proactive approach and enthusiasm for sharing ideas and driving them forward

additional information

what's in it for you?
• generous salary, bonus and pension matching
• great development programmes
• amazing offices and great culture
• 25 days holiday plus one extra day for your birthday
• subsidised gym and canteen
• huge staff discount and regular sample sales
• life insurance, medical care, cycle to work scheme
• and tonnes more...

company description

we're asos. we blend our flair for fashion with our love of cutting- edge technology, but more importantly were interested in how we can bring the best out of you.

we exist to give people the confidence to be whoever they want to be, and that goes for our people too. at asos, you're free to be your true self without judgment, and channel your creativity into a platform used by millions.

job description

what you will be doing:
• work with the product manager, the data scientists and various business stakeholders to identify and define the business problem and business case
• elicit, analyse, validate, consolidate, and prioritise the high-level requirements using appropriate definition techniques
• communicate the specifications using appropriate documentation and modelling techniques
• collect and validate the non-functional requirements, including performance, implementation design, usability, security & audit, and appropriate legislative requirements
• lead the refinement of the requirements and business solution definition, including acceptance criteria working closely with the key stakeholders
• collaborate with lead engineers and the product managers to plan post implementation assessments, benefits tracking and realisation – this includes supporting the business and ensuring that any defects or enhancement requests are well defined and prioritised appropriately
• work in an agile, cross functional team taking responsibility for delivering big data and machine learning products
• work with other teams within ai when required
• be part of our tech-wide business analysis community

qualifications

key skills and experience

essential
• experienced business analyst within a data centric context:
• significant experience of gathering and documenting high quality business requirements, interacting with business stakeholders through workshops, interviews & meetings, and written communication
• proven experience of working closely with business stakeholders and it teams to deliver robust and efficient solutions
• knowledge of rdbms, etl, big data, data warehouse technologies including nosql databases
• experience of data analysis and data profiling
• experience of producing data mappings from source to target
• understanding of big data technologies and data science concepts:
• experience with large datasets whether it is structured or unstructured data
• understanding of data lake, data preparation and feature generation concepts
• good understanding of statistics and basic understanding of machine learning and model creation
• experience of working with complex systems and apis

nice to have
• computer science, maths or similar degree
• iseb/bcs business analysis certification
• exposure to cloud platforms, notably microsoft azure
• experience in retail and/or e-commerce

additional information

what's in it for you?
• competitive salary, pension, and private medical care scheme
• performance related bonus
• flex benefits allowance - which you can chose to take as extra cash, or use towards other benefits
• 25 days paid annual leave + an extra day for your birthday
• employee discount (hello asos discount!)
• tech develops - our internal tech focussed skills development programme to focus on your personal growth as a technologist
• opportunity to represent asos at industry leading events
• opportunity to help shape and drive our de&i initiatives in tech (like our wit movement and diversity mentoring in tech)
• opportunity to make an impact from day one and work with the latest in cutting edge of technology

through our fashion with integrity strategy we are driving diversity, equity and inclusion across every aspect of asos and ensuring every asoser can be their authentic self at work. we want our people to be whoever they want to be, because we believe people who bring their best selves to work, do their best work.

job description:

we are currently a 32 strong team, split into four key areas – stock, non-stock, data and reporting. the accounts payable (ap) team is an important function that requires those with vision, the ability to deliver change, efficiency and of course results! this role is for a finance data analyst, working as part of the ap team, and reports into the ap reporting manager. the ap team is responsible for matching and payment of stock and non-stock invoices, managing supplier accounts and resolving any queries promptly and efficiently.

[ads1]
job responsibilities:
• assist ap teams with grni, feed or other clearances and write offs
• assist report development in power bi, dynamics and ssrs for ap
• identify data integrity issues and assisting data team when required
• super user for ap systems -oracle, instream etc
• running weekly reports -ap overdue, net positioning, poa v overdue, other
• updating weekly kpi dashboard
• month end ap ledger close and ap balance sheet reconciliations
• ownership of delete invoice process -reporting and assistance when necessary
• assist ap teams with grni, feed or other clearances and write offs
• point of contact between ap and finsys and logistics
• providing staff training and support for internal systems
• ad hoc project work
• other reporting and assistance as required by the business

job requirements:
• performance related bonus
• flex benefits allowance – which you can chose to take as extra cash, or use towards other benefits
• 25 days paid annual leave + an extra day for your birthday
• providing exceptional support to the ap reporting manager and the ap team as well as the wider business
• interrogating and analysing reports to see what the root cause analysis on any issues causing bottlenecks for ap
• cultivating and maintaining good internal business relationships
• employee discount (hello asos discount!)

qualification & experience:
• excellent communication skills with a natural ability to build strong relationships
• exceptional problem solving skills
• outstanding attention to detail
• ability to work in a fast-paced environment and adapt to rapid change
• takes initiative
• good ap and accounting experience
• experience working with stock ledgers
• experience of managing multiple critical paths
• excellent reporting and analytical skills
• accurate and logical approach to work
• great time management skills

company description

we're asos. we blend our flair for fashion with our love of cutting- edge technology, but more importantly were interested in how we can bring the best out of you.

we exist to give people the confidence to be whoever they want to be, and that goes for our people too. at asos, you're free to be your true self without judgment, and channel your creativity into a platform used by millions.

job description

asos is undertaking an exciting multi-year transformation programme, called asos reimagined, to enable our ambitious global growth plans. you will support the business change function who are responsible for enabling the successful delivery of the transformation and continuous improvement initiative through coaching, facilitating and helping to grow change capability across asos. the business change function comprises a tmo and an operational excellence centre of excellence which includes process excellence, business architecture, lean / agile and change management teams.

our senior insight analyst will be the key insight support and business partner of the operational excellence teams as well as being exposed to other key stakeholders across the business. you'll help them understand the asos customer better and the asos processes, including responding to the teams analytical requests.

you will be…

you will enjoy making a direct impact on the business and see your suggestions for strategic testing being implemented for a better experience for the customer. you will be a data-driven person who is confident using many different sources of data. you will enjoy being the go-to person for understanding customer behaviour and business change initiatives while also making a direct impact on this fast-growing business. the role will require you to work closely with the operational excellence teams and be their key insight sup-port and business partner. you will be responsible for guiding decision making and presenting information effectively to a wider range of stakeholders, including those with a non-analytical background. areas of focus include: optimising the order returns process; making changes to the asos supply chain; and improving stock management.

responsibilities include:
• profiling customer behaviour and demographics by market, to help stakeholders under-stand their audience and plan activity accordingly.
• understand different types of customer behaviour through building statistical models for segmentation and propensity analysis.
• developing and training the operational excellence team to work with insight team and effectively embed within that business area.
• championing a test and learn approach with stakeholders, helping to define testing roadmaps, structuring a/b and multivariate tests, then drawing insight and recommendations from results.
• working with other customer insight functions in the team (marketing, customer research, market intelligence) to enhance our knowledge of the customer and combine insight into one aligned story for the business.
• work with data teams to ensure we are using the most accurate and relevant data for our insight.
• proactively bringing new ideas to the table relating to business questions, analytics approaches, datasets and ways of working.
• respond to ad hoc data requests as required whilst ensuring we are enabling the business to self-serve where possible.
• developing an expertise of testing/optimisation best practices and using this knowledge to advocate testing across the business

qualifications
• a degree or equivalent in a relevant quantitative discipline (computer science, mathematics, finance or economics)
• experience supporting change and transformation programmes/teams
• knowledge and day to day use of sql essential
• interest in programming languages (python, r)
• use of data visualisation tools is desirable (power bi, tableau), but not essential
• a strong analytical approach with excellent knowledge of excel and powerpoint
• a passion for data analysis and problem solving
• a proactive and flexible approach
• quality, accuracy and attention to detail are critical
• ability to work under own initiative, effectively prioritise workload and thrive in a fast-paced environment
• strong communication skills, and a good team player

additional information

what's in it for you
• competitive salary, pension, and private medical care scheme
• performance related bonus
• flex benefits allowance - which you can chose to take as extra cash, or use towards other benefits
• 25 days paid annual leave + an extra day for your birthday
• employee discount (hello asos discount!)

company description

we're asos. we blend our flair for fashion with our love of cutting- edge technology, but more importantly were interested in how we can bring the best out of you.

we exist to give people the confidence to be whoever they want to be, and that goes for our people too. at asos, you're free to be your true self without judgment, and channel your creativity into a platform used by millions.

job description

asos is a unique and forward-thinking organisation which understands how data and technology drives its business forward. the data, analytics and ai architecture team is on a mission; empowering asos to be the best it can be by driving sustainable competitive advantage through innovative use of data, information and insights. your expertise will be invaluable, architecting and delivering the right solutions to enable asos to become truly data and insights driven.

the role is within a collaborative team who work across the broad data analytics and ai estate. this can provide the opportunity to touch upon traditional and modern approaches and technologies ranging from end user reporting through to ai and ml. we are seeking an individual who will relish the opportunity to work across this diverse spectrum in a cloud-first environment but who can bring an immediate experience of data warehousing and related approaches to complement the team.

what you will be doing:
• collaborate with the data, analytics and ai architecture team to help continually shape and evolve the existing strategy and architecture to meet changing business demands.
• provide architecture leadership, assurance and direction to analytics implementation teams.
• work with multidisciplined teams inside and outside of asos tech to understand the requirements needed for the data stored across the asos estate.
• work with engineering team leads to set and maintain standards and development practices that aid high delivery cadence without impeding robust, scalable and quality solutions.
• assist in ensuring the smooth delivery of products, solutions and initiatives that empower the organisation to obtain greater value from its investments.
• work with the wider architecture community to continually improve upon data analytics awareness and appreciation.
• collaborate with the immediate data, analytics and ai architecture team to help evolve a centre of excellence whose aim is to continually improve our capabilities to support implementation teams deliver world class software.
• assist with creating a fluid, end-to-end vision for how data flows through the organisation.
• be an ambassador for the technical capability of asos tech both internally and externally.

qualifications

what you will need:
• in depth experience as an architect who lives and breathes data analytics and an ambition to take this best practice and use it in a dynamic environment while making waves in the industry.
• you'll also have the following:
• good analytical and problem-solving skills.
• broad expertise in the design and delivery of advanced analytics and business intelligence use cases and solutions.
• excellent communication skills and a diplomatic nature.
• highly collaborative and open working style.
• commitment to provide a high level of customer service to internal and external users.
• ability to work upon parallel projects to a high standard.
• proven experience in the successful delivery and ongoing maintenance of complex, high volume, high performing and high-quality software systems.
• working knowledge of big data implementations and associated issues.
• experience of implementing/supporting cloud-based solutions.
• in-depth knowledge in most of the following technologies:
• azure data related technologies such as sql data warehouse/synapse, azure sql database, azure cosmos db, azure data lake and analysis services.
• apache spark and/or databricks.
• expertise with microstrategy, power bi, or another major end-user reporting and/or visualisation platform.

in-depth knowledge of most of the following architectures, concepts and activities:
• data warehouse, lake, lakehouse, mesh.
• data visualisation, reporting, business intelligence.
• self-service analytics.
• batch and streaming data.
• etl and elt.
• data governance and security.
• data modelling.
• partitioning and data compression.
• relational and nosql.

additional information

what's in it for you?
• competitive salary, pension, and private medical care scheme
• performance related bonus
• flex benefits allowance - which you can chose to take as extra cash, or use towards other benefits
• 25 days paid annual leave + an extra day for your birthday
• employee discount (hello asos discount!)
• tech develops - our internal tech focussed skills development programme to focus on your personal growth as a technologist
• opportunity to represent asos at industry leading events
• opportunity to help shape and drive our de&i initiatives in tech (like our wit movement and diversity mentoring in tech)
• opportunity to make an impact from day one and work with the latest in cutting edge of technology

posted: may 12, 2022

weekly hours: 35

role number:200377407

we are seeking a world-class data engineer to join the data engineering team within apple media products. amp (home to apple music, app store, itunes and other services that millions of customers use every single day) has some of the most compelling data in the world. we are looking for a talented engineer who is motivated by meaningful problems and well versed with big data technologies. this is a rare opportunity to join a focused team and work collaboratively with other groups to make a significant impact.

key qualifications
• languages: java or scala
• working knowledge on the following distributed data processing platforms: spark, hadoop
• great if you also know: kafka, java map reduce, python
• algorithms: you will be working on crafting new algorithms to process large scale data efficiently.
• we expect you to know: basic computer science algorithms, data structures and distributed algorithms to process and mine data
• great, but not required, if you also know about how to develop: graph, data classification and clustering algorithms in distributed environment
• good debugging, critical thinking, and communication skills
• knowledge in engineering machine learning, feature engineering systems is a plus.
• able to capture cross-functional requirements and translate them into practical engineering tasks
• bonus points for experience in the music space
• 3+ years of programming experience

description

as a member of the data engineering team, you will have significant responsibility and influence in crafting its future direction. this role is inherently cross-functional and the ideal candidate will work across disciplines. we are looking for someone with a love for data and ability to iterate quickly on all stages of data pipeline. this position involves working on a small team to develop large scale data pipelines and analytical solutions using bigdata technologies. successful candidates will have strong engineering skills and communication, as well as, a belief that data driven processes lead to phenomenal products. you will need to have a real passion for quality and an ability to understand complex systems. if this sounds like you, then we would love to hear from you.

education & experience

bachelors or masters degree in computer science, mathematics, or meaningful industry experience preferred

additional requirements
• apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. we also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. apple will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants

the people here at apple don’t just build products — they build the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. it’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that encourages the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. join apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it.

here you have a phenomenal opportunity to help build and evolve large-scale highly-available systems, with positions currently available as we grow our amazing london team.

key qualifications

key qualifications

• prior experience with big data technologies (hadoop, spark, etls, distributed systems)
• track record of implementing and maintaining highly scalable data systems and services
• experience working with micro-services architectures
• manage the data architecture, scheduling and production of data pipelines & solutions

description

description
you will be joining a small team responsible for developing and building solutions with a focus on leveraging anonymised data & machine automation to improve apple media products and services. you will bring your knowledge and expertise in data engineering to develop, architect and maintain large scale reliable data & machine learning pipelines.

this is your opportunity to help engineer highly visible global-scale data products with petabytes of data, supporting hundreds of millions of users. successful candidates will have strong engineering and interpersonal skills, as well as, a belief that data driven processes lead to phenomenal products.

you will need to have a real passion for quality and an ability to understand sophisticated systems. this role also includes a crucial thread of data privacy and security. this is a rare opportunity to join a focused team and work collaboratively with other groups to make a significant impact.

summary

the apple database technology group is looking for a software engineer with a passion for developing world class, highly scalable, and resilient database systems with a particular focus towards ensuring quality, performance, and correctness. particular areas of focus involve transaction and concurrency management, query language, planning and optimisation as well the design and development of custom storage, indexing, and search structures. we are a group of hard-working engineers that don multiples hats: coder, hacker, debugger, and most importantly, customer advocate. we are seeking someone who is passionate about working in an exciting environment with constantly evolving priorities. your background should be a good blend of design and hands-on development of software at scale. you are dedicated, motivated, and willing to switch context in a heartbeat. you are creative and inspired to invent new ways to analyse and build better products.

key qualifications

a solid understanding of relational databases, sql, and query planning and execution

strong experience in designing, developing, and testing of large scale distributed systems

programming in java or other object oriented language required

extensive experience with java debugging and profiling

creative thinker and strong problem solver

strong technical experience on multiple platforms (os x, ios, etc.)

ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment

description

consider joining apple’s database technology group and help craft software which forms the foundation for some of our most exciting cloud services products. we are searching for a capable engineer who has an interest in database and scaleable systems development. in this highly visible position, you will collaborate with multi-functional engineering teams to define and implement some of the core backend platform frameworks and systems that will power next generation apple web services. we promote innovation and new technology to further improve our creative output. we're looking for creative and passionate people to help us bring our visions to fruition.

additional requirements

apple media products is the team behind the app store, apple music, apple tv+, apple arcade, and many other high profile products on iphone, ipad, mac and appletv. our engineering team is looking for talented, performance-savvy, marketing operations specialists that can enable success of marketing and customer engagement programs by encouraging a close working relationship between business and engineering teams.

key qualifications

key qualifications
• experience in retention/lifecycle marketing (mobile marketing automation, crm operations, exposure to campaign tools, email service providers)
• solid understanding of technology (rest api responses, data types, databases)
• proven ability to build relationships and engage with cross-functional teams
• passion for learning new technologies
• experience integrating sdks of mobile marketing automation tools such as braze, localytics, swrve, sfmc. candidate will be responsible for migrating apple services onto internal marketing technology.

description

description
